loans.name: Aidee Maria

texts.es:
Hace tres años a Aydee se le ocurrió  preparar chicha de maíz y arroz,   pasabocas derivados de la harina de trigo  para fiestas y helados, fue así como muchos habitantes del  barrio  Simón Bolívar, empezaron a solicitar estos servicios y a reconocer el negocio, constituyéndose de esta manera en  la primera clientela de Aydee, que le facilitó agregar otros negocio como el de venta de lencería  mediante catálogos y ahora emprendió su café internet. Ella vende de contado y a crédito, su sistema de ventas de servicios de internet lo hace con el dinero en la mano y la mercancía la financia en su mayor parte  en la ciudad de Santa Marta, a 1 hora de Soledad, donde viaja quincenalmente y también la  distribuye en Barranquilla, pero tiene muchos deseos de expandirse a las poblaciones de los alrededores de esta ciudad. 
Aydee inició el negocio de internet con su esposo y con él tiene muchas metas,  como el de sacar a su familia adelante pues tienen 2 hijos en las edades de 4 y 7 años, con los que sueñan en verlos convertidos en profesionales exitosos. Su mayor desafío es atender en su negocio todos los avances tecnológicos que amerite cada momento,  para capturar los clientes mas jóvenes que es un potencial importante para el buen desempeño de su mercado y también cumplir una función educadora en el tema de tecnologías modernas,  porque con su microempresa daría  acceso a las comunidades mas pobres. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él adecuará su local donde está ubicado su café internet, para hacerlo mucho mas confortable al estar de sus clientes, teniendo en cuenta que se acercan las vacaciones escolares y Aydee quiere ver su microempresa con una ocupación de sus computadores del 100%.
texts.en:
Three years ago Aydee decided to start making rice and corn 'chicha' (a soft drink), wheat-flour-based snacks for fiestas and ice cream. Many residents of Simón Bolívar neighborhood started to request these services and recognize her business.  They became Aydee's first customers.  This made it possible for her to start up other businesses such as the sale of lingerie from catalogs and now her own Internet café.  She sells her goods for cash or on credit.  Her sales system for Internet services is cash in hand.  Her goods are sold mainly in the city of Santa Marta which is one hour from Soledad.  She travels there every two weeks.  She also distributes to Barranquilla but has a great wish to expand to the towns around this city too.

Aydee started up her Internet business with her husband and the pair of them have many goals such as getting their family ahead since they have 2 children aged 4 and 7 and they dream of seeing them become successful professionals.  Her biggest challenge is keeping her equipment up to date with the latest technological advances in order to capture younger customers since they are really important for the successful performance of her business.  She would also like to fulfil an educational function in the area of modern technologies because with her small business she would give access to the poorest communities.

Her Kiva loan is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to adapt the premises of her Internet café, to make them much more comfortable for her customers, bearing in mind that the school holidays are approaching and Aydee would like to see her small business with her computer stations 100% occupied.

loans.use: To adapt the premises where she runs her Internet café to make them much more comfortable for her customers

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian vive en la zona de Cota Cota de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es comerciante, tiene una pequeña distribuidora de materiales de construcción
Es soltero.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (compra de cerámica).
Es la primea vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito podrá incrementar sus ingresos, y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristian lives in the Cota Cota zone of the city ciudad de La Paz. He is single.  He's also a merchant, with a small construction materials distribution business.  The loan will be used to purchase merchandise (ceramic tiles).

This is the first time he has requested a loan from Impro, and this loan will enable him to increase his income, and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy ceramic tiles for his construction material distribution business

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr.Fernando ; el tiene 52 años de edad y es casado y tiene 7 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de venta de combustible que lo transporta de Cusco a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado  , el socio trabaja de forma independiente , siendo este el único sustento para su familia . 

El socio solicita el préstamo para proveer de mas combustible

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Puntualito” that is found in the Cusco district, in Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is Mr. Fernando, 52, married and he has 7 children.  The member sells fuel that he transports from Cusco to the city of Puerto Maldonado.  He works for himself and he is the sole support of his family.

Fernando is requesting a loan to purchase more fuel.
He appreciates those who are part of his dream and he promises to make all the payments at the established time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase more fuel.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 47 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 13 and 20. All her children go to school. Her husband works as a home builder. Beatrice sells bridesmaid dresses. She has had this business for 13 years. 

She is requesting this loan to buy more bridesmaid dresses. She says that with the profit from this business she will pay school fees for her children and renovate her house as well. One day, she would like to own classic wedding dresses.

loans.use: To buy more wedding clothes to sell

loans.name: Narcisa Marcela

texts.es:
Narcisa de 38 años, vende productos Onnilife (empresa naturista y de venta de vitaminas) y también atiende una panadería familiar. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.  

Debido a la necesidad económica comenzó como vendedora de productos Onnilife  por catalogo para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. En la actualidad vende los productos recorriendo las calles y a sus vecinos o amigos y debido a que sus padres tienen una panadería pero ya no la pueden administrar debido a su edad ella decidió administrarla para ayudar a sus padres sin dejar de vender sus productos. Tiene una persona que la ayuda a hacer la masa del pan y a hornearlo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos naturales y materia prima para la panadería como harina, leche, huevos. En el futuro quiere incrementar su distribución de los productos y agrandar la panadería.
texts.en:
Narcisa is 38 years old and works selling Onnilife products (a company selling natural products and vitamins) and at her family's bakery.  She lives in an area outside the city called Paraíso, which is located in an area characterized by dirt roads and mountains.

Due to economic necessity, she began selling Onnilife products through a catalog to help with family expenses.  She currently sells the products in the street and to neighbors and friends.  Her parents have a bakery but because of their age, they were unable to run it.  Narcisa decided to run the bakery to help her parents, while continuing to sell her products.  She has an employee who helps make the bread dough and bake it.

With this loan, she would like to buy natural products, and raw materials for the bakery like flour, milk and eggs.  In the future, she would like to increase her product sales, and expand the bakery.

loans.use: Buy natural products for her mail order business and eggs and flour for her bakery

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a Kiambu-based dairy farmer who has been running his business since 2008. He supplies the milk he produces to milk-processing plants in his region. The market for his product is good and, as a result, he is doing well. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase animal feed. Samuel is a single father of two children who are in school. He describes himself as business-oriented and hopes to be successful in what he does. For extra income, Samuel runs a butcher shop in Kiambu.

loans.use: Buying animal feed

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of five and eighteen. All her children go to school. Her husband works as a farmer.  Grace sells cows. She has had this business for a period of fourteen years. 

She is requesting this loan to buy more cows to sell.  With the profit from this business she will buy a refrigerator. 

She says that her business is successful because it sustains the family needs and pays school fees for her children.  She would like to export cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old. She is married and has three children who are between three and seven years old. Her two older children go to school. 

Her husband is a motorcyclist.  Josephine sells beans and sorghum. She has been in this business for about two years.  She needs this loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. 

When her business makes profit she will renovate her house, and hopes to also buy a motorbike from that profit. She says that her business is successful because it facilitates her basic family needs. She would like to have a large stock of food stuff in the future.

loans.use: To buy beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Aburukundo Group

texts.en:
Beatha is 28 years old. She is married and has one child who is 3 years old. Her husband works as a driver. Beatha is the leader of the borrowing group called Aburukundo Group. Aburukundo means "People Full of Love" in the Kinyarwanda language. 

Group members sell different products and each has a market stall where they operate their daily businesses. Beatha owns a retail shop and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, sugar, and cosmetics. She has had this business for four years. 

She has requested a loan to buy more cooking oil and cosmetics to sell. With the profit from the business she will buy more items for sale. In the future she would like to import more items and distribute them to other business people in her area and beyond. In the photo, Beatha is seen in the middle of the group with a raised hand. 

The extra person in this photo does not belong to this group but is married to a man who is a member of this group. In an effort to support her husband, she decided to join him in the photo. She (the non-member) is sitting in the front row on the right hand side, wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: To buy more items such as cooking oil sugar and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Anita;   la socia tiene 33 años de edad, es casada estudio solo hasta la secundaria y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la artesanía ella compra y vende artesanía, también tiene como actividad la agricultura y ella compra y vende productos agrícolas, entre los que tiene papa, maíz, verduras. La socia realiza también algunas manualidades como aretes, collares y otros para vender en el área de artesanía. La socia desea el crédito para comprar mercadería de tipo artesanal y venderla. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería artesanal.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Anita is a member of the community bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" [The Friendship of Ollantaytambo], which is located in the Ollantaytambo district in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Anita is 33 years old, married, has two children, and went to school until high school.  She works creating and selling crafts, and also works buying and selling agricultural products like potatoes, corn, and vegetables.  She also makes earrings, necklaces, and other jewelry to sell in the craft market.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase craft products and sell them.  She is thankful for this loan and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase craft materials

loans.name: Lela Group

texts.en:
Betty D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Lela. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are between 14 and 20 years old. She is a college student. She describes herself as an earnest and hard-working woman. She cares for four siblings.

For two years she has been selling charcoal and water in the Elwa Community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 LRD portion of this 45,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of charcoal and sacs of water. Her goal is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and water for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 47-year-old dairy farmer. Her business is in Kiambu. She has been running this business since 1999. 

She has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to buy a dairy cow. This loan has been guaranteed by Jirani Mwema SHG. Elizabeth is married and is a mother to two young adults who are in school. She also supplies timber to earn extra income. 

Elizabeth describes herself as hard-working and business-oriented.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dativa is 27 years old. She is married and has two children who are between four and six years old. All her children are enrolled in school and she also cares for one orphan who is a dependent. Her husband is a farmer. 

Dativa sells a variety of items in her shop such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, paraffin, and cement. She has had this business for three years. With this loan she will buy more items like sugar, cement, and cooking oil to sell. 

Dativa says that her business is successful because she manages to get what is needed for the well-being of her family, and the profit from this business will be used to buy a plot of land where she will establish her business. She  hopes to be a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cement, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Bernilda

texts.es:
El negocio de Bernilda N., es mejorar la imagen personal y/o profesional de sus clientes mediante las técnicas de belleza que aplica a ellos  en su salón de belleza del barrio Villas del Carmen, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 14 y 17 años. Ella inició este negocio cuando aprendió a cortar cabello y practicaba esta tarea,  primero con familiares y muy buenas amigas y gradualmente extendió su servicio, aprendiendo las técnicas de manicure, pedicure, tratamientos de cabello y maquillaje, productos que hoy en día ofrece en su microempresa y con los que resalta la belleza de cada persona que compra los servicios que ella ofrece.
Este es el tercer financiamiento que  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace a Bernilda, organización que le ha apoyado su crecimiento personal y empresarial mediante servicios de formación empresarial y crédito,  para que ella pasara de las   tijeras y maquina  de corte, a todo lo que hoy tiene como infraestructura su negocio. Bernilda ha tenido un manejo ordenado y muy técnico de el, porque el aprendizaje producto de las capacitaciones, lo aplica y esto hace que cada día viva  mas enamorada de su negocio y de lo que mas le gusta ofrecer: Belleza para damas caballeros, jóvenes y niños, que son su  principal  mercado en el barrio donde vive,  y   de otros barrios a su alrededor que  también la buscan, porque sus clientes reales “han pasado la voz”,  de  la buena calidad de su trabajo. Con su credikiva, Bernilda se dispone a comprar productos de belleza como tintes, aliceres, pintauñas, limas, champús,  enjuague y gel todo esto en mayor volumen,  para obtener buenos descuentos y asegurarse que en estas fiestas de Diciembre no le falte nada en el momento de hacer su trabajo, porque sus clientes deben quedar bellos para celebrar en familia y para ir a las graduaciones y fiestas de sus amigos familiares o vecinos.
Su sueño mas adelante es construir la segunda planta de su vivienda, para independizar el negocio de su vida familiar y brindar un ambiente confortable a sus clientes y mayor tranquilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Bernilda N.'s business is to improve the personal and professional image of her customers with beauty techniques applied in her beauty salon in the Villas del Carmen neighborhood.  She lives there with her husband and her two children, age 14 and 17. 

She started this business when she learned to cut hair and practiced on her relatives and very good friends, and gradually extended her services.  She learned techniques for manicures, pedicures, hair treatments and makeup, which she offers in her business now and improves the beauty of everyone who buys the services she offers.

This is her third loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organization which has supported her personal and professional growth with business training services and loans, so that she has passed from scissors and cutting equipment to everything she has today as the infrastructure of her business.  

Bernilda has an organized and technical operation of her business because she applies her training and every day is more in love with her business and what she likes to offer: beauty for women, men, young people, and children.  Her primary market is the people in her neighborhood and in other neighborhoods nearby who have heard good things about the quality of her work from her customers. 

With her loan, Bernilda plans to purchase beauty products like dyes, straighteners, nail polish, nail files, shampoos, conditioners, and gel in a larger volume so she can get a better discount and make sure she has enough stock for the December holidays.  Her customers need to stay beautiful to celebrate with their families and to go to graduations and parties with their friends and neighbors.  

Her dream is to build a second floor of her home so she can separate her business from her family life and create a comfortable environment for her customers and more comfort for her family.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products like dyes, straighteners, nail polish, nail files, shampoos, conditioners, and gel in higher volume

loans.name: United Friends Group

texts.en:
Betty D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United Friends.  She is 40 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 1 and 23 years. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of financial support. All of her children are attending school. She cares for four siblings.

For 5 years, she has been selling charcoal and wool in Gbengba’s Town Community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of charcoal and wood. 

She describes herself as a very easy-going woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and wood for resale

loans.name: Ange

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ange client ayant deja recu le pret de HOPE, vient de finir avec son premier pret avec succes.
A l'octroi de son premier pret il avait achete des stocks de pagnes, des metrages et fournitures de couture pour faire des tenues, camisoles pour dames, des culottes et chemises pour hommes et des tenues scolaires pour les eleves , collegiens et lycee pret a porter qui ont ete bien vendus.
Ses ventes journalieres avaient largement augmentes, il avait des recettes de 50.000frs et 150.000 frs par jour, et en plus il n'a pas connu des difficultes pour rembourser son pret.

Avec le second pret , il compte renforcer le stock des tissus, metrages et son oublier l'achat d'une nouvelle machine a coudre pour elargir l'atelier  d'apprentissage de couture pour les jeunes filles meres  et  continuer dans le meme elan  en faisant des chemises, des camisoles avec des jupes, des robes pour fillettes, surtout que les fetes de fin d'annee et de la Noel s'approchent.
Le pret a eu un impact considerable dans sa vie familiale, ses enfants ont ete inscrits cette annee dans un college prive,et les conditions de vie de sa famille se sont nettement ameliorees.
Tres ouvert et pragmatique , il tient a aller au bout de ses ambitions en perseverant  a travailler toujours avec HOPE.
texts.en: Mr. B. just successfully paid off his first loan with HOPE.  Upon receiving his first loan, he bought a stock of pagnes (colorful West African cloth), fabric lengths and sewing supplies. He used these items to make ready-to-wear women's dresses and camisoles, men's pants and shirts, and school uniforms for middle and high school students that have sold well. His daily sales have increased substantially. He has revenues of 50,000 and 150,000 francs per day, and in addition, he has not experienced any difficulty repaying his loan. With the second loan, he intends to bolster his stock of fabrics and yardages as well as to buy a new sewing machine to expand the apprentice sewing workshop for young mothers.  He plans to continue making shirts, camisoles with skirts and dresses for girls with the same fervor, especially as the Christmas and year-end holidays are approaching.  The loan had a considerable impact on his family life.  This year his children were enrolled at a private middle school, and his family's living conditions have improved significantly. Very friendly and pragmatic, he wants to fulfill his ambitions while continuing to work with HOPE.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, pagnes, sewing supplies and a sewing machine

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Vilma; ella tiene 54 años de edad, separada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería  donde vende todo tipo de panes, pasteles, tortas, por medio de este negocio la socia saca a delante a sus hijos. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su panadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the community bank "Puntualito", which is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Vilma is 54 years old, separated, and has three children.  She balances her daily activities with work at a bakery, where she sells all types of bread, pastries, and cakes.  Her business allows her children to get ahead.

She is asking for this loan to improve her bakery.

She is thankful to everyone who will make her dream possible through this loan and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Improve her bakery

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy phone cards to sell

loans.name: Kambuga Bakyara Kwekamba Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
S. Mary is a hardworking and determined woman who has been running a retail shop in Kambuga Trading Centre for 10 years. In her shop, she sells general merchandise to her clients, most of whom are repeat customers. Mary is married with 5 children, all of whom are still in school. She is also involved in agriculture, selling most of her products from which she is able to earn 280,000 UGX all together.

Mary needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for her retail shop. She has a story to tell about her business. To start her business, she got a loan from a local Sacco and ever since, she never looked back until she joined Pearl, where things have continuously moved smoothly. Her dream is to have all her children attain higher education so that they become self-sustaining.

loans.use: to restock her shop with more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish and pig's feet

loans.name: Anet

texts.en:
Anet is 33 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of two and thirteen. All her children go to school. Her husband works as a security guard. Anet sells clothes and other items in her shop. She has been doing this for four years. 

She needs this loan to buy more clothes to sell, and with the profit from this business she will renovate her house. Anet says that her business is successful because she bought a plot of land and paid her children’s school fees. In the future she would like to be a sole distributor of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cartons of fish and meat

loans.name: Roberto Favian

texts.es: Para Roberto V. vender mercancía desde muy temprano siempre ha sido el pan de cada día, porque con este negocio ha logrado sostener su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos de 4 y 6 años, con quienes sueña verlos convertidos en unos profesionales exitosos, por eso no descansará trabajando hasta lograrlo. El inició vendiendo sillas, artículos de cocina y adornos, entre sus vecinos mas cercanos, y gradualmente se fue enfocando hacia el ramo de la juguetería,  electrodomésticos y está posicionado no solo en su barrio, sino en los alrededores de él, porque ya es muy conocido y lo buscan para hacerle pedidos, por eso  Roberto está aplicando a su credikiva, pues tiene encargado los juguetes de navidad de los hijos de sus clientes y electrodomésticos y también porque  está afanado por tener lo que sus clientes le encarguen; pues en estas fiestas de fin de año,  aunque en su recuperación de  cartera  la rotación aumenta, debe esperar hasta que le paguen las primas y bonificaciones a sus clientes para volver a comprar, de tal manera que este financiamiento lo oxigenaría mucho su negocios y facilitaría el  dar respuesta a sus compradores. Este es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el primero logró incrementar su inventario, sus ventas y por consiguiente obtuvo mayor utilidad. Su gran desfio es tener un local propio en un corredor comercial, que impulse  las ventas por sus condiciones específicas, para que sus esfuerzos se vean reflejados mas rapidamente y se vaya cumpliendo poco a poco sus metas de llevar a sus hijos a la universidad y brindarles un mejor estar a su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto V. has earned money selling merchandise for a long time, and this business supports his family, which consists of his wife, and two children who are 4 and 6 years old.  He dreams of his children being successful professionals, so he never stops working hard to achieve that dream.

He started out selling chairs, kitchen implements, and decorations to his neighbors and gradually became focused on selling toys and household appliances.  He now sells both in his neighborhood and the surrounding area because he is well known and people look for him to place orders.  

Roberto is applying for this loan because he has orders to fill for Christmas toys for the children of his customers and for home appliances and he is in a hurry to have those items.  Although in the recovery of his portfolio the rotation increases, he has to wait until he pays the premiums and discounts to his customers to return to shop, so this loan will stimulate his business and help him respond to his buyers.

This is the second loan he has received from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  With his first loan, he was able to increase his inventory and his sales, which earned him more income.  His biggest challenge is having a location for his business along the commercial corridor, which will boost sales because of its good location.  His efforts will get results more quickly so he can achieve his goal of sending his children to college and provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchase Christmas toys and household appliances ordered by his customers

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 30 years old, and is in the mechanical engineering industry. He offers vehicle repair services in a very competitive area of Nairobi. 

He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy spare parts for the lathe machine. His customers are motor vehicle owners and motor dealers. He was previously employed as a mechanic before starting his own business ten years ago. He hopes to buy more machines and open a large workshop in the future.  In five years, he believes he will have his own car. 

Since joining Faulu Kenya, he has become financially independent and he has learned how to save and live within his means.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for lathe machine

loans.name: Teofilo Alfredo

texts.es:
Teófilo de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.  Tiene una pequeña farmacia.

Hace 10 años uno de sus hijos trabajaba en una farmacia pero como Teofilo quería un negocio le pidió la ayuda de su hijo para que le enseñe todo sobre el negocio. Con un pequeño capital que tenía comenzó a comprar medicinas y alquilo un local para su farmacia. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días vendiendo remedio como apronax, relmez, ampollas etc. 
     
Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas como meloxicar, brocotocil, nemulabo expectorante etc. En el futuro quiere tener otra farmacia en otro sector y que la puedan administrar sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teófilo is 43 years old and lives in a suburban zone called Paraíso de la flor located in an area characterized by its dirt roads and mountains. He has a small pharmacy.

For the past 10 years, one of his children has worked in a pharmacy, but Teofilo wanted a business, so he asked his son to teach him about the business. With a little capital that he had he began to buy medicines and rented a place for his pharmacy. Currently he works from 7am to 9pm every day selling medicines such as apronax, relmez and ampollas. 

With this loan he wants to buy medicines such as meloxicar, brocotocil and nemulabo expectorante. In the future he wants to have another pharmacy in another location which his children can manage.

loans.use: Medicines

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Teresa, ella tiene 47 años de edad; casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como son arroz, azúcar, leche, la socia desea ampliar su negocio  .

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "PUNTUALITO". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 
The member is Mrs. Teresa and she is 47 years old. She is married and has 3 children. The member alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar and milk. The member wants her business to grow. 

The member is requesting a loan to set up her grocery store. 

The member thanks those who are helping her with this dream and she promises to complete her payments in the established installments.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to set up a grocery store.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel De Jesús tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general, hace mas de 12 años que tiene este negocio lo inicio por medio de su familia que le enseño este medio de vida, por lo que a él siempre le ha gustado trabajar. El se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, cosméticos, perfumes, artículos plásticos, sabanas, toallas entre otras cosas pues ha demostrado ser un joven muy emprendedor. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima que sus clientes le han solicitado ya que en esta temporada tiene bastantes pedidos.
texts.en: Manuel De Jesús has three young children and has been selling general merchandise for more than 12 years.  He started this business through his family, who taught him this line of work because he has always enjoyed working.  He sells clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, plastic items, sheets, and towels, among other things.  He’s proven to be a very entrepreneurial young man.  He will use the money from this loan to buy items that his customers have requested.  During this time of year he gets plenty of requests.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bread, beans, seasoning, cooking oil, pepper, salt, etc

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucia;   la socia tiene 79 años de edad, es viuda estudio y tiene 6 hijos, la socia se dedica a la agricultura ella tiene terrenos en su comunidad los cuales producen, maíz, papa, verduras ella suele vender sus productos en el mercado central de Ollantaytambo, La socia desea el crédito para comprar semillas para la nueva siembra. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas para sembrar.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO". The communal bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Lucia. She is 79 years old, a widow and has 6 children. The member works in agriculture. She has land in the community which produces corn, potatoes and vegetables, which she usually sells in the central market of Ollantaytambo. The member wants this loan to buy seeds for the new season.

The member appreciates and values this loan and she promises to fulfill the payments in the established installments.

loans.use: The member requests the loan to buy seeds to plant.

loans.name: Dorothe

texts.fr:
Femme tres entreprenante , vient de finir son premier  pret avec excellence,elle avait achete des cartons de vivres frais comme le poulet de chair ,les ailes de dinde, ailes de poulet, croupions de dinde; les cotes de porcs.
les ventes journalieres ont augmente de beaucoup 100.000frs a 250.000frs par jour et elle a beaucoup epargne, pour essayer d'aller vers l'avant.

Avec le nouveau pret, elle pense renforcer son capital en achetant les memes stocks de produits pour satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.
Elle va continuer avec Hope pour atteindre son objectif celui d'etre une femme d'affaire reputee.
texts.en:
Dorothe has a strong entrepreneurial spirit and has just finished her first loan with excellent results. She had bought crates of  fresh food like whole chickens. turkey wings, chicken wings, turkey pieces, and sides of pork. Her daily sales went up sharply, from 100,000 francs to 250,000 francs per day and she was able to save a lot of money in order to plan for the future. 

With the new loan, she will increase her capital by purchasing the same types of products to meet her customers' needs. She will stay with Hope in order to meet her goal - to be a business woman with a  strong reputation.

loans.use: To buy boxes of whole chickens, chicken thighs, fish.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chajabal Group

texts.es: Doña Lidia J., tiene 31 D. edad, casada, curso el quinto grado D. primaria, tiene 3 hijos, 2 varones y 1 nena, su esposo se dedica a la confección D. playeras y ella también se dedica a esta actividad productiva, ya que ellos confeccionan y luego lo entregan por mayor, cuenta ya con 10 años D. experiencia con esta actividad, y D. esta forma obtienen ganancias para cubrir los gastos familiares. Contando con deseos D. superación, entusiasmo y la ayuda D. unas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina Mujeres D. Chajabal, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes y tomando en cuenta el nombre D. la aldea. El Banco Comunal cuenta con 10 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar: la confección D. playeras, la crianza D. animales, venta D. Artículos D. Consumo Diario y ropas típicas.  El préstamo doña Lidia lo utilizará para compra D. Materia Prima, para la confección D. playeras, y D. esa forma incrementar su negocio, así generar más ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones D. vida personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Lidia J. is 31 years old, married, and completed a fifth graD. education.  She has three children, two boys and one girl.  Her husband makes and sells t-shirts and she works in this activity as well.  They have been manufacturing and delivering in quantity and have 10 years experience doing this.  In this way they are able to generate an income to cover the family expenses.

With a desire to get ahead, lots of enthusiasm, and with the help of some neighbors, they formed a group so that they could request a loan.  The communal bank is called, “Mujeres D. Chajabal” (Women of Chajabal).  The name was selected by all of the group’s members, taking into account the name of their neighborhood.

The communal bank has 10 members who are involved in different activities.  Among them are: t-shirt making, raising livestock, the sale of daily consumables, and typical clothing.  Lidia will use the money from this loan to buy supplies for making t-shirts, and in this way be able to increase her business.  In this way she will be able to increase her income and improve her own and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Shirley, ella tiene 36 años de edad; soltera   y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de hamburguesas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de cusco siendo su horario desde las 6:00pm hasta las 10:00pm. la socia desea ampliar su negocio  .

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más insumos para su pequeño negocio de hamburguesas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en: Shirley is a member of the “Puntualito” communal bank, located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.  She is 36 years old, single and has one son.   Her business is selling hamburgers from a mobile location in Cusco, from 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily.  She would like to expand her business and is asking for this loan so that she can buy more supplies for her small business.  She appreciates the people who are helping her achieve her dreams in this manner and is committed to repaying her loan within the established timetable.

loans.use: Supplies for her business

loans.name: Andreah

texts.en:
Andreah is a 33-year-old businessman who sells clothes in a very competitive area of Nairobi. His customers are mostly parents since he mainly deals in children's clothing. 

He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add stock of children's clothing.  He is also employed in an engineering company and was previously employed as a casual labourer.  

Andreah is married and is a father to three children who are in school. In five years time, Andreah wants to be an established businessman with several outlets in town and also diversify into real estate in the future. 

Since joining Faulu Kenya, Andreah has been financially empowered and has also developed a saving culture. He describes himself as a peace-loving and hard-working.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Romania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Romania;   la socia tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica a la agricultura como principal actividad y también tiene un bar restaurante y pollería, cuando es de día la socia atiende platos caseros y los vende como menú del día  a partir de las 4 de la tarde ella prende su horno y hace pollo a la brasa, por las noches expende bebidas alcohólicas, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y trabaja de lunes a sábados y es muy amable en su trato por lo que le va muy bien. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como aceite, pollos, papas, gas, leña entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos de cocina.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the comunal bank “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo,” or ‘The Friendship of Ollantaytambo.’ The comunal bank is located in the Ollantaytambo district of the Urubamba province and Cusco department. 

This member is Ms. Romania. She is 47, married, and has two children. She works in agriculture as her main occupation and also has a restaurant/bar and poultry shop. During the day, she prepares homemade dishes and sells them as a set meal. Starting at 4 pm, she lights her oven and makes pollo a la brasa, Peruvian roast chicken. At night she sells alcoholic drinks. She is a hardworking woman and works from Monday through Saturday. She is very pleasant in her endeavors, so everything goes very well. She needs the loan to purchase ingredients such as oil, chicken, potatoes, gas, and firewood. She requests the loan to purchase cooking ingredients. 

She is thankful for and values the loan provided through this means; likewise, she commits to making the loan payments in the stipulated time frame.

loans.use: To invest in cooking ingredients

loans.name: Dorotea Del Carmen

texts.es: Dorotea del Carmen tiene 61 años. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, verduras y maíz, hace más de 33 anos que se dedica a este negocio. Siempre le ha gustado trabajar Dorotea tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación, pues ha sido de gran provecho. Se levanta muy temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, por lo que sus clientes solicitan mucho el lo que es el maíz. Debido a esto es que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima  como frutas, verduras y maíz.
texts.en: Dorotea del Carmen is 61 years old and has been selling fruits, vegetables, and corn for more than 33 years.  She has always enjoyed working and Dorotea has been a Fundación client for a long time.  This has been very helpful to her.  She rises early every morning, and from 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM, her customers make many requests for merchandise, particularly corn.  She is asking for this loan so that she can invest in inventory, such as fruits, vegetables, and corn.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Kusi Killa Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Kusi Killa inicia su ciclo 8 con 13 socias. Gregoria tiene 49 años, es casada y madre D. 4 hijos, el mayor tiene 20 años y la ultima 10 años. Gregoria se dedica al venta D. abarrotes en General como son azúcar, arroz, leche, huevo, aceite, detergente, jabón, champú, sillao, etc., este negocio se encuentra en su misma casa y lño atienD. desD. hace 6 años, la única dificultad que ella tiene es cuando bajan sus ventas. El préstamo que solicita lo empleará en la compra D.: jabón, champú, sillao azúcar, arroz, leche y huevo.
Gregoria es socia D. Finca Perú desD. hace 1 año y medio, le gustan las capacitaciones que le imparte la promotora en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en: The Kusi Killa Communal Bank is starting its 8th loan cycle, with 13 members.  Gregoria is 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  Her oldest son is 20 years old and her youngest daughter is 10.  Gregoria sells groceries like sugar, rice, milk, eggs, oil, detergent, soap, shampoo, soy sauce, etc.  The business is located in her house and she has run it for 6 years.  The only difficulty she faces is when her sales fall.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy: soap, shampoo, soy sauce, sugar, rice, milk, and eggs.  Gregoria has been a member of Finca Perú for a year and a half  and she likes the the educational sessions the facilitator presents at her communal bank.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Hard Strikers Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Hard Strikers group. They are small-scale business women based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fudia B.. Fudia was born in Lunar, a small town in northern Sierra Leone, and is age 40. She is currently residing in Makeni City together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a footballer and her children are attending primary school. Fudia has been a businesswoman for seven years now. She sells cigarettes and liquors. With her share of this loan, she will buy cigarettes and hard drinks in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy cigarettes and hard drinks in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a 43-year-old businessman, is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add stocks of charcoal and firewood. He sells charcoal and firewood in Kiambu and to neighbourhood residents. He also practices farming and plumbing to earn more income. 

A married father of four, Joseph plans to be a large scale distributor of charcoal and firewood in five years time. His business has improved greatly since joining Faulu Kenya and he describes himself as very determined.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and firewood for resale

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.fr:
Client tres exemplaire ayant fini son premier cycle avec succes, avec une epargne considerable avait pour son premier pret fait tourner sa boucherie avec beaucoup d'enthousiasme.
Il avait achete des cartons de vivre frais , de la volaille , cartons de tripes et touts ce dont il a besoin pour faire fonctionner sa boucherie.
Ses ventes ont ete tres considerable, par jour il vendait 150.000frs a 350.000frs par jour.
Petit a petit il a commence a faire la vente en gros des ses produits.

Avec le second pret, il veut continuer dans le meme sens , jusqu'a ce qu'il atteigne son objectif, n'etant pas encore marie, il est entrain d'economiser pour preparer a prendre sa fiancee en mariage.
texts.en:
This exemplary member has successfully completed his first loan cycle. He ran his butcher shop with considerable savings and great enthusiasm, having purchased cartons of fresh food, poultry, tripe, and whatever else was needed to supply the business. 

He earned substantial revenues, averaging 150,000 to 350,000 francs per day. Gradually, he started selling his products wholesale.

He wants to use his second loan to maintain this level of success until he reaches his goal. Being single, he is saving his money to marry his fiancee.

loans.use: To buy cartons of chicken legs, broiler chicken, meat, tripe, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Alberto;  tiene 43 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de venta de comida quien conjuntamente trabaja con su esposa en este negocio, a su vez  el socio trabaja  en el sector turismo con su carro, transportando a los turistas a sus respectivos tours. 
 
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz y carnes.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Alberto belongs to the “Puntualito” community bank which is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province and Cusco department. 

Alberto is 43, married, and has 6 children. He has a business of food sales and works together with his wife in the business. He also works in the tourism sector with his car, transporting tourists to their respective tours. 

He requests the loan to purchase cooking products such as rice and meats.

Alberto is thankful to those who take part in his dream by funding the loan, and he commits to making the loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: To purchase cooking products such as rice and meats

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fabiana; La socia tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica a la administración de su tienda abarrotes, la socia desea invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para implementar su tienda abarrotes, ella tiene su tienda en el primer piso de su vivienda y trabaja con el apoyo de sus hijos. La socia comprará fideos, leche, arroz, azúcar al por mayor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" which translates to "The Friendship of Ollantaytambo". The community bank is located in the Ollantaytambo district which belongs to the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. 

The member's name is Fabiana. She is 51 years old, is married and has three children. Her business is managing her grocery store. She wants to invest in purchasing staples for her grocery store. She has her store in the first floor of her home and she works with the help of her children. She will buy pasta, milk and sugar wholesale. 

The member is thankful for and values the loan granted through this medium and agrees to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: Invest in purchasing staples to sell at her grocery store.

loans.name: Candido Arsenio

texts.es: El Señor Cándido Arsenio de 38 años está casado desde hace mucho tiempo y con ella tiene 4 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su negocio lo inicio de manera ambulante obteniendo la mercadería de diferentes departamentos y lugares y más tarde fue que se estableció en el mercado en donde obtendría ofrecer nuevos clientes  de esta manera es que llevara el sustento diario a su hogar, ya que vende de contado y al crédito a sus mejores clientes.Solicita este préstamo para la compra de celulares, accesorios, entre otros. Ya que tiene varios pedidos para de fin de año. La gente le solicita los diferentes productos que el ofrece.
texts.en: Mr. Candido Arsenio is 38 years old and has been married for a long time. He has four young children that the cares for. He started his business as a street vendor and obtained his merchandise from different departments. Later, he established his business at the market where he was able to obtain new clients which is how he can provide for his family daily. He does cash sales and also offers credit to his best customers. He is requesting this loan to purchase cell phones, accessories and other products since he has several orders for the end of the year. People request the different products that he offers.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mirian Margarita

texts.es:
Miriam de 45 años, vende productos naturales y de uso personal en las zonas de Paraíso de la flor. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Hace 10 años ella vendía productos de belleza pero hace un año atrás como necesitaba más ingresos decidió vender productos naturales y cosméticos. Su trabajo lo realiza recorriendo las calles vendiendo sus productos por catalogo y tiene una estrategia de dar a crédito los productos cuando no tienen sus clientes para cancelar al instante. Vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, productos naturales de Herbalife desde muy temprano en la mañana sale a recorrer las calles. Una de las complicaciones al caminar por el sector son la lomas que tiene que subir para ir donde sus clientes. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería como perfumes, cremas, productos naturales para tener más variedad para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere ver a sus cuatro hijos graduarse y tener un local para sus productos.
texts.en:
Miriam is 45 years old and sells natural products and personal products in the area of Paraiso de la Flor. She lives in a periurban area called Paraiso de la Flor which is located in an area characterized by its dirt roads and mountains. 

She had been selling beauty products for 10 years but a year ago she decided to sell natural products and cosmetics because she needed more income. She does her work by walking the streets selling her products by catalog. She has a strategy of giving her clients credit when they cannot pay instantly. She sells perfumes, lotions, deodorants and Herbalife natural products and leaves early in the morning to cover the streets. One of the difficulties that she faces while walking in the area are the hills that she has to climb to reach her clients.  

With this loan she wants to purchase more merchandise such as perfumes, lotions and natural products so that she can provide a greater variety to her clients. in the future she would like to see her four children graduate and she would like to have a stall to sell her products.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, lotions and natural products.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 25 years old and in business. She runs a grocery store in a good business area where she sells kales, spinach, carrots, bananas, among other food products.  She is requesting a loan of Kes. 10,000 to purchase stock items such as carrots, kales and spinach. 

Janeth is a single mother of one child who goes to school. She was previously employed in a pharmacy before she started her own business. Janeth says she is determined to change her life.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale

loans.name: Jean Didier

texts.fr:
Client tres pragmatique et entreprenant, ayant fait preuve d'un remboursement constant durant le premier pret et a fait des grand efforts pour faire des epargnes considerables, a beneficie du second pret pour renforce son activite en achetent des lots de sacs de voyage, sacs a main pour homme et dames, des draps et tout articles dont les clients ont besoin.

L'impact a ete considerable, vu que ses ventes ont augmente de 80.000frs a 150.000frs par jour, et cela l'a permit a realise une partie de ses objectifs,faire le commerce en gros des produits divers .
Il a commence avec des voyages de Kinshasa pour aller acheter des sacs, valises et dras a des prix abordables. 
il tient toujours a ses engagements ; et il promet d'aller loin dans les affaires  avec Hope
texts.en:
A very pragmatic and enterprising client, Mr. B. has consistently repaid his first loan and made great efforts to save money.  He has used his second loan to strengthen his business by buying quantities of suitcases, men’s and women’s handbags, sheets, and other items his clients need.

The impact of the loan was considerable, with his sales growing from 80,000frs to 150,000frs per day.  He has been able to meet one of his goals, to sell various products in bulk.

Mr. B. began with trips to Kinshasa to buy bags, suitcases, and sheets at affordable prices.  He always keeps his engagements; he promises to go far in his dealings with Hope.

loans.use: Strengthening business by purchasing suitcases, handbags, sheets

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a single mother of two. For a living, she runs Shiro’s caterers, where she sells food. As the breadwinner in her family, she is able to provide basic needs for her children and educate them. She is able to employ one person and she desires to grow her business and employ more people. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has been motivated to work hard and she sees hope in her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy utensils and energy-saving cookers (jikos).

loans.use: To buy utensils and energy-saving cookers

loans.name: Apolonio Jose

texts.es: Apolonio José tiene 42 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de comida. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a su hogar, que es donde está ubicado su negocio. Pues fue por iniciativa propia que comenzó a pesar de no tener mucho ingresos para su negocio siempre. Ya que es muy importante para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos menores de edad. el motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jugos y refrescos.
texts.en: Apolonio Jose is 42 years old and has a business selling food. He has had this business for more than seven years and the majority of his clients come to his home which is where his business is located. It was by his own initiative that he started this business in spite of not having a lot of income for his business. It is very important to him to raise his three young children. He is requesting this loan to purchase supplies such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, juices and soft drinks.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ernestina; La socia tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica a la artesanía la socia trabaja como empleada en un centro artesanal, ella se encarga de la venta de la mercadería, la socia trabaja todo el día incluyendo los sábados, ella está aprendiendo a realizar aretes en alambres de alpaca y con mostacillas, la socia desea comprar material para realizar sus aretes y poder venderlos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra materiales para realizar joyas en alambres.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" ["The Friendship of Ollantaytambo"] communal bank.  This communal bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, which is in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Ernestina.  She is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She works in the crafts business, as an employee at an artisan's center where she is in charge of selling the merchandise.  She works every day, including Saturdays, and is learning how to make earrings from alpaca wire and beads.  She would like to buy materials for making her earrings and to be able to sell them.  She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of materials for crafting earrings from wire.

Ernestina is grateful for and values the fact that she is being offered a loan in this manner, and she promises to comply with her repayments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making jewelery from alpaca wire

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. José Luis; el tiene 48  años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; el socio tiene un carro que lo adquirió con sus ahorros y  ahora el trabaja en una empresa de transporte público siendo su horario de trabajo desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm 
 
El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su  carro y así comprar repuestos para este mismo.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Puntualito". The bank is located in the district of Cusco which belongs to the Cusco province and department.
 
The member's name is Jose Luis, he is 48 years old, lives with his live-in partner and has four children. The member has a car which he bought with his savings. He works for a company that provides public transportation and works from 6:00 am until 9:00 pm. 
 
The member is requesting this loan to invest in the maintenance of his car and to buy spare parts for it. 

The member thanks those that are a part of his dream through this medium and he promises to make his loan payments in the time established.

loans.use: To pay for car maintenance and purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon, a 38 year old, runs an auto spare parts and hardware shop. He mainly sells car spare parts and paints. He started running the business in 2005 and he has experienced a good flow of customers.  

He says that through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to invest in shares and has developed a saving culture. He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale one in the future. He has requested a loan of 65,000 Kenyan shillings to buy spare parts and paints.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and paint

loans.name: Ciro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Ciro; el tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; el socio trabaja hace un par de años con su carro de forma independiente y  trabaja dando servicio de taxi. 
 
El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su  carro y así poder  comprar repuestos para este mismo.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Puntualito". The bank is located in the district of Cusco which belongs to the Cusco province and department. 

The member's name is Mr. Ciro. He is 47 years old, lives with his live-in partner and has three children. The member has been providing taxi services independently for a couple of years. 

The member is requesting this loan to invest in the maintenance of his car and to buy spare parts for it. 

The member thanks those that are a part of his dream through this medium and he promises to make the loan payments in the time established.

loans.use: To invest in the maintenance of his car and to buy spare parts for it.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.fr:
Cliente tres fidele , ayant fait preuve d'un remboursement constant et efficace durant le premier pret,
 elle tient a perseverer dans l'exercice de son activite .
Le premier pret a ete benefique pour cette cliente vu qu'elle a epargne beaucoup d'argent pour atteeindre son objectif, ses ventes ont accrus de de 30.000 a 65.000frs cfa
Pour le second pret elle va continuer dans le meme sens  en renforcant les produits de son etalage comme les cartons de lait , sucre, bonbons, 50kg de lait pour faire du yaourt, du sucre, de la farine et autre produits   
Elle est tres optimiste dans la realisation de ses objectifs, etre une femme d'affaire tres celebre d'ici cinq ans
texts.en:
Beatrice O. is a very loyal client who repaid her first loan consistently without difficulty.  She wants to continue operating her business. The first loan was beneficial to her given that she has saved a lot of money for reaching her goal and her sales increased from 30,000 to 65,000 CFA.
For the second loan, she will continue in the same direction, expanding the products in her stall such as cartons of milk, sugar, candy, 50 kg of milk to make yogurt, flour and other products.   She is very optimistic that she will achieve her goal to be a very successful business woman in five years

loans.use: To buy items for her business to bolster her stall

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doris; La socia tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica a la atención de su pequeño hospedaje situado en sus casa, la socia brinda el servicio de hospedaje a los turistas que llegan a la zona y también ella tienen sus terrenos en el cual produce maíz, papa, verduras. La socia desea el préstamo para poder implementar los desayunos en su hospedaje y dar mejor servicio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de frutas, gas, insumos.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doris M. S. is a member of the Communal Bank “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” [Ollantaytambo’s Friendship]. The bank is situated in the District of Ollantaytambo and is part of the Urubamba province in the Department of Cusco.

Mrs. M. is 42 years old, has three children and lives with her common-law husband. She has a small lodging in her house where she offers services to tourist visiting the area. She also plants corn, potatoes and vegetables on her land.

She requests the loan to be able to offer breakfast in her lodging thus providing better service to her costumers. She will use the loan to buy supplies, gas and fruits. Mrs. M. is grateful for and values the loan and she commits herself to make the payments within the specified time.

loans.use: to buy supplies, gas and fruits

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 52 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de cosa de horno. Hace más de 33 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y le gusta mucho realizar esta actividad. Santos se levanta todos los días para empezar su ardua labor, para conseguir más ingresos decidió invertir en los productos necesarios para la elaboración de las cosas de hornados. Con el préstamo quiere comprar leña, maíz, azúcar, bolsas entre otras cosas. En el futuro quiere ayudar a sus hijos que tengan una educación más digna.
texts.en: Santos is 52. Her job is the making and sales of 'cosa de horno' [a typical Nicaraguan pastry]. She has had this business for over 33 years. She is a very enterprising woman and she enjoys this work very much. Santos gets up every day to begin her day of arduous work. In order to make more income, she decided to invest in the necessary products for the making of ceramics. With this loan she wants to buy firewood, corn, sugar, and bags, among other items. In the future she wants to help her children to have a more decent education.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maintain Yourself Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Maintain Yourself” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and, consequently, improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. Fatmata is age 35. She was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and one of her children is attending primary school. For 10 years now, Fatmata has been selling body lotion, baby clothes, and underwear. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, baby clothes, and underwear in large quantity to add to her stock

loans.name: Eva Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Eva R. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pulpería desde hace varios años y vende productos de la canasta básica familiar. su pulperia esta ubicada en la colonia Simón Azcona frente a la Escuela Rafael Pineda Ponce, Eva administra muy bien su negocio ya que lo atiende personalmente,  de este negocio le ha dado la crianza a sus hijos ya que enviudo desde hace mas de 10 años y una vez faltándole su esposo lucho y siguió adelante con el fin de sacar adelante a sus hijos, su negocio es bien visitado por sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería para tener mas surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eva R. has had a general store for several years and sells staple goods. Her store is in the community Simon Azcona, in front of the school Rafael Pineda Ponce.
 
She manages her business very well because she does it personally and her costumers visit it regularly. It has been her household only source of income since she has been a widow for over 10 years. After her husband passed away, she continued to work hard to make sure her children are well provided for.  

The loan will be used to buy goods to stock up her store.

loans.use: To buy staple goods for her store,

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nora Yamilee

texts.es: Nora de 39 años, vive en la comarca san Rafael de mocorron. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ya que ella para ayudar con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a vender productos como ropa, cosméticos, lápiz labial entre otras cosas. En la actualidad desde muy temprano se levanta ara ofrecer sus diferentes productos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener cuartos de alquiler para tener más dinero para darles una mejor vida a sus tres hijos.
texts.en: Nora is 39 years old.  She lives in the San Rafael de Mocorron district.  She sells general goods.  As she wanted to help with her family expenses, she began selling products such as clothes, cosmetics, lipstick, etc.  She currently gets up very early to offer her different products for sale.  She would like to use the loan to buy products such as perfumes, creams and deodorants.  In the future, she would like to finish building her house and have rooms to rent so that she will have more money to provide her three children with a better future.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Roger Noel

texts.es: Roger Noel tiene 21 años. Es un hombre casado. Pero no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Roger es brindar el servicio de video juegos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que fue con capital propio, porque tenía la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia, su familia tiene muchas dificultades económicas, pero esto no impide que sea un hombre responsable y cariñoso con su familia, a pesar de las circunstancias él ha hecho de todo para salir adelante. Por lo que el dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de controles, discos y televisor. El deseo de Roger es mejorar sus ingresos para proporcionarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en: Roger Noel is 21 years old.  He is a married man but doesn't have any children.  Roger's business activity is providing video games services.  He set himself up with his own capital because he needed to generate income for his family.  His family has a lot of financial difficulties.  However, this doesn't stop him being a responsible man who is  loving towards his family.  In spite of his circumstances, he has done everything to succeed.  The money he is requesting will be used as working capital for the purchase of controllers, disks and a television.  Roger's wish is to improve his income so that his family can live in decent conditions.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Blanca Nidia

texts.es: Blanca Nidia tiene 43 años y tiene 2 hijas menores de edad a su cargo, ella es una madre soltera, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su hogar. Pues esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos en Fundación, ya que ha tenido varios créditos. Empezó con este negocio desde hace 9 años, empezó vendiendo ropa y zapatos en la calle de manera ambulante con una canasta, hasta  que  estableció una pulpería. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan detergente entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Blanca Nidia is 43 years old and has 2 daughters in her care.  She is a single mother and her business is a grocery store which is located in her home.  This is not the first time she has requested a loan from Fundación.  She has already had several loans from us.  She started this business 9 years ago.  She started out selling clothes and shoes in the street from a basket and did that until she set up her grocery store.  She is requesting this loan to buy candies, soft drinks and detergent among other products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani lives in a three-room brick house with her husband and three children. Her house is located in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is Pakistan’s second largest city and is known for its history and culture. She has lived there in an area named R-A Bazar for the past 11 years. 

Two of her children are enrolled in a school and are getting their education while the last one is only 3 years old. Her husband’s name is A. H. and he is a movie maker by profession. He offers his services at different occasions such as wedding ceremonies and birthday parties, etc.
 
Rani has proved herself as a great mother and housewife who not only takes care of her children very well but also made her house into a home with her good management skills. She is fond of cooking and cooks delicious and healthy food for her family. All the members of her family take care of her and respect her.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a digital movie camera that will help him provide his customers a better quality movie of their occasions. 

He has been doing this business for past 18 years and Rani is hopeful that after this investment, his business will improve further. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has built a good credit record and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds the book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Rani.

loans.use: To buy a digital movie camera for movie-making business

loans.name: Bertin Jonas

texts.fr:
BERTIN JONAS K.


La vente des sandales hommes, est son activité, il a ete parmi les meilleur des client en remboursement et en epargnant beaucoup.

 Le temps passe avec lui a permis de maitriser la gestion des activites generatrice de revenus, calculer le benefice,faire la gestion de stock.
Il a aussi augmenté son chiffre d’affaire car ses ventes journalières sont passées de15000f jour à 35000f jour.
Le prochain prêt va lui donner la possibilité d’acheter les sandales, les baskets  et enfants, les ceintures cuirs et cartable et sacs (hommes; dames et enfants).
Sa vie s’est améliorer, il s’est marié et son épouse attend un bébé.
texts.en:
Bertin Jonas Kihouloub’s business is the sale of men sandals. He is amongst the best customers for reimbursing his loans and has a lot of savings. 
As time passed he was able to master the management of income producing activities, to calculate a profit and manage his stock.
He has also increased his sales because his daily sales went from F15, 000 to F 35,000 per day.

The next loan will allow him to buy sandals, sneakers and children shoes along with leather belts, school bags and bags for men, women and children.

His life has improved, he got married and his wife is expecting a baby.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, sandals and bags.

loans.name: Saul Anibal

texts.es:
Saúl, se dedica a la fábrica de piñatas, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 8 años de edad, ellos residen en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel; él fabrica las piñatas con la colaboración de su esposa, ellos abastecen tiendas que se dedican a la venta de los preparativos para fiestas infantiles.
Saúl está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de papel, pegamento, colorantes y alambre, para fabricar las piñatas, estos materiales son la materia prima que el procesa para la fabricación de sus productos, él tiene un pedido de 500 piñatas pero no tiene el dinero que se necesita para los materiales por  lo que este préstamo le ayudara mucho para atender la demanda.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio y dar salida a todos los pedidos que se le presenten ya que son oportunidades de crecimiento para darse a conocer con más personas; él quiere progresar y dar a su hijo lo más necesario para que pueda crecer sano.
texts.en:
Saúl, who makes piñatas, lives with his wife and 8-year old son in the city and department of San Miguel. He makes the piñatas with the help of his wife. They stock stores that sell decorations for children's parties. 

Saúl is requesting a loan to buy paper, glue, dyes and wire to make the piñatas. These are the raw materials that he uses to make his products. He is currently working on a request for 500 piñatas but doesn't have the capital necessary to buy materials. This loan will help him fulfill the order. 

His goal is to improve his business and to be able complete any order that is placed, since each order is an opportunity to expand his customer base. Saúl wants to improve his life and to provide his son with what he needs to grow up healthy.

loans.use: Purchase of paper, glue, wire, and dyes

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” ubicado en el distrito Cabanilla,  provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil  viuda y tiene  08 hijos (04 dependientes), la señora tiene estudios hasta 4to de educación primaria.

Antonia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, el préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio venta de abarrotes y golosinas.
