Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá comprando golosinas y otros productos para su negocio.

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las charlas.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women) community bank which is located in the department of Puno.  She is 58 years old and is a widow.  She has 8 children (4 of whom are dependent on her).  She studied up to the fourth year of her primary education.

Antonia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling groceries and candies.

Now she is requesting a new loan for 700 nuevos soles which she will invest in buying candies and other products for her business.

Her dream is to improve her business.  What she likes most about her community bank are the talks.

loans.use: To buy candies and other products for her business

loans.name: Family Care Group

texts.en:
Mariama T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mariama was born in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. She is 29 years of age and married to a salaried worker. The couple has two children who are attending primary school. For seven years now, Mariama has been selling clothes, slippers, hair extensions, etc. 

This is the first loan that Mariama and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. Mariama will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy clothes, slippers, hair extensions, etc.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en: Adjowa Y. is a fish monger from Elmina. She is divorced and has six dependants. She ensures the welfare of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to provide a meaningful education for her dependants with the additional income.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Abrewa

texts.en: Abrewa M. is married and has six dependants. She sells used clothing in Elmina. Her husband is a mason. Abrewa uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Abrewa will use the loan to purchase more used clothing for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abrewa plans to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es:
el sr. Ramon P. cuenta con una tienda en la cual vende abarrotería en general denominada DESPENSA EL HOGAR. su negocio esta al servicio de la población del municipio de Las Trojes ofreciéndoles productos de la canasta básica familiar a los mejores precios del mercado, tanto al por mayor como al detalle, contando con mas de un año de experiencia en el manejo de esta actividad comercial, su negocio esta ubicado en la calle denominada del comercio lugar estratégico donde se ubica la mayor parte de los negocios de este municipio.       
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir bien su negocio, ya que la demanda de sus clientes es bastante. 
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Ramon P. has a store in which he sells general groceries.  His store is called “Despensa el Hogar” (Home Pantry)  His business serves the population of the town of Las Trojes, offering them products from the basic family shopping basket at the best prices on the market both wholesale and retail.  He has more than a year of experience in this business activity.  His business is located in a commercial street.  It is a strategic place where most of the businesses of the town are to be found.

He will use his loan to buy merchandise and thereby better stock his business since his customers' demand is quite high.

He needs the profits he makes to get his family ahead.

loans.use: To buy butter, rice, beans, flour, oil, margarine, salt, milk, soft drinks, sugar, bread, cookies, juice, soap, toilet paper, sanitary towels, candies, churros, soup and pasta

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is married to a trader and they live together with their six dependants. She is into the sale of foodstuffs such as cassava and plantain in Elmina, which she has been doing for the past ten years. Ama uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy extra foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy extra foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Sopiah

texts.en: Sopiah D. cooks food and travels around Elmina to sell it. She also sells cosmetics. She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a security man. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to put up a stall where she can sell her food.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook for sale

loans.name: Angela Marina

texts.es:
Ángela de 46 años, confecciona y cose ropa en su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Desde pequeña ella aprendió a coser porque su mama le enseño para que tenga una oportunidad de trabajar independientemente. A la edad de 20 años inicio cosiendo y confecciona ropa a sus vecinos y amigos poco a poco pudo comprar su propia máquina de coser y tener ya un numero definido de clientes. En la actualidad tienen su taller de costura y confección en su casa, trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 16h30pm de lunes a viernes haciendo ropa por pedido y enmendándola.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una máquina de coser porque la que tiene ya esta vieja. En el futuro quiere que sus cuatro hijos sean profesionales y tener una papelería en su casa.
texts.en:
Ángela is 46 years old.  She makes and sews clothes in her home.  She lives in a peri-urban area called Paraíso de la Flor.  It is located in a region which is characterized by its dirt roads and mountains.

She learned to sew when she was a little girl because her mom taught her so that she would have an opportunity to work independently.  At the age of 20, she began sewing and making clothes for her neighbors and friends.  Little by little she was able to buy her own sewing machine and have a clearly defined number of customers.  She currently has her sewing and dressmaking workshop in her home.  She works from 7.30am to 4.30pm from Monday to Friday, making clothes to order and mending them.

She would like to use her loan to buy a sewing machine since the one she has is already old.  In the future, she would like for her four children to be professionals and to have a stationery shop in her home.

loans.use: Sewing machine

loans.name: Cheena's Group

texts.en:
Cheena is married to G. M., who is a painter by profession and paints buildings and homes. He gets work from the house owners and building owners on a contract basis, and after completing the work he gets the full income. 

Cheena  is a very supportive lady by nature. She offers her cooking services to her neighboring families. She is a great cook and earns a reasonably good income from her work. 

She has given birth to 2 sons. Both are illiterate and work for a little income.  She lives with her family in the area named R-A Bazar, which is a residential area of Lahore. Lahore is Pakistan’s second largest city and is known for its history and culture. She has lived there in a 3-room brick house for the past 9 years. 

Cheena has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in purchasing paint boxes of different colors to offer better quality services to his clients. He has been doing this business for the past 8 years and Cheena is hopeful that this investment will be beneficial for his business and will make him good income. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Cheena.

loans.use: To buy paint for painting business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa K. is divorced and has five dependants. She sells foodstuffs such as cassava, plantain, and others in Elmina. She also sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and fish, which she has been doing for 15 years. Demand for her foodstuffs is increasing. She is asking for a loan to expand her business by purchasing other kinds of foodstuffs requested by her customers. Theresa uses her income to see to the well-being of her family. Theresa plans to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: To purchase other kinds of foodstuffs

loans.name: Walter Emmanuel

texts.es:
Walter reside en el Transito, departamento de San Miguel, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su abuelo y juntos trabajan el cultivo de maíz, su abuelo ha sido quien le ha enseñado a sembrar ellos tienen sus propios terrenos para realizar el trabajo y no tienen horario fijo.
Actualmente están preparando la tierra para hacer la siembra pero aun no han comprado los materiales que necesitan para el cuido de la milpa, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder adquirir abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para plagas, esto le ayudara para desarrollar una buena labor en el cultivo y de esta manera darle el mejor cuido para obtener una buena cosecha de maíz.
Él sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida para él como también para su abuelo, además desea tener una buena cosecha de esta siembra.
texts.en:
Walter lives in Transito, in the department of San Miguel. He is 21 years old, single, and lives with his grandfather. Together they farm maize. His grandfather taught him to farm; they own their farmland and have a flexible work schedule.

Currently, Walter is preparing the land for planting but he hasn't purchased the necessary supplies to take care of his crop. Thus, he is requesting a loan to buy manure, chemical fertilizers, and pesticides. These agricultural inputs will help him take care of his crop throughout the season and obtain a better maize yield at harvest.

Walter dreams of improving his and his grandfather's quality of life. He also hopes for a good harvest this season.

loans.use: Purchase of organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides.

loans.name: Apolinaria Teofila

texts.es:
Apolinaria es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” ubicado en el distrito de Cabanilla, provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 05 hijos (01 dependiente), la señora tiene estudios hasta 2do de educación primaria.

Apolinaria viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 meses, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para invertir en la compra de mercaderías para su negocio.

Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y educar a sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Apolinaria is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoas” (Triumphant Women) community bank, located in Cabanilla district, in Lampa province, in the department of Puno.  She is 54 years old, married and has 5 children (1 of whom is still dependent on her).  She studied up to the second year of her primary education.

Apolinaria has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 months.   Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her clothes-selling business.

She is now requesting a new loan for 800 nuevos soles which she will use to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her business.

Her dream is to improve her business and educate her children.  What she most likes about her community bank is the ease with which she can take out loans and what she earns on her savings.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise for her business

loans.name: Central Bo Road Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Central Bo Road” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Isatu F. K. is the leader of this group. The approximately 35-year-old is a widow and has six children, two of whom are still attending schools. Isatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells palm oil, rice, beans, fish, oranges, etc. With the help of this loan, Isatu is going to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current ones.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, beans, fish, oranges, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Pedro Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro   tiene 42 años de edad es separado tienen tres hijos ya mayores de edad  de 20, 18 y 16 años de edad, no viven con el ellos estan en la ciudad de Lima juntamente con su madre. El vive en la casa de su madre hace 5 años desde que se separo de su familia. El vive en barrio los acuaches en casa de material noble de un piso,  el se dedica  a prestar servico de trasnporte en vehiculo alquilado. El Sr. pedro aun tiene sueños que cumplir uno de ellos es poder tener su vehiculo propio. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en la renovacion de su licencia de conducir y otros gastos personales del mejoramiento de vivienda de su madre.
texts.en: Pedro is 42 years old.  He is separated and has three grown-up children aged 20, 18 and 16.  They do not live with him.  They live with their mother in the city of Lima.  He has lived in his mother's house for the last 5 years since he separated from his family.  He lives in Los Acuaches neighborhood in a one-level house made of solid construction materials.  He works providing transport services in a rented vehicle.  Pedro still has dreams he would like to fulfil.  One is to have his own vehicle.  With the money he is requesting, he will invest in renewing his drivers' license and cover other personal expenses incurred in improving his mother's home.

loans.use: To renew his drivers' license

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba W. is divorced and has six dependants. She smokes fish for sale in Elmina. She has been in the fish business for 12 years. Aba uses her income to ensure the welfare of her home. This loan will be used to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further her dependants’ education.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. is married and has seven dependants. Araba sells cooked banku (a local dish prepared from milled maize) and serves it with soup in Elmina. Her husband is a fisherman. Araba uses her income to assist her husband with the general upkeep of the home. Araba will use her loan to expand her banku business. She wishes to buy land with her additional income.

loans.use: To expand her banku business

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe Group

texts.es: El  grupo se llama “MARIA GUADALUPE” se encuentra ubicado en Metepec, Estado México. Está conformado por 11 integrantes, entre ellas está L. Sra. Apolonia ManueL. H. D. 43 años D. edad.ElL. tiene una tienda D. abarrotes desD. hace 10 años, tiene 2 hijas y 1 hijo, los cuales dependen económicamente D. elL. y su esposo, L. señora nos comenta que decidió iniciar su negocio por que los ingresos D. su esposo muchas veces no le alcanzaba para cubrir sus necesidades y las D. sus 3 hijos. Gracias a préstamos ha podido abrir su tienda, quiere este prestamo porque le sería D. gran ayuda para surtir más su tienda y comprar más mercancía para que se negocio siga creciendo.L. señora desea que su negocio tenga una estabilidad para que con ello pueda asegurar las carreras universitarias D. sus 2 hijas y D. su hijo que aun está en primaria.
texts.en: This group is called “Maria Guadalupe”.  It is located in Metepec, in the State of Mexico  There are 11 members, including Mrs Apolonia ManueL. H. who is 43 years old.  She has had a grocery store for 10 years.  She has 2 daughters and 1 son who are financially dependent on her and her husband.  She tells us that she decided to set up her business because her husband's income quite often didn't manage to cover their needs and those of their 3 children.  Thanks to loans, she was able to open her store.  She would like this loan because it would be a great help.  It would enable her to better stock her store and buy more merchandise so that her business can keep growing.  She would like her business to be achieve a level of stability so that she can guarantee the university studies of her 2 daughters and her son who is still in elementary school.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Eda Oralia

texts.es:
la sra. Eda C. cuenta con una pulpería en donde ofrece a su clientela productos de la canasta básica familiar, teniendo 9 años de experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de actividad ya que antes  de ir a vivir a Las Trojes tenia su negocio en la aldea de Maquingales donde a su vez tiene una finca de café, su negocio esta ubicado en la Terminal de buses de dicho municipio, lo que le permite tener muy buena clientela todo el año , con las ganancias que le genera este negocio le permiten satisfacer los gastos personales y cumplir con los compromisos del hogar. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería ya que por los momentos no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mas su pulperia y asi satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eda C. owns a general store where she offers her customers basic household goods. She has 9 years of experience in this type of work. Before she came to live in Las Trojes she also had a similar business in the village of Maquingales, where she had a coffee farm at the time. 

Her business is located in the municipal bus station of Las Trojes, which guarantees her a steady stream of customers all year. The income she earns from her business allows her to cover her personal and household expenses.

She will use the loan to buy products for her store, since she doesn't currently have enough working capital to stock her store and meet customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, bread, sugar, coffee, milk, bread, cookies, sodas, juice, lard, oil, soap, toilet paper, churros, sausages, cheese, soup, pasta, salt, condiments, seasonings, cereal, batteries, light bulbs, flashlights, matches.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Help You Sisters Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Help You Sisters” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Anita M. K.. Anita was born in Magburaka 40 years ago. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a teacher and her children are attending secondary school. Anita sells slippers/flip-flops and pork. She has been a businesswoman for four years now. With the help of this loan, Anita can expand her business by buying slippers and pork in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy slippers and pork in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras” ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. La señora estudio hasta primero de educación primaria.

Bertha viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 07 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de estructuras metálicas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo de  S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de materiales para su negocio de venta de estructuras metálicas, especialmente puertas y ventanas.
	
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar el negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of “Las Mensajeras” (The Messengers) community bank which is located in Juliaca district, in San Román province, in the department of Puno.  She is 34 years old and lives with her partner.  They have 3 children.  She studied up to the first year of her primary education.

Bertha has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 7 years.  She tells us that her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used it to increase the working capital of her business selling metal structures.

She is requesting a new loan for 800 nuevos soles and will invest it in the purchase of material for her business selling metal structures, especially doors and windows.

Her dream is to have more capital to improve her business.  What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings and the talks.

loans.use: To buy materials for making doors and windows

loans.name: Helder Wilvindert

texts.es:
Helder de 41 años, tiene una tienda de víveres. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Trabajo en una empresa de chofer pero como necesitaba más ingresos hace tres años atas con el dinero que le dieron al liquidarlo de chofer compro algunos víveres y con la ayuda de su esposa pudo ubicar una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad trabaja con su esposa desde las 06h30am atendiendo la tienda. En su tienda vende arroz, aceites, enlatados etc. Con ayuda de sus hijos también puede atender la tienda ellos al llega del colegio le ayudan. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como granos, enlatados para tener más variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere cambiar su tienda en otro sector para tener más clientela.
texts.en:
Helder is 41 years old.  He has a grocery store.  He lives in a peri-urban area called Paraíso de la Flor which is located in a region which is characterized by its dirt roads and mountains.

He used to work for a company as a driver but he needed more income so three years ago he used the money they gave him when he lost his job as a driver to buy some basic foodstuffs and with the help of his wife he set up a small store in the front part of his house.  He currently works with his wife from 6.30am serving in his store.  In his store he sells rice, oil, canned goods, etc.  His children also help him to serve in the store when they get home from school.

He will use this loan to buy foodstuffs such as grains and canned goods so that he has more variety in the products he offers.  In the future, he would like to have his store in another district so that he can have more customers.

loans.use: To buy canned goods and grains

loans.name: Betthia Ines

texts.es:
Bethia es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas de Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 03 hijos. La señora tiene grado de instrucción de secundaria completa.
Bethia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años, el primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de ganados menores, ahora está trabajando con el engorde de ganado vacuno. 
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante y progresar en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y las charlas.
texts.en:
Bethia is a member of the “Brisas de Rio Blanco” which is located in Pilcuyo district, in El Collao province, in the department of Puno.  She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children.  She completed her secondary education.

Bethia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for seven years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to buy young livestock.  She now works fattening cattle.

She is requesting a new loan for 3,000 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to be successful and make progress in her business.  What she most likes about her community bank is the punctuality and the talks.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Gabriel Francisco

texts.es:
el sr. Gabriel D. se dedica al comercio, pues vende verduras desde hace mas de 5 años, dicha actividad la realiza de forma ambulante en las diversas comunidades como ser Cifuentes, Cayantu, Río Arriba  Campamento, Las Quebradas, La Apertura, Arenales. su producto lo distribuye en el vehiculo de su hermana ya que su vehiculo esta lo esta reparando porque esta en mal estado, razón por la cual esta solicitando el credito para comprar unos repuestos y tambien unas verduras.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Gabriel D. has been a vegetable merchant for more than 5 years. He sells in various communities, such as Cifuentes, Cayantu, Río Arriba Campamento, Las Quebradas, La Apertura, and Arenales. He works from his sister's car because his car is being repaired. He's requesting this loan to buy spare parts and also vegetables. He needs the income to get himself and his family ahead.

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, cabbage, beets, and carrots

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cesar Silverio

texts.es: El Sr.Cesar tiene 43 años de edad, el es soltero cuenta con casa propia el cual heredo de su madre, el vive solo, en Av. Paris en el Distrito de La tinguiña, en casa de material de adobe de un piso. El se dedica  a la venta de ropa como ambulante en el mercado La Union, y los dias sabados y domingos como recorredor por los caserios de Ica. El Sr. Cesar viene realizando esta actividad hace 7 años. El cuenta con metas que cumplir como el de tener un negocio mucho mas amplio en lugar propio. Con el dinero que solicita sera para surtir su mercaderia para la campaña navideña que se aproxima.
texts.en: Cesar is 43 years old.  He is single and has his own home which he inherited from his mother.  He lives alone in La Tinguiña district in a one-level adobe house.  He works selling clothes as an itinerant salesman in La Unión market and also on Saturdays and Sundays around the villages of Ica.  Cesar has been in this business for 7 years.  He has goals which he would like to fulfil such as expanding his business and having his own premises for his business.  He will use the money he is requesting to stock his business with more merchandise for the Christmas period which is approaching.

loans.use: To stock his business for the Christmas period

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Sol Group

texts.es: La foto fue tomada en la tiendad de la Señora Leticia T. H. Una integrante del grupo Emprendedoras del sol, el cual está ubicado en la comunidad de Cañada Morelos, en el Estado de Puebla en México. Se ve el grupo al que pertenece y la mercancía que vende la señora Leticia, ella se dedica a atender esta pequeña tienda de abarrotes, negocio que inició hace diez años, solicita el prestamo para la compra de abarrotes y ampliación de su negocio. Sus clientes prefieren comprar con ella por que aparte de tener buenos precios tiene la amabilidad y atención que ellos requieren. Al momento de solicitar su crédito ella se siente contenta y agradecida por la confianza que la gente deposita sobre ella y sus compañeras. Tiene cuarenta años de edad y estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria es casada y tiene cuatro hijos dos mujeres y dos varones. Dentro de sus proyectos personales ella quiere seguir apoyando a que sus hijos concluyan sus estudios.
texts.en: The photo was taken in the store belonging to Leticia, one of the members of the group Emprendedoras del Sol, which is located in the community of Cañada Morelos, in the Mexican state of Puebla. The photo shows the group and the goods that Leticia sells. She runs this little grocery store and she started the business 10 years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy groceries and expand her store. Her customers prefer to buy from her because, apart from having good prices, she has the kindness and attention to their needs that they are looking for. At the moment of requesting the loan, she feels happy and grateful for the confidence that people are placing in her and her group members. She is 40 years old and completed the sixth grade of primary school. She is married and has 4 children, 2 female and 2 male. Through her personal projects, she wants to keep supporting her children so that they can complete their studies.

loans.use: To buy groceries and expand the business

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es socia del Banco Comunal “Bartolina Sisa”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de EL Collao,  Departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente con cuatro hijos y tiene grado de instrucción superior.
Betty viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra y venta de animales menores,  actualmente se dedica a la venta de utensilios de cocina como cucharas, platos, cuchillos y muchos otros. 
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá ampliar la mercadería de su negocio. 
Su sueño  es ser microempresaria. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la confianza y las facilidades del préstamo.
texts.en: Betty is a member of the Community Bank, "Bartolina Sisa”, located in the Ilava district, the Collao Province, in the state of Puno. She is 32 years old, married, and lives with four children. She studied through high school.  Betty has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. Her first loan she borrowed 300 Soles; money she invested in the buying and selling of young (small) animals. She currently sells kitchen utensils like spoons, plates, knives and other things. Betty is asking for a new loan to borrow 1,000 soles. The loan will enable her to broaden her merchandising base. Her dream is to one day become a successful small-businessness-owner. She likes the Community Bank's security and the ease of its lending services.

loans.use: Broaden the merchandise for her business

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a housewife, she stays at home and does her household work.  She has no child. She is a citizen of a city named Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan. Her house is located in the area named Akhter town, which is the small residential area of the city. 

Her husband, M. R., is a private entrepreneur and is involved in a fruit selling business. He buys fruits from the fruit markets at cheap rates and sells it on different streets of the town for good profit. 
 
Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits in bulk quantity to sell to his customers.  He has been doing this business for the past 10 years, and Zarina hopes that this loan investment will be profitable for his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application.  In previous loan years, she has proved herself a responsible loan user who paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zarina.

loans.use: To buy fruit in bulk for resale

loans.name: Guisella Ines

texts.es: La señora A. B. Guisella Ines, tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente tiene 3 hijos, vive en casa de familiar, con direccion Av. Moscu 660 La Tinguiña, casa de material noble de una planta. Se dedica a la venta de ropa como recorredora hace mas de un año..El señora tiene metas  trazadas y obejetivos, en futuro quiere tener su propio puesto comercial, con el credito piensa invertir en el negocio.
texts.en: Mrs. A. B. Guisella Ines, is 41 years old, and lives with her 3 children. She lives in a family home, at the address: Avenue Moscu 660 in La Tinguiña. Her house is made of noble plant materials. For more than one year, she's been selling a line of clothing. She has long- and short-term goals. In the future she wants to have her own business stand, and with the loan she plans to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in her clothing business

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con tres hijos. La señora tiene grado de instrucción de secundaria completa.
Blanca viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace diez años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de ropas.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar la mercadería  de su negocio. 
Su sueño  es ampliar su negocio. Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el compañerismo.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the “San Salvador” Communal Bank, located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 45, in a common law marriage, and has three children. She has a high school education. 

Blanca has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for ten years. Her initial loan was for 300.00 Peruvian nuevos soles, money that she invested in her clothes selling business. She is now requesting a loan for 2000.00 Peruvian nuevos soles, a loan that will allow her to increase the merchandise in her business. 
 
Her dream is to grow her business. What she likes best about her communal bank is the comeradery.

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her business

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a housewife and has no children. She is a very active lady, she spends her time at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife. 

She is married to R. A., who is a salesman by profession.  He supplies candies and biscuits to different general stores on order. He buys these items at wholesale prices and supplies them to different stores, generating good income on it.  

Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy candies & biscuits in larger quantities.  That will help him fulfill larger orders on time and earn more income.   Khursheed is hopeful that with the help of this loan investment, her husband’s business will improve and receive positive financial results. 

They live in a city named Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan. Their home is located in the area named Akhter town which is a small residential area of the city. 
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah. This is her 3rd loan application. She is a very responsible client who has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khursheed.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stocks of candies & biscusits

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.es:
Bonifacia es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito de Azángaro, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con 03 hijos. La señora realizó estudios de educación primaria.

Bonifacia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, su   primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de puertas y ventanas de metal.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en materiales para su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un taller más grande. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las capacitaciones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Bonifacia is a member of the "Azangarinas Valientes" communal bank located in Azángaro district, Azángaro province, Puno department.  She is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children.  She has a primary school education.

Bonifacia has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 3 years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles (PEN).  She used the money to increase the capital of her business selling metal doors and windows.

Now she is asking for a new loan of 500 nuevos soles.  She will invest the money in materials for her business.

Her dream is to have a bigger shop.  What she most likes about her communal bank are the trainings and the chats.

loans.use: To buy materials for the manufacture of doors and windows

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani lives in Borewala, which is a small city in the Punjab Province of Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived there in Akhter town with her family in a 2-room brick house for over many years. 

She is a house wife, and prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She has given birth to 2 sons and a daughter. She couldn’t provide them educational facilities due to financial constraints. Her elder son started driving a rickshaw on rent, while the other son stays at home and doesn't do anything.   Her daughter is only 6 years old, and Rani has plan to enroll her in school in the near future. 

Her husband is also a driver by trade. He runs a rickshaw to provide transport services to his customers. He adopted this profession 3 years ago and people know him as a good driver. 

Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to repair his rickshaw because its engine is having problems and doesn’t work properly.  The loan amount will help him repair his rickshaw fully.   Rani is hopeful that this investment will help her husband keep his vehicle in better condition, and help him improve his services for his clients. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and has maintained a good credit record in every loan year. This is the fifth time she has applied for a loan. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rani.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brígida es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol” ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla, provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con dos  hijos y grado de instrucción de secundaria  completa.
Brígida tiene diferentes actividades a la que se dedica, entre ellos podemos mencionar, a la venta de abarrotes, venta de comida, este ultimo lo realiza solo sábado y domingo, además tiene un molino donde  hace molido de cebada, trigo, quinua,  morón  y otros. Ella  viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace diez años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual le sirvió para aumentar el capital de su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que invertirá en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Su sueño es comprar más maquinarias y tener una molinera más grande.
La señora nos cuenta que le gusta de todo del Banco Comunal como la puntualidad, responsabilidad y el compartir alegría.
texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the Community Bank, "Santiago Apóstol” located in the Paucarcolla District, Puno Province in the State of Puno. She is 32 years old, in a common-law marriage, with two children. She completed secondary school. 

Brígida does different activities, among them, she sells groceries and she food. The later she does only on Saturdays and Sundays. In addition she has a mill where she mills barley, wheat, quinoa, and chestnuts. She began working with the Manuela Ramos Movement 10 years ago. Her first loan she borrowed 300 soles, which was put toward increasing capital in her grocery business. 

Now she's asking for a loan of 1500 soles; and with that she will invest in her groceries business. Her dream is to buy more equipment and to have a larger mill. She tells us that she likes the Community Bank above all for its punctuality, responsibility and for imparting happiness.

loans.use: To invest in her grocery business

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her sons expand their fruit selling business. With the loan, they will buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell through their fruit shops. This will help them provide better quality fruits to their customers and earn more income. 

She lives with her family in a city named Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan. Her house is located in Akhter town where she moved 20 years ago with her family. 

She has 5 children. All of them are sons: three of them are involved in a fruit selling business while one is a painter and offers his services painting houses and buildings to his customers. Her youngest son is studying in 5th class.   She herself is a housewife and does her household responsibilities at home. 

This is the 5th time Jameela has applied for a loan. In previous loan years she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.  

She is hopeful that with the help of this loan investment, her sons will be able to improve their business, which will result in a better financial life for her family and she will be able to return the loan without any problem.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruits selling business

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim lives in Borewala. It is a small city in Punjab Pakistan, known for its shrines. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area named Akhter town. She moved here after her marriage.  

She is 50 years old, married to M. A. and has 3 sons. She couldn’t provide educational facilities to her children due to financial reasons. 

Her husband has a business selling fruits and is the only income earner in the family. He gets up early in the morning, puts the fruits on his cart and sells them by visiting different streets of the city. He has been doing this business few years now and has a good reputation among his customers.  

Shamim herself is a housewife, she stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very good mother as well and raises her children very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. Her husband will use the loan money to purchase fresh seasonal fruits in bulk quantity to resell.  She is hopeful that this investment will be profitable for her husband’s business and his income will increase.  She is a new loan applicant for Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook ) is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy fruit in bulk for resale

loans.name: Jehova Jireh Group

texts.es:
el grupo Jehova Jireh esta ubicado en la colonia Eben Ezer de la ciudad de Danli, lo integran 3 personas, un hombre y dos mujeres. ellos tienen mucho tiempo de conocerse y se establecieron como grupo para salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

el sr. Manuel de Jesus R. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de dulces, negocio que el lo ha nombrado “DULCES R.” su especialidad es la elaboración de dulces de banano, él a sabido ganarse la clientela por el buen sabor, tamaño y precio de los dulces que elabora.
sus dulces los vende a dueños de pulperías y mercaditos.
Don Manuel es casado y de principios cristianos, junto con su esposa sacan adelante su negocio, ya que ella le ayuda en la preparación de los dulces.
de su matrimonio ya solo dependen dos hijos y que actualmente están cursando sus estudios primarios.

la sra. Arcenia A. tiene más de 6 seis años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de Maíz, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación.
Ella se ha sabido ganar la clientela por el buen tamaño con que elabora las tortillas y por la higiene que muestra el lugar donde elabora su producto.
Sus clientes potenciales son los vecinos de la Col. Eben Ezer y la Col. Bella Vista ya que ella elabora las tortillas y las va a dejar a una pulpería, tambien vende en su casa de habitación y encargos que tiene permanente de otros clientes.
Doña Arcenia esta casada y es de buenos principios cristianos; su esposo se dedica a vender mercadería de manera ambulante y del matrimonio tienen 3 hijos los cuales dependen a un 100% y los tiene estudiando.

la sra. Gloria Marina F. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de Donas.
las elabora en su casa de habitación y sale a venderlas en dos fabricas de tabacos que se encuentran muy cerca de donde vive, siendo sus clientes potenciales los empleados de la misma.
Doña Gloria es madre soltera de tres hijos, aproximadamente 3 años se separo de su esposo quedando sola al cargo de la educación y crianza de sus hijos, mismos que a la fecha están cursando sus estudios primarios.
Doña gloria es una mujer de admirar,  trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Jehova Jireh group is located in the Eben Ezer neighborhood in the city of Danli.  It is comprised of three people, one man and two women.  They have known each other for a long time.  They set up their group in order to get ahead with their businesses and their families.  What follows are details about their different business activities.

Manuel de Jesus R.’s main activity is making and selling sweets.  He has named his business “Ducles R.” (Delicious Sweets).  His specialty is making sweets from bananas.  He has known how to win customers by the good taste, size, and price of the sweets that he makes.  He sells his sweets to the owners of small grocery stores and markets.

Manuel is married and of Christian principles.  Together, he and his wife get ahead in his business.  She helps with the preparation of the sweets.  They only have two dependent children who are in elementary school.

Arcenia A. has been making and selling corn tortillas for over six years.  She does this in her house.  She has known how to win customers by the good size of her tortillas and the hygiene that is apparent in the place where she makes her products.  Her potential customers are the neighbors in the Eben Ezer neighborhood and the Bella Vista neighborhood.  She makes the tortillas and then leaves them in a small grocery store.  She also sells from her home, and she has standing orders from other customers.

Arcenia is married and of Christian principles.  Her husband sells merchandise in an itinerant manner.  They have three children who are all in school.

Gloria F. makes and sells donuts.  She makes them at home, and she sells them at two tobacco factories that are very close to where she lives.  Her potential customers are the workers in the two factories.

Gloria is a single mother, and she has three children.  She separated from her husband approximately three years ago.  This left her alone to raise her children and to be in charge of their education.  The children are in elementary school.  Gloria is a woman to admire.  She works very hard to get her children ahead.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flavorings, bags, fruit, firewood, lime, corn, wheat flour, oil, shortening, and margarine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El señor Blas tiene 55 años de edad, está casado con la señora Celestina Delvalle de Cáceres quien tiene 48 años de edad. 
Ambos  nacidos en la ciudad de Itá, tienen 3 hijas que ya son independientes. 
Viven en un barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá donde posee una carpintería hace más de 18 años, allí fabrica y vende todo tipo de muebles como sillas, roperos, placares, mesas y cómodas, sus clientes en su mayoría son macateros (personas que venden artículos diversos en forma ambulante) de la zona y particulares. 
El señor Blas opera con la Fundación Paraguaya hace 4 años demostrando buen pago en sus préstamos cancelados, en esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de madera, ya que tiene varios pedidos de ropero y otros muebles. 
 El señor Blas manifiesta que el préstamo que solicita lo ayudará a satisfacer esa demanda de pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Blas is 55 years old, and he is married to 48 year old Celestina Delvalle de Cáceres.  They were both born in the city of Itá, and they have three daughters who are independent.  They live in a neighborhood very close to the center of the city of Itá.  That is where he has had a carpentry shop for over 18 years.

In his shop he makes and sells all types of furniture like chairs, wardrobes, cabinets, tables, and chests.  Most of his customers are “macateros” (people who sell diverse articles in an itinerant manner) from the area or private individuals.

Blas has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya for four years.  He has demonstrated good repayment of his loans.  He is requesting this loan in order to buy wood because he has several orders for wardrobes and other furniture.  Blas states that the requested loan will help him meet the demand from the orders that he has.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Ada Esmeralda

texts.es:
La Sra. Ada Rodríguez es Maestra de educación primaria Jubilada y su actividad principal es el comercio cuenta con una pulpería la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “El Estudiante”  desde hace 6 seis años, esta ubicada en su casa de habitación contiguo al Instituto Teodoro Rodas Valle “INTERVALLE” de la ciudad de Danlí.
La Sra. Rodríguez cuenta con bastantes clientes y especialmente por los estudiantes del centro educativo, ya que este colegio es privado y se a convertido en el de mejor aceptación de la población Danlidense y Paraiseña.- dicho centro educativo brinda las tres jornadas de clases.
Doña Ada cubre los gastos familiares con los ingresos que le genera su negocio y actualmente le esta cubriendo el estudio universitario a dos de sus tres hijos.
El crecimiento en su negocio es notable y sus condiciones de vida se ve que son favorables.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Ada Rodríguez is a retired elementary school teacher.  Her main business activity is a small grocery store, which operates under the name “El Estudiante” (The Student).  She has had this business for six years.  This business is in her house, which is adjacent to the Instituto Teodoro Rodas Valle “Intervalle” in the city of Danlí.

Ana has plenty of customers, especially the students from the educational center.  This school is private, and it has become the most popular school for those living in Danlidense and Paraiseña.  This educational center offers three academic sessions.

Ada covers the family expenses with the income that her business generates.  She is currently covering two of her three children’s university studies.  The growth of her business is notable, and her living conditions are good.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to better stock her business.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, juice, water, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, bread, cookies, margarine, shortening, oil, pasta, salsa, soup, toilet paper, sweets, salt, condiments, corn and wheat flour, glasses, sanitary napkins,  batteries, repellents, matches, candles and churros

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es:
La Señora Sixta de 58 años de edad es comerciante y está casada con el Señor Teófilo de 57 años de edad. 
Se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas hace 4 años, posee una clientela bien formada ya que tiene su local en su casa propia el cual es muy concurrido por la buena ubicación  que posee. Esta actividad lo realiza con su esposo. 
Solicita el préstamo para la ampliación de su local, ya que anteriormente vendía sus productos en la calle y desea construir un lugar  para que sus clientes se sientan a gusto y puedan saborear cómodamente las ricas comidas que Sixta les prepara a diario. 
Sixta ha operado en varias oportunidades con la Fundación Paraguaya cumpliendo en forma puntual con el pago de sus compromisos, es por eso que desea una nueva oportunidad a fin de llevar a cabo su sueño.
texts.en:
Ms. Sixta is 58 year old shopkeeper and is married to Mr. Teófilo, who is 57. She has sold food and drink for 4 years and has a well formed clientele. Her business is in her own home and is very popular because of its good location. She runs the store with her husband. 

She requests the loan to increase the size of her store. Before, she would sell her products outside. She wants to construct a place so that her clients can feel at ease and comfortably enjoy the delicious foods that Sixta prepares every day. 

Sixta has worked with the Paraguay Foundation on several opportunities, fulfilling her loan payment obligations on time. Because of this, she wants a new opportunity to achieve her dream.

loans.use: To increase the size of her store for sales

loans.name: Analda Josefa

texts.es:
Doña Analda se dedica al comercio, vende tajadas de platano fritas, su negocio se mantiene estable y sus condiciones de vida se ve que son favorables. 
El crecimiento en su negocio es notable ya que su micro empresa hace uso de dos empleados de diferente sexo, la de sexo femenino le ayuda en todo el proceso de la elaboración de las tajaditas y el hombre es el que se encarga de hacer las compras y la distribución de las mismas.
sus clientes potenciales son los dueños de las casetas de diferentes de centros educativos de la ciudad de Danlí a quienes les vende el producto y muchos ya están por encargos.
Doña Analda es una mujer soltera y que con su trabajo cubre todos los gastos familiares.
con ella vive un hijo y la esposa de su hijo, pero él ya no depende de ella porque trabaja para mantener su nueva familia, de Doña Analda ya solo depende su Madre quien es una señora ya de edad bien avanzada y que esta a un 100% al cargo de ella.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de platanos, aceite y sal.
texts.en:
Analda is a merchant. She sells fried plantain. Her business is stable and her quality of life is good. 
 
The growth of her business is notable, since her micro-business has two employees, a man and a woman. The woman helps her in the process of preparing the plantains and the man takes care of purchasing and distribution.  

Her potential customers are the owners of different stands near the educational centers in the city of Danlí. She sells them her product and a lot of it is made to order.  

Analda is a single woman who with her work covers all of the family expenses. She lives with her son and his wife. He doesn't depend depend on her, because he works to support his new family. The only person who depends on Analda is her mother, who is an elderly woman and who is 100% under her care. She will use the loan to buy plantains, oil, and salt.

loans.use: To buy plantains, oil, salt and wrappers.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón vive en concubinato con la señora Efigenia Aquino hace más de 10 años, tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar, viven en un barrio cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá.
 El mismo posee una despensa en su domicilio donde surte a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes de todo tipo de insumos y artículos de primera necesidad para el hogar como ser bebidas en general, arroz, azúcar, yerba, lácteos y otras mercaderías.
El negocio lo administra la cónyuge, el cliente opera con la Fundación Paraguaya hace mas de 1 año en forma excelente, además de la despensa el señor Ramón posee un taller mecánico donde realiza servicios de reparación y mantenimiento de todo tipo de motocicletas, dicho negocio le ha dado muchos frutos ya que el mismo manifiesta que actualmente posee una cantidad importante de clientes formados los cuales son vecinos de la zona y empleados 
de una granja de pollos muy conocida del lugar.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa ya que se acerca fin de año y desea aumentar su stock para las fiestas.
texts.en:
Ramón has lived in common law marriage with Efigenia Aquino for more than 10 years. They have 3 school aged children and live in a neighborhood close to the center of the city of  Itá.

He owns a store in his house where he distributes to his neighbors and occasionally to all types of customers materials and basic necessity items    for the home, such as general beverages, rice, sugar, herbs, dairy products and other merchandise.
 
His spouse runs the business. He has worked excellently with the Paraguaya Foundation for more than a year. Besides the store,  Ramón has a mechanics garage where he does repairs and maintenance on all types of motorcycles. This business has brought him a lot of results. He relates that at this time he has a significant amount of regular customers who are residents of the area and employees at a well known chicken farm in the area.      

He is asking for the loan to buy merchandise for his store since the end of the year is near and he wants to increase his stock for the holidays.

loans.use: To buy general beverages, dairy products, herbs, rice and other merchandise.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Carla es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol” ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla, provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 17 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, grado de instrucción secundaria completa.
Carla es socia nueva del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitara un primer préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de productos de plástico como juguetes.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la unión hay entre las socias.
texts.en:
Carla is a member of the village bank "Santiago Apóstol."  It is located in the Pancarcolla district, Puno province, and Puno department.  Carla is single, 17 years old, and has completed high school.
She is a new member of Movimiento Manuela Ramos (local lending institution).  She requests her first loan of $125 (S/ 300.00 nuevos soles) and will invest the loan proceeds in her business, which is the sale of plastic items such as toys.
Her dream is to expand her business.  What she enjoys about her village bank is the friendship among the members.

loans.use: To purchase inventory such as plastic toys

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Maria C. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de Maíz, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace mas de 7 siete años y es notable que durante este tiempo a sabido administrar su negocio, ya que según va pasando el tiempo su negocio sigue en crecimiento; actualmente esta moliendo 14 medidas de Maíz diario y su negocio ya posee una empleada permanente a la cual le paga según la producción que elabora. 
Doña María es casada y de su matrimonio tuvo 5 cinco hijos de los cuales ya solo 2 dependen de ellos, su esposo trabaja en una fabrica de tabacos donde se dedica a la fabricación de puros.
Doña maría a apoyado a su esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar y manifiesta que así es como han podido brindar la educación secundaría a sus hijos y han logrado salir adelante, ya que si solo su esposo trabajara la situación económica en su hogar fuera mas difícil.   

Doña Maria es una persona muy trabajadora, pero en la actualidad no cuenta con al capital de trabajo suficiente para la compra de maíz.
con las ganacias desea reconstruir dos piezas de su casa, mismas que actualmente son construidas de orillas de madera y  ya cuenta con parte de los materiales para la reconstrucción de las dos piezas de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doña Maria C. makes and sells corn tortillas.  She began this business more than seven years ago, and it is notable that during this time she learned how to run her business.  With the passage of time, her business has continued to grow.  Today she grinds 14 measures (31 pounds) of corn every day and her business now has a permanent employee who is paid according to her production.
Doña María is married and has five children from her marriage.  Two of the children still depend on their parents.  Her husband works in a tobacco factory, making cigars.
Doña María helped her husband to pay certain household expenses, and this enabled them to give a high school education to their children and to stay afloat financially.  If her husband were the only one working, their economic situation would be more difficult.
Doña María is very hard-working, but does not now have sufficient working capital to buy corn.
With her earnings she wants to repair two portions of her house, portions that are now built with wooden borders.  She already has some of the material that she needs for this repair.

loans.use: compra de harina de maiz, leña, cal, agua.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La Sra. Pabla T. es comerciante posee una despensa bien surtida desde hace mas de 3 años, cuenta con una clientela bien formada quienes se encuentran muy conformes con los precios y los productos que se encuentran a la venta en la despensa.
 Vive en el Asentamiento Nueva Esperanza del Barrio San Antonio de la Ciudad de Itá, con su marido y sus hijos, todos ellos asisten a Escuela primaria de la zona. 
Comenzó su despensa en un pequeño salón y hoy cuenta con un amplio local bien equipado. 
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora y sacrificada que gracias a su esfuerzo y su perseverancia ha logrado llevar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como productos de limpieza, lácteos, panificados, carnes, y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs Pabla T. is a saleswoman.  She has a well-stocked grocery store which she has had for more than 3 years.  She has a solid customer base and her customers are very happy with her prices and the products which they find for sale in her store.

She lives in Nueva Esperanza, in the San Antonio neighborhood of the city of Itá with her husband and her children who all attend the local elementary school.

She started her grocery store in a small room but today she has bigger, well-equipped premises.

She is a very hard-working, selfless lady who, thanks to her effort and perseverance, has managed to get her family ahead and improve their quality of life.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as cleaning products, dairy products, bakery products, meat and other products.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store (rice, sugar, bakery products, dairy products, meat, cleaning products, etc.)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol” ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla, provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con cuatro hijos y tiene grado de instrucción de primaria completa.
La señora se dedica a la compra y venta de queso, quinua lavada y trabajos en artesanía. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles,  dinero que fue utilizado en su negocio.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que invertirá en su negocio.
Su sueño es  tener vacas lecheras de calidad. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank “Santiago Apóstol,” located in the Paucarcolla district in the province and department of Puno.  She is 55 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She has an elementary school education.

Carmen buys and sells cheese, washed quinoa, and handicrafts.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 3 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she used in her business.

Now she requests a new loan of 300 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in her business.

Her dream is to have quality milk cows.  What she likes about her communal bank are the savings she can accumulate.

loans.use: to invest in her business selling cheeses and washed quinoa

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efrain tiene 29 años, el vive en casa con sus padres es soltero y es el sustento de su familia, él inicio el negocio de servicio de fotocopiadora, impresiones y recargas virtuales para celulares, el ya tiene mas de ocho años en este negocio el cual lo formo con mucho esfuerzo pues ya cuenta con su maquinaria propia, el sueño de Efrain es incrementar su negocio por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar una máquina fotocopiadora mas grande que le permita poder atender mas rápido a sus clientes, Efrain es un joven muy empeñoso ya que se esfuerza para salir adelante y poder darles a sus padres todo lo mejo y una buena calidad de vida,  se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales.
texts.en: Efrain is 29 years old and lives with his parents.  He is single and supports the family.  He started a business that provides photocopying services, prints, and cellular recharge cards more than 8 years ago.  He has built the business with a lot of effort, and now has his own equipment.  His dream is to expand his business, and so he is requesting a loan to buy a larger photocopying machine that would allow him to attend more quickly to his customers.  Efrain is a very dedicated youth who strives to get ahead so that he can give his parents the best and a good quality of life.  He is provided this loan based on good personal references.

loans.use: to buy a photocopy machine

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Señor José, soltero de 30 años de edad es Fotógrafo de profesión hace más de 15 años.
 Comenta que comenzó trabajando  desde muy joven, primero como empleado por más de 5 años y que después se esforzó para independizarse ya que lo que ganaba no le alcanzaba y deseó probar suerte por cuenta propia. 
Con mucho esfuerzo fue juntando el dinero para la compra de su primera cámara fotográfica y de ese momento ya han trascurrido 10 años.  
 Actualmente presta sus servicios en la ciudad de Itá y ciudades aledañas, es muy conocido por su excelente trabajo, razón por la cual cuenta con muchos clientes. 
Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una nueva herramienta de trabajo y poder seguir realizando trabajos según comentó, plasmando y teniendo de recuerdo los momentos más lindos de la vida.
texts.en:
Jose is single, 30 years old, and has been a photographer for over 15 years. He said that he started working when he was very young, first as an employee for over five years. Then, he made the leap to become independent since what he earned wasn’t enough to make ends meet, and he wanted to try his luck doing freelance work.

With a lot of effort, he put together money to purchase his first camera, and ten years have passed since then. He lends his services to the city of Itá and other nearby cities. He is well known for his excellent work, the very reason why he has many clients. 

Jose has decided to trust in the Paraguay Foundation, requesting a loan to purchase a new tool for work, enabling him to continue creating works that capture on film and preserve as mementos the most beautiful moments in life.

loans.use: To purchase a still camera

loans.name: Silvia Carmelina

texts.es:
Doña Silvia es una señora D. 53 años D. edad, vive en El Transito, departamento D. San Miguel con sus dos hijos D. 18 y 22 años D. edad, ella es viuda y posee una tienda que comenzó  por iniciativa propia con sus hijos, el horario D. ellos es D. 6:00am á 7:00pm, su ventaja es la falta D. competencia en la zona.
Hoy doña Silvia solicita un préstamo para la compra D. arroz, frijol, aceite, azúcar, gaseosas, y otros productos que le son demandados por los clientes y que necesita tener en su inventario para el momento en que los clientes le lleguen. Con esta inversión ella estará solventado la dificultad D. falta D. inventario a la vez está incrementando la posibilidad D. tener mayores ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Su proyección en la vida es que su negocio no llegue a la quiebra y que al contrario siga progresando y estabilizando los ingresos del hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Silvia is a 53 year old woman who lives with her two children (ages 18 and 22) in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel. She is a widow and manages a store that she started along with her children. Their work schedule is from 6am to 7pm. She is at an advantage because of the lack of competition in the area.

Today Doña Silvia is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, sodas, and other products that are demanded by her customers. She needs to have inventory for when her customers come to her store. With this investment, she will be able resolve her lack of merchandise by increasing her inventory. This will help her generate more income to cover her household expenses.

Her goal in life is to prevent her business from going bankrupt. She would like to continue progressing and stabilize her household income.

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, oil, sugar, sodas, and other products

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Inocencia T. de 65 años de edad, es comerciante desde hace mas de 10 años, tiene un puesto de ventas de ropas bien surtido en el Mercado de Itá desde hace más de 5 años. 
Comenta que desde siempre se dedicó a la venta pero anteriormente lo hacía en forma ambulante.
 Luego de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logró montar su negocio en el mercado municipal de su ciudad y gracias a Dios, según comenta, le ha ido muy bien.
Ella es soltera y tampoco tiene hijos.
Desea acceder a un crédito para surtir aún más su negocio debido a que la época de fin de año es en donde las ventas crecen más y quiere contar con buen stock de mercaderías para entonces.
Está muy agradecida por la confianza que ha depositado la institución en ella y que no la defraudará a fin de poder acceder a créditos futuros.
texts.en:
Sra. Inocencia T. is 65 years old and has worked as a merchant for more than ten years. She has been selling clothes at a well-stocked stand at the Itá Market for more than five years. Inocencia says that she has always been in sales and previously worked as a street vendor. After much effort and sacrifice, she set up her business at the municipal market and, thanks to God, has done very well. She is single and does not have children.

Inocencia wants to access a loan to increase the inventory of her business for the year-end season. During this time, she generates more sales and wants to have a good stock of merchandise. She is extremely grateful for the confidence Fundación Paraguaya has placed in her. For this reason, she does not want disappoint so that she can access future loans.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
el grupo Luz Divina esta ubicado en la colonia los Llanos Tablon de la ciudad de Danli, lo integran 3 mujeres las cuales son muy unidas y muy trabajadoras, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Celsa M. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular y tambien da el servicio de moler maiz. tiene gran cantidad de ventas al crédito ya que la mayoría de las personas obreras y clientes de su negocio trabajan en fincas de Tomates y Chiles Dulce ubicadas en ese sector y es a ella que se abocan sus clientes para sacar al crédito los productos mas necesarios para el consumo diario.
Su negocio se mantiene estable y sus condiciones de vida han mejorado notablemente.
Doña Celsa esta casada y de su matrimonio actualmente dependen 3 hijos los cuales unos están cursando estudios primarios y una hija estudios secundarios, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y también se dedica a la compra de leche donde la recolecta de pequeñas lecherías y la vende a un solo recolector de leche en su casa de habitación. 

la sra. Maria Marleny B. se dedica a la venta de granos básicos Maíz y Frijoles, tambien vende golosinas (Vasitos y Choco bananos) y enchiladas, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación.
Doña María B. vende a diario los vasitos y choco bananos pero los días sábados y domingos se dedica a la elaboración y venta de enchiladas.
El crecimiento en su negocio es notable ya que ahora posee su propia refrigeradora donde mantiene las charamuscas y choco bananos. 
las condiciones de vida notablemente se ve que han mejorado.
Doña Maria vive en unión libre y es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales unos de ellos están cursando sus estudios primarios, su compañero de hogar se dedica a la agricultura ya que la zona donde viven es muy apta para este tipo de actividad pero también se dedica a la albañilería cuando lo buscan para la construcción de viviendas.

la sra. Eva M. se dedica a la elaboración de Pinol,  venta de Arroz de Maíz y venta de carne asada los días sábados, actividad en la cual cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia.
Ella sale a vender su producto de manera ambulante y su punto estratégico para la venta es la Terminal de transporte de esta ciudad, doña Eva se sube a los autobuses a ofrecer sus productos y son los viajeros los que más compran el mismo.
Doña Eva, es soltera y en su casa de habitación ya solo vive una hija, la cual no depende de ella,  ya que sus hijos crecieron y tienen sus propias familias.

Cabe mencionar que los integrantes del grupo son personas que se conocen muy bien entre ellas mismas, ya que son varios años los que tienen de residir en el mismo lugar y cada una de ellas posee su propio negocio.
texts.en:
The “Luz Divina” (Divine Light) Group is located in the Llanos Tablon division of the city of Danli. This group is composed of three hardworking women who are very close. Described below are the details of their various business activities:

Sra. Celsa M. sells popular consumer products and also provides a service of grinding corn. A large number of her sales are made on credit since the majority of her customers are farm workers who are employed by the local tomato and sweet pepper farms. Celsa has agreed to extend credit to her customers for the most basic consumer products. Her business remains stable and her living conditions have improved considerably. Doña Celsa is married and has three dependent children, of whom two are in elementary school while her daughter is in high school. Her husband is a farmer, but also works as a buyer of milk from small dairy farms. He then sells the milk to a single collector who comes by their home.

Sra. Maria Marleny B. sells basic grains, corn, and beans. She also sells sweets, such as ice cream cups and chocolate covered bananas, and enchiladas from her home. Doña María B. sells ice cream and chocolate bananas every day, but on Saturdays and Sundays she spends time making and selling enchiladas. The growth in her business has been significant. She now owns a refrigerator for storing popsicles and chocolate bananas. Her living conditions have also improved as well. Doña Maria is in a common law marriage and the mother of four children who are in elementary school. Her household partner is a farmer since the area where they live is suitable for this type of activity. He also performs masonry jobs whenever there are home construction projects available.

Sra. Eva M. makes “pinol” (a corn based beverage) and sells rice and corn. On Saturdays she prepares and sells roasted meats. She has five years of experience with her businesses. Eva sells her products as a street vendor. Her strategic sales location is at the city bus terminal. She gets on the buses to offer her products to travelers who buy them. Doña Eva is single and lives alone since her grown daughter is no longer dependent on her and has a family of her own.

It should be mentioned that the members of the group are people who know one another very well. They have lived in the same place for several years and each woman has her own business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, tiene 35 años D. edad, resiD. en El Transito departamento D. San Miguel y vive con sus hijas D. 6 y 9 años D. edad, es madre soltera, su negocio tiene 20 años D. funcionar pero a sus manos llego hace 4 años ya que primeramente era D. su tía.
En este momento ella solicita un  préstamo para la compra D. una plancha para hacer las tortillas y maíz, gas, estos son los materiales principales para realizar la venta, con esta ayuda ella fortalecerá el negocio y su producción será mayor y mejor para atender a los clientes.
Su proyección es fortalecer el negocio, administrar los fondos D. este préstamo y llevar a cabo la inversión  para garantizar mejores ventas y mayores ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana sells tortillas. She is 35 years old and resides in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel with her daughters, ages 6 and 9. Ana is a single mother. Her business has been in existence for 20 years, but she assumed ownership four years ago since it previously belonged to her aunt.

At the moment, Ana is requesting a loan to buy a grill for making the tortillas, corn, and gas. These are the main supplies she needs to generate sales. With this support, Ana can strengthen her business and increase her production so that she can better serve her customers.

Her goals are to strengthen her business, manage the funds from this loan, and make good use of this investment so that she can guarantee better sales and more household income.

loans.use: Purchase corn, gas, and a grill

loans.name: Máximo Rafael

texts.es: Máximo Rafael tiene 44 años, su actividad es la carpintería. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio este negocio cuando tenía 17 años, el aprendió porque anteriormente se iba a un taller a aprender de este medio de vida, a la edad de 19 años empezó a realizar sus primeros muebles con ayuda de ciertos ayudantes que tenia. Después de un tiempo decidió que su profesión iba a ser la carpintería. En la actualidad trabaja todos los días y algunas veces que tiene pedidos por sus clientes no tiene horario fijo. Hace puertas, sillas, juegos de salas, comedor escritorio, mesas.  Para seguir con su negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo pintura, laca, diluyentes para pinta muebles que tiene hechos. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando y obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Máximo Rafael is 44 years old and has been a carpenter for more than 20 years. He started working at a carpentry workshop when he was 17 years old. There he learned the trade that would become his livelihood. At the age of 19, Máximo began making his first pieces of furniture with the help of a few assistants.
