loans.use: Additional capital to purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Gracelyn

texts.en:
Desiree Militante is engaged in buying and selling of coconuts. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income is come from selling of copra and charcoal. She has been operating her business for one year and earns a monthly net income of 2,300 PHP. Desiree is 26 years old, married with one infant. She is from the village of Unidos, Calamba.

In 2008, Desiree joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Desiree has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Desiree is requesting her 6th loan with the amount of 25,000 PHP which will be used for house renovation.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns a monthly net income of 3,200 PHP. Marilyn is 49 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Upper Langub, Calamba. 

In 2000, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Marilyn is requesting her 19th loan amounting to 35,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Hospe

texts.en:
Hospe L. is from the town of Palilan, Jimenez Mis. Occ. Philippines. She is 49 years old. Hospe is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Hospe owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products in the local community. Hospe has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Hospe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hospe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the business. Hospe is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Hospe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marialita

texts.en:
Marialitata G. is from the town of Pan-ay Diot Tudela, Mis. Occ. Philippines. She is 44 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marialitata owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products in the local community. Marialitata has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marialitata joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marialitata has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marialitata is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marialitata from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Rafiqa's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqa is a 52-year-old lady and comes from Lahore, a historic city of Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its culture and is Pakistan’s second largest city. She lives there in a small home, with her husband and two children, in an area named Green Town. She moved here after her marriage. Both her children are sons and work in the factory for a small income. They are illiterate and couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial condition of Rafiqa and her husband.

Rafiqa's husband is a vegetable vendor by profession. He operates his shop in the market. He sells fresh and seasonal vegetables to his good number of clients and generates income for the family. He has been involved in this business for many years. Rafiqa shares the financial burden with her husband by operating a small grocery shop at her home. She uses a room in her house as her grocery shop, where she sells items to her customers’ demands.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her grocery shop business. With the loan she will buy groceries in bulk to sell in her grocery shop. She is hopeful that, after an investment, her business will grow and her income will be increased. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that this will take her business to a better position.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop business

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima is 33 years old, the mother of a daughter and a son. Both of them are enrolled in a school and getting their education. She lives in a two-room brick house with her children. She is a talented lady who operates a school in the community, where she provides the services of a teacher. She has in her school a fair number of students, due to its high quality of education and good environment. Her children are also getting their education from their mother’s school.
 
Saima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her school. With the loan, she will buy furniture, such as chairs and tables, and also stationery items, such as pencils and notepads, to provide a better study environment for her students.
 
She has been running the school for the past four years and is hopeful that through this investment she will be able to educate many more children and help to make their future bright, and so her own kids' as well.
 
She is a new loan applicant at Asasah, and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Saima.

loans.use: To buy furniture and stationery for school

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a married, 32-year-old woman living in a historic city of Pakistan known as Lahore. She lives with her family in their three-room house, where she moved after her marriage ten years ago. She and her husband have two sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a nearby school and are receiving their education. Her husband’s name is E. A. and he works in a hospital. Shazia explains that she had to stop going to school after the 10th grade due to her family's poor finances, but she knows and understands the importance of a good education. She wants her children to complete their education and, therefore, she works very hard.

To earn a living, Shazia is a beauty expert. Specifically, she provides beauty salon services to her clients, which include bridal makeup work and makeup for other parties. She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her beauty salon business. With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy beauty-related items such as makeup kits, face packs, and creams in bulk quantity so that she can provide better services to her clients. She hopes that the loan will have a positive impact on her business and that she will be able to realize greater profits. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional beauty products in bulk

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is a married woman with a teenage daughter named Darina. She lives and works in Belaya Tserkov.

To earn a living, Oksana sells groceries in the central marketplace of her home town. For instance, she sells food items such as cookies, candy, and chocolates. She has been working in this line of business for seven years. Presently, Oksana owns a vending kiosk worth 24,000 UAH. Her gross income is approximately 26,000 UAH per year, and her net profit is a little over 3,000 UAH per month.

Oksana is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 UAH ($650) to diversify the merchandise she offers for sale in her kiosk. She always sees an increase in demand for her inventory around Christmas and New Year’s. As such, Oksana wants to increase her stock of goods with additional merchandise to be able to meet the growing demand and generate additional income this holiday season. One of Oksana’s long-term goals is to have her own grocery store in downtown Belaya Tserkov.

loans.use: To satisfy customer demand during the holiday season by expanding her inventory

loans.name: Saeeda's Group

texts.en:
Saeeda lives in the historic city of Pakistan called Lahore.  Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture.  She lives there in a three room brick house with her family in the area named Green town which is a housing colony.  She moved here after her marriage with G. R. 26 years ago. 

She is a 53 year old lady, mother of a son.  He is twenty-five years old, named Dilshaad who operates a construction supply sales business.  He couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial condition of his parents.  He started this business few years ago and is getting a good income from it. 

Saeeda herself bears the financial burden with her family by selling clothes. She purchases clothes from wholesale markets named “Ichra and Shahalmi” and sells it to her local area clients for a good profit.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes sales business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different varieties in bulk quantity that will help her make more sales by offering more variety to her clients.  She is very hopeful that this loan investment will have a positive impact on her business and her monthly income will increase. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Saeeda.

loans.use: To buy clothes of different variety for cloth selling business.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with two daughters who are 9 and 13 years old.  He owns greenhouses and grows vegetables for sale.  Vitalyi has 15 spacious greenhouses and 3 separate ones for seedlings.  He started this farming enterprise 10 years ago.  Vitalyi started out small but has gradually expanded his business. He has already invested about 500,000 Grivnyas in his greenhouse business.  His expenses on seeds and polyethylene film amount to 80,000 Grivnyas every  year.  

Vitalyi is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to install heating units in 8 greenhouses. He is planning to plant and harvest 10,000 tall-grown tomatoes this farming season.  Vitalyi admits that the farming business has proved to be effective and profitable in this region. He sees the potential for the further growth of his venture in the future.

loans.use: To install heating systems in his greenhouses.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is a farmer from Kamenka.  He grows vegetables for sale.  Ashot owns 3 big greenhouses and a separate one for seedlings.  He has been working in this area of agriculture for 7 years.  Presently, he has already invested about 120,000 Grivnyas in his enterprise.  He spends about 40,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film every year. 

Ashot is planning to use the loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to install heating units in two of his greenhouses.  He is hoping to plant 5,000 tall-grown tomatoes this farming season.  Ashot has experienced profitability of this business in his region.  He is looking forward to working just as hard and to see his venture expand even more and bring him stable income.

loans.use: To install heating units in 2 greenhouses.

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed makes and sells artificial flowers.  She takes orders from different gift shop and supplies them with flowers to order.  She is very skillful in her art and receives regular orders every month.  She also sells bangles.  She has a large variety available to sell to her clients.  She does these businesses to share the financial burden with her family. 

She lives in the historic city of Pakistan called Lahore.  Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives there in a three room brick house with her family in the area named Green town.  

Her husband has a business of making stoves (used to cook food on it).  He has been doing this business for the past 18 years.  Earlier, he made stoves for someone else, but later he started making them for himself.  Now he makes stoves and sells to his own clients and earns a good profit.
 
Naheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy steel and iron in larger quantities and that will enable him to make more stoves and to complete the orders for his clients.  Naheed is hopeful that with this investment, her husband will be able to improve his business and increasing his sales. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy steel & iron for stove making business.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband.  With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as bricks, cement and sand in bulk quantity to improve the sales of his construction supply business.  He has a good clientele base who prefers to give him orders because of his quality items.
  
Naseem is 52 years old, mother of a son who is a graduate (14th Level) and works in a hospital on monthly wages. To financially support her family, Naseem does embroidery works. She has contracts with different boutiques, to whom she provides the finished products to get a good income.
  
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and she is very confident that taking a loan will be a good decision for her family which will benefit her husband and family on a long term basis. She lives in the city Lahore which is famous for its culture and history.  There, she owns a two room house where she has been living with her family for over 25 years.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for a construction supply sales business.

loans.name: Kaliypakan

texts.en:
Kaliypakan J. lives in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  She is 46 years old, married and has two daughters who are 19 and 7 years old.  Kaliypakan works as a caretaker in the local hospital and is known as a very responsible person.  She has shift work but manages to be a perfect householder and attentive mother for her children.  Kaliypakan’s husband works as a driver. 
 
11 years ago, in order to support her family, Kaliypakan began her business in cattle breeding and cultivating of perennial herbs.  Due to her persistent and hardworking personality, Kaliypakan achieved success and in 2005.  She managed to buy a car, which is now used as a taxi.  Today, Kaliypakan has one milk cow and two calves and plans to enlarge the number of her cattle. 

For this very reason, Kaliypakan has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to broaden her business by purchasing one milk cow and a concentrate for her cattle.  With the revenues from this investment, Kaliypakan plans to buy a plot of land.  All members of Kaliypakan’s united family are doing their best to make the future prosperous and stable.
  
Bai-Tushum and Partners use Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow and a concentrate for her cattle.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla L. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan.  Shventure ie is 34 years old.  Priscilla is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Priscilla owns and operates a business raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.  Priscilla has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Priscilla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Priscilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI.  Priscilla is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Priscilla from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  Shamim has a poultry business that she has been engaged in for four years.         

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chicken feed.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Shamim hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Shamim hopes to have her own plot. Shamim is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which is helping her improve future prospects and provide a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Shem

texts.en: Shem is a Nairobi-based businessman. He is a landlord who has developed several semi-permanent residential houses that he rents out. His customers are mainly middle income earners. He has been in this business for the last four years. He is married and, in partnership with his wife, Shem runs a grocery store. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to install water pipes and repaint his rental houses. He is a risk taker and also hardworking and hopes to build more permanent houses in the future. Since joining Faulu, his business has grown and he has been able to take care of his family.

loans.use: to install water pipes and repaint his rental houses

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 50 years old and in business. She operates "Mwala Dairy Enterprise" where she sells milk to earn a living. She also rears dairy cows. She has been in this business for five years and has a good market with happy, friendly and loyal customers. She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy a freezer. She describes herself as hardworking and friendly and hopes to grow her business into a milk processing plant in future. In five years time, Esther hopes to deal with a diversity of milk products in her business. This is Esther's first loan and it is guaranteed by Joy Traders SHG.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Amina has a salon business  that she has been running for two years now.          

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Amina hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Amina hopes to become a lawyer. Amina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her improve future prospects by protecting herself from diseases.

loans.use: to purchase braids

loans.name: Daphine

texts.en:
Daphine N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Daphine has been selling soft drinks since two years now.         

To help expand her business, Daphine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more soft drinks. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Daphine hopes to generate more profits and buy food.  In the future, Daphine hopes to own a retail shop. Daphine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her future prospects by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Gloria has been running her own retail shop since two years.         

To help expand her business, Gloria has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase rice and sugar.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Gloria hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Gloria hopes to become an accountant.  Gloria is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which is helping her improve her future prospects and living standard.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Aisha has a business selling charcoal, which she has been doing for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal and for another business.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Aisha hopes to own a plot of land.

Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and for another business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Lydia has a poultry business, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase maize bran.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Lydia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.

In the future, Lydia hopes to own a plot of land. Lydia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: To buy maize bran for chicken feed

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 35 years old, married and the father of five.  He operates a bicycle transport business for a living.  His business is just one and a half years old.  In addition, he does small-scale farming for extra income.

He was previously employed in a hotel before he started his own business.  He currently wants to open his own cafe, so he requested a loan of 20,000 KES.  He hopes to own vehicles for transport in the future.

loans.use: To open a cafe

loans.name: Kavuo

texts.en:
Kavuo is a 32 year old businessman. For a living, he operates a bodaboda (motorcycle transport) business in Nairobi. He has been in this business for three years and hopes to expand it in future.

Kavuo also runs a retail shop in partnership with his wife. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a motorbike. He describes himself as hardworking and his business has been good.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna, a member of Muso group in Faulu Kenya, joined the group as a business lady who sells green maize. She also does mixed farming to boost her income.  Married with four children, she works hard in order to provide for her family and hopes eventually to move her enterprise to permanent premises instead of renting.  Anna has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy sacks of maize.

loans.use: To buy sacks of maize

loans.name: Amady

texts.fr: Monsieur Amady N. est un jeune qui réside à Nguéniéne un arrondissement dans le département de MBour où il exerce une activité de quincaillerie pour la vente de matériaux de construction et d'automobile également. Il a demarrait son activité sous fonds propre, ainsi Monsieur N. voulant agrandir et renforcer son fonds de commerce sollicite ce crédit car c'est une zone reculée où il peut générer des revenus et aider ses parents qui vivent dans cette localité
texts.en: Mr. Amady N. is a young man who lives in Nguéniéne, a district in the MBour "département", where he has a hardware business selling building  materials as well as car equipment. Mr N. began his business with his own money, but because he wants to expand and strengthen his business, he  is requesting a loan, since it is a remote area where he can generate income and help his parents who live in this town.

loans.use: To strengthen his business

loans.name: Messi

texts.en:
Messi N., age 18, has operated a poultry business for the past several months. She lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children.      
 
To help expand her business, Messi has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Messi hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Messi hopes to become a tailor.

Messi is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
Hezron, age 32, sells clothes and shoes in a densely populated area where he caters to a good market of middle income earners. He is requesting his first loan of Kes. 20,000 to add a new stock of clothes.  

For extra income, Hezron is a farmer. He is married and a father to two children who are in school. He hopes to own a boutique in the future and has a five-year plan of eventually owning a plot.

loans.use: To add a new stock of clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
Winifred N., age 16, has operated a small hotel business for three years. She lives and works in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is unmarried and has no children.        
  
To help expand her business, Winifred has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase saucepans and stock food items. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Winifred hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  

In the future, Winifred hopes to be a nurse. Winifred is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to take care of herself.

loans.use: To buy saucepans and stock food items

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra N., age 16, has been a charcoal vendor for three years. She lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is unmarried and has no children.       
  
To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Barbra hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  

In the future, Barbra hopes to become a pharmacist. Barbra is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to play such cooperative games as netball.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas K. M., age 26, offers computer services such as printing, photocopying, and typesetting. He has been engaged in this business for three years.  He also operates a motorbike transportation business to boost his income. He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kes to buy computers and printers. 

Cosmas is married and is the father of one child. He aspires eventually to run his business on his own business premises instead of renting.

loans.use: To buy computers and a printer for his printing, photocopying, and typesetting business

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida, age 40 (shown holding the Asasah Passbook in the picture), helps her husband support the family by offering embroidery services. She receives orders from neighboring areas and is able to help pay the family's utility bills with her business. She and her family live in Sahiwal, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. They reside in an area named Essa Nagri in a two-bedroom house.
 
Rashida's husband, Yunus M., is involved in a food-selling business. He makes Punjabi food dishes such as Nan chanay (made with chickpeas and served with bread, pickle, and salad) and Daal chawal (made with rice and lentils). These two dishes are the specialty of his business and people from different areas of Sahiwal city come to him to buy his food. He has operated his business for 25 years and has established a good name in his area for the quality and taste of his food.
  
Rashida and her husband have a son and two daughters. They couldn’t educate any of their children due to poor financial conditions. Their son started work in his teens and works as a shoe polisher.

Rashida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy items such as lentils, cooking oil, and spices in bulk quantities that will enable him to prepare large amounts of food to sell to his customers. Rashida believes that an investment in her husband’s long-standing business will bring about positive changes in her family life. She also hopes to be able to collect some dowry money from her loan profits for her elder daughter’s marriage. 
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who has paid her installments on time and has attended very meeting.

loans.use: To buy items such as lentils, cooking oil, and spices in bulk quantities for food-selling business

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon is a member of Faulu Kenya under the Ngwate Kwoko group. He runs a taxi business to earn a living and was previously a shopkeeper. He also does farming to make extra income. He really appreciates Faulu Kenya for supporting him financially because he was able to build his own home. He has requested another loan of 40, 000 Kes to service his car and buy tires.

loans.use: To service his car and buy tires

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida, wife of S. M., resides in a city named Sahiwal in Pakistan. She is a caring wife and a mother. She is not an educated lady but she has raised her children with great care and discipline. She has two children: a son and a daughter. Her son got an education until 5th grade standard and now works in a private organization for a monthly wage. Her daughter is enrolled in school and reads in 5th standard grade level. Her husband drives a rickshaw prociding transportation services. He has been doing this for many years. 

Rashida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw because now his rickshaw is creating problem and doesn’t work well. Rashida is hopeful that with a fully repaired rickshaw will make her husband's work better and make him more income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself a responsible client and always paid her installments on time. Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rashida.

loans.use: To repair a rickhsaw

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is 28 years of age. She is married to A. M. who is a government employee with meager income. She belongs to Sahiwal which is famous for its cow species. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area named Essa nagri. She shifted here after her marriage few years ago. She supports her family by doing sewing work. She works very hard all day to fulfill orders on time and to earn income for her family. She has five children; four daughters and a son. All of them are enrolled in school and getting their education. 

Samina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy another sewing machine. She will also hire a worker who will assist her in finishing orders on time. EID season is on and she has received a large order to fill. She hopes that with this loan investment she will be able to get the better financial results from her business. This is her second loan application. She has built a good credit reputation and has never missed any meeting. In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Samina.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra, pictured with the Asasah passbook in her hand, is a 35-year-old housewife living in Sahiwal, a small city of Punjab that is famous for its agriculture industry. She lives with her family in a 3-room brick house in the area known as Essa nagri, where she has been for the past 15 years. She and her husband have two sons and one daughter. Due to a lack of financial resources, her eldest son had to stop attending school and started working in a private company. He works there for a low income, but the extra income he generates enables the family to enroll his younger brother and sister in school.

She is applying for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s scrap business. He runs a shop in the market, where he sells scrap materials such as plastic bottles, used papers etc. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years. Bushra is hopeful that the loan proceeds will greatly benefit the business because he could purchase scrap in bulk quantity to sell to his customers for profits.

Bushra is a regular client/borrower of Asasah. In fact, this would be her third loan from Asasah. Notably, she explains that she successfully and timely repaid her prior loans and thereby maintained a good credit record.

loans.use: To expand the business by purchasing scrap materials in bulk

loans.name: Emillyn

texts.en: Emillyn, age 30, is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 in order to buy beauty products for her beauty salon. She has been operating the beauty salon for seven years in a busy part of Nairobi. Her clients are ladies. Her desire is to own a production company and she plans to employ many people in her company over the next five years. Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has learnt business management. Emillyn is unmarried but looks forward to having her own family someday. She is focused, a go-getter, and a good leader.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou S. est une commerçante productrice de beignets très prisé par les ouvriers et chauffeurs de taxi clando dans la zone de Grand Mbour un quartier de Mbour. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce secteur. Pour le bien être de sa famille et la rentabilité de son activité Madame vient solliciter ce crédit pour l'acquisition de produits destinés à son fabrique
texts.en: Mrs. Fatou S. is a merchant who prepares and sells beignets, very popular with workers and unlicensed taxi drivers in the Grand Mbour area, a district of Mbour. She has over 10 years of experience in this area. In order to ensure the well-being of her family and the profitability of her business,  Mrs. S. is seeking a loan to purchase supplies necessary for her work.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam (holding the Asasah Passbook in the photo) is a seamstress. She supports her family financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful in her art and receives a good number of orders every month. With this loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her old machine no longer produces work of the quality she expects of herself. The new machine will help her do her work better and finish orders on time. She has operated this business for past four years and she is hopeful that she will successfully improve her business with the help of this loan investment. 

Mariam and her husband, M. A., live in Sahiwal, which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. Mariam's husband is a rickshaw driver. He provides transportation services to his passengers and drops them at their designated destinations. They have two sons, Amir, age 10, and A., age 5. Both are enrolled in school and are getting their education. The family resides in a housing colony named Rasoolpur.
 
Mariam has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her thirrd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and has never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz, age 37 (shown holding the Asasah Passbook in the picture) is a homemaker with many household responsibilties. She makes every attempt to make her family's life better through her work. She and her husband have two sons and two daughters. The family lives in Sahiwal, a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. Their eldest son operates a Punjabi food stall business in the market. Their other children are enrolled in school and are getting their education. 

Shahnaz's husband is a noodle salesman by trade. He supplies noodles to different departmental stores and businesses and earns a good profit from his work. Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will utilize the loan to purchase packs of noodles in larger quantities in order to fulfill larger orders on time. Shahnaz is confident that an investment for her husband’s business will be a good step toward his business growth.  

Shahnaz is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy packs of noodles in larger quantities to offer for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, age 36, offers printing, photocopying, typing, and binding services. He and his wife have two children, both of whom attend school. Joseph has requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 in order to buy stationery and a printer. Joseph also earns extra income from employment. He describes himself as open-minded and aggressive in his business, and he hopes to have the best printshop possible with the fastest machines in town. In five years' time, Joseph plans to be a stationery supplier.

loans.use: To buy stationery and a printer for his business

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 49 (shown holding the Asasah Passbook in the picture), is requesting a loan for her husband's fruit vending business. Her husband, M. Y., buys fresh fruits from the fruit markets at cheap rates and then sells them in different areas of the community from his four-wheel cart. People come to buy fruits from him because of their freshness and good quality. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits in bulk quantities and increase his sales. Nasreen is confident that this loan investment will be beneficial for her husband and for the family, and that he will be able to lift up his business successfully by increasing his sales to many more customers. 
 
They have three sons, two of whom work. The youngest, age 15, still lives at home. The family lives in a city named Sahiwal in Pakistan. Nasreen and her husband couldn’t provide education facilities to her children due to their limited financial resources. The children left their school after completing fifth grade.
 
Nasreen is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit-selling business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis, age 26 and unmarried, operates a business called Rehoboth Butchery, a business he has been running for two years. He is requesting a loan in the amount of Kes. 20,000 in order to add stocks of meat to his butchery. Being a hardworking man, Francis hopes to become a meat supplier in future and  eventually to open more outlets. His business environment is good and there is a constant flow of customers.

loans.use: To add stocks of meat to his butcher business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 24, owns and runs a grocery store in a busy part of Nairobi. Her business has a good number of loyal customers. She has been in this business for five years, before which she was in the business of selling used clothing. She is social and hardworking and hopes eventually to be a distributor of fruits and vegetables on a larger scale. 

She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to purchase passionfruits, bananas, and avocados, and to enlarge her business premises.

Mary and her husband have three children.

loans.use: To purchase passionfruits, bananas, and avocados, and to enlarge her business premises

loans.name: Amin's Group

texts.en:
Amin, age 54 (shown holding the Asasah Passbook in the photo), is a homemaker with many household responsibilities. Her husband, U. K., is a professional electrician. He runs an electrical repair shop in the market where he offers electric and electronic repair services.  The family resides in a two-room brick house in Kot Khadim Ali, which is a small housing society of Sahiwal. Sahiwal is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry.
  
Amin and her husband have two sons and two daughters. Her sons are educated through eighth-grade level and are employed. The eldest son is also an electrician, a trade he learned from his father. The other works in a private company and earns a monthly wage. The daughters are enrolled in school and are getting their education. 

Amin has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy the latest repair tools for his electronics and electrical repairs business, which will help him improve his business earnings and work more efficiently. 

Amin is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she has built up good credit behavior and has attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy the latest repair tools for electric and electronics repair business

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s animal sales business. He buys animals such as buffalos and goats inexpensively from animal markets. Then he raises them and sells them to his customers. His work is time-intensive, but in the end it earns for him a good profit. With the loan, he will buy buffalos and goats for his animal sales business.
 
Sughran is a very supportive lady. She shares the financial burden for her family through her sewing business. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and receives regular orders every month. Her earning allows her to pay for the utilities. She is the mother of two sons, both of whom are enrolled in school and getting their education.  

Sughran is hopeful that through this loan investment, her husband will be able to improve the financial condition of his business by increasing his sales. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy buffalos and goats

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is almost 50 years old. She is very active and fulfills her household responsibilities very actively. She lives with her family in a small city called Sahiwal, which is famous for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She is married to M. A.. He has two businesses. In the morning, he runs a grocery shop, and in the evening he handles his tailoring shop. He has hired some workers in his tailoring shop who help him in completing the orders on time. He pays them a monthly wage.
 
Shahnaz is the mother of two children: a son and a daughter. Both are enrolled in a local school and are studying in different classes. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk in order to meet the needs of his customers and increase his sales. He has been involved in this business for the past 15 years. Shahnaz is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to improve his grocery business after investing this money into it. She is a new loan user of Asasah, and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Jorge Miguel

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta y reparación de celulares, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en San Francisco Gotera,  departamento de Morazán, es un lugar cercano a donde él vive y lleva ya un año de dedicarse a este negocio. Él vive con su esposa pero solamente él está al frente de la administración del negocio.
El quiere realizar una remodelación al negocio y para hacerla realidad solicita un préstamo pues no tiene los fondos necesarios para comprar los materiales para pintarlo y decorarlo, él necesita cambiar la apariencia al local para tener una  mayor atracción de los clientes y se sientan más cómodos.
Como administrador de su negocio él quiere volverlo fuerte y con capacidad para resolver las necesidades de los clientes ofreciendo una mejor atención y un trabajo de calidad.
texts.en:
Jorge is an enterprising young man.  He is 22 years old and lives in the city of San Miguel, in San Miguel department.  He works selling and repairing cell phones.  His business is located in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department which is near his home.  He has been in this business for a year.  He lives with his wife but he is the only one in charge of the business.

He would like to remodel his business and in order to do so he is requesting a loan as he doesn't have the necessary funds to buy the materials to paint and decorate it.  He needs to change the appearance of his premises so that he can attract more customers and so that his customers feel more comfortable.

As manager of his business, he would like to strengthen it and ensure it can fulfil his customers' needs, offering better service and quality work.

loans.use: To buy paint and decorations

loans.name: Martha De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Martha, resiD. en Guatajiagua, departamento D. Morazán, tiene 49 años D. edad, se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización D. comales  y ollas D. barro, ella vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos D. 28, 24, 19, 14  años D. edad, los dos últimos dependen económicamente D. ella. El negocio tiene ya 28 años D. realizarlo trabajando con su esposo y con la ayuda D. sus hijos, su horario es D. 8:00am a 5:30pm, este oficio lo aprendió D. su madre.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. loza cruda, y materia prima, como barro, leña, nacazcol; el préstamo le servirá para incrementar el inventario D. su negocio y por enD. sus ventas.
Sus aspiraciones son incrementar el negocio, en nivel D. venta como ofrecer variedad D. productos, en su familia le gustaría apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios y a nivel personal que Dios le regale salud para no padecer enfermedades e incurrir en gastos y pagar adecuadamente el préstamo.
texts.en:
Martha lives in Guatajiagua, in Morazán department.  She is 49 years old and works making and selling clay 'comales' (dishes for cooking tortillas) and pots.  She lives with her husband and her 4 children aged 28, 24, 19 and 14.  The two youngest are still financially dependent on her.  She has been in this business for 28 years.  She works with her husband and with the help of her children.  She works from 8.00am to 5.30pm.  She learned the traD. from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to buy unfired earthenware and raw materials such as clay, firewood and nacazcol (a dye).  The loan will be used to increase her business inventory and, consequently, her sales.

Martha's aspirations are to increase her business both in terms of sales as well as being able to offer a wiD. range of products.  Her aspirations for her family are to support her children in their studies and on a personal level.  She hopes that God grants her good health so that she doesn't suffer from any illnesses and thereby incur expenses.  She also aims to pay her loan on time.

loans.use: To buy clay, firewood and nacazcol (a dye)

loans.name: Elvia Noemi

texts.es:
Elvia, reside en Delicias de Concepción, departamento de Morazán,  vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, se dedica a la confección y venta de hamacas, tiene 28 años de edad, y de estar al frente de este negocio lleva 6 años trabajando todo el día, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre quien se lo enseño muy bien.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la confección de las hamacas como hilo de seda de diferentes colores, con esta inversión ella pretende incrementar su producción y sus ventas, ofreciéndoles a los clientes hamacas de diferentes colores y tamaños.
Su aspiración es mejorar su vivienda y dar a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que se preparen  y puedan optar por un estilo de vida diferente.
texts.en:
Elvia is 28 years old and lives in Delicias de Concepción in the department of Morazán with her husband and her two children, who are 8 and 10 years old.  She manufactures and sells hammocks.  She has had this business for six years, and she learned it from her mother, who taught her very well.

She is asking for this loan to purchase materials to manufacture hammocks, such as silk thread in different colors.  With this investment, she would like to increase her production and sales by offering her customers hammocks in different colors and sizes.

Her dream is to improve her home and give her children the necessary education so that they can choose a different way of life.

loans.use: Purchase silk thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase carpentry tools

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, se dedica  a la crianza de pollos de engorde, tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años, residen en Meanguera Departamento de Morazán, él trabaja junto a su esposa en la crianza y engorde de pollos desde hace dos años.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos pequeños y el alimento para los mismos, vitaminas, antibióticos y vacunas, para dar el mejor cuido posible a la granja e incrementar la posibilidad de crecerlos y comercializarlos a buen precio.
Su proyección es tener una granja grande y bien establecida que produzca muchos pollos para la venta y de esta manera ir mejorando su condición económica, mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos tengan acceso a la educación.
texts.en:
Carlos is 23 years old and lives with his wife and three year old child in Meanguera in the department of Morazán.  He and his wife have worked together for two years raising broiler chickens.

He is asking for a loan to purchase chicks and food for them, including vitamins, antibiotics, and vaccines in order to give them the best care possible and increase the possibility that they will reach adulthood and be sold for a good price.

His dream is to have a large and well established farm that produces many chickens for sale so that he can improve his financial status, improve his home, and give his children access to education.

loans.use: Purchase chickens, vitamins, antibiotics, and feed

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es:
Israel de 35años de edad es soltero, vive en union libre con la Sra. Felicia Lopez con quien tiene tiene 2 hijos: Minerva de 15 años cursando el 1er año de secundaria y la menor Israelita de 3 añitos, que aun no estudia.  

Israel labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como operario de limpieza desde hace 3 años. Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de continuar con la construccion de su casa, pues el credito anterior le sirvio para iniciar los arranques y ahora quiere levantar las paredes, para de esta manera ir poco a poco haciendo su casita y brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.  

Sueña con que sus hijos estudien para que cuando sean mayores pueden trabajar y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Israel is 35 years old and single.  Felicia Lopez is his live-in partner, and they have two children.  Minerva, age 15, is in her first year of high school.  Three year old Israelita does not go to school yet.

Israel has been a cleaning workman for the city of Juigalpa for three years.

He is requesting his third loan to continue building his house.  He used the previous loan to start building, and now he wants to raise the walls.  This way he will, little by little, build his house and give his family better living conditions.

He dreams that his children get an education so that when they are grown they will be able to work and have better living conditions.

loans.use: Raise the walls on the house he is building

loans.name: Esther Roman

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito D. Azángaro, provincia D. Azángaro, y departamento D. Puno, tiene 43 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 06 hijos, realizó estudios D. educación primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial  fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. venta D. carne.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar ovejas para su engorD. y venderlas en carne.

Su sueño para es tener más capital para mejorar el negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las charlas y los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the community bank "Azangarinas Valientes", located in the Azángaro district in the province of Azángaro and department of Puno.  She is 43 years old, married, and has six children.  She finished her schooling after elementary school.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, which she used to increase the capital in her business that sells meat.

She is asking for a new loan of 800 nuevos soles to purchase sheep to raise and sell.

Her dream is to have more capital to improve her business.  The things she likes best about her community bank are the lectures and sporting events.

loans.use: Purchase sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old. She lives in the village of Buenaaventura Sialer in the district of Pitipo in the province of Ferrañafe. It is a rural region to the east of the major northern cities of Lambayeque and Chiclayo. She is a single mother with one 17-year-old child. She lives in her family's home.

Rosa manages a small butcher shop. She sells beef, duck, liver, and any number of other meat products that her clients demand. She owns a couple of freezers as well as machines to assist in the processing of the meat. She purchases the meat from local farmers or wholesalers in local markets. Then she sells it to local clients. In addition, Rosa owns a moto-taxi, which she uses to transport her inventory. She also rents it out to a local driver in order to earn additional income.

This will be Rosa's first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to use the loan to increase her daily inventory and her business. Rosa has great references among the community and is very well respected. She cares greatly for her family and works hard every day to provide opportunities to her child. She has a grand spirt and drive.

loans.use: Increase her daily meat inventory

loans.name: Raquel Marie

texts.es:
Raquel de 46 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales estudian y trabajan.  Ella labora para la UNAN como docente desde hace 12 años. 

Esta solicitando  su 7mo credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su vivienda, pues los creditos anteriores han sido utilizados para pintar y continuar la construccion de su casa.  En este momento lo que necesita hacer es ponerle el piso a la casa, ademas construir el porche de la casa.  

Expresa sentirse muy agradecida con AFODENIC y Kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado, ya que gracias a los creditos ha podido ir mejorando poco a poco su casa.
texts.en:
Raquel is 46 years old and married.  She has two children who go to school and work.  She has worked for UNAN (University of Nicaragua) as a teacher for 12 years.

She is requesting her seventh loan to continue making improvements on her house.  The previous loans were used to buy paint and continue building her house.  What she needs to do now is put down the floor of the house and build a porch.

She feels grateful to AFODENIC and Kiva for the support they have given her.  Thanks to the loans she has been able to continue improving her house little by little.

loans.use: Put down a floor and build a porch

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old. She lives along with her partner and their two young children in their own home. They reside in the village of Buenaaventura Siale, located in the district of Pueblo Nuevo in the province of Ferrañafe. It is a rural zone east of the major northern cities of Chiclayo and Lambayeque.

Out of the front of her home, Ana manages a small general store. She sells general needs items including detergent, hygienic supplies, dry foods, candy, vegetables, beverages and beer. She has been running the store for over five years and she is quite well known in the area. She has a loyal client base and stable sales. Her husband works as a laborer for the municipality.

This will be Ana's first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to use the loan proceeds to increase her inventory in anticipation of the holiday season. She expects sales to increase during this period and she wants to take advantage of current prices and ensure that she is able to supply for her clients' needs. Ana is a dedicated businesswoman and mother. She hopes to be able to continue providing for her children and maintain their schooling, even through university.

loans.use: to increase her inventory in anticipation of the holiday season

loans.name: Francisca Ynes

texts.en:
Francisca is 40 years old. She lives near the coastal town of Pimentel which lies twenty minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo. It is a desert region primarily populated by fisherman, artisans and small animal raisers. She shares her home with her partner and her two young children.

Francisca works as a teacher in a local school, primarily teaching reading and writing. She enjoys sharing her knowledge and bettering the education system in her area. At home she raises cuyes (guinea pigs) and other small animals. These function as an additional income source, a source of food and a savings vehicle. She sells the animals in local markets. Her husband is a public transit driver.

This will be Francisca's first loan with Edpyme Alterntiva. She has requested the funds in order to make some general improvements to her home and to purchase additional balanced feed for her animals. She wants to be able to take advantage of current prices and create a better living standard for her family.

loans.use: to make general improvements to her home and to purchase additional balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
Adriano is 59 years old. He lives along with his wife and one dependent child in the city of Chiclayo in northern Peru. It is one of the larger cities in Peru with a large commercial district and many famous markets. The family maintains a happy and stable home.

For several years now, Adriano has driven a taxi cab in the region. He transports passengers to and from work, shopping trips or social gatherings as needed. It is a well-received and competitive service in the city due to the relatively few personal vehicles that families own. Most of the population relies on private transit operators such as Adriano.

Currently Adriano finds himself in need of a loan in order to make repairs to his vehicle and complete standard maintenance. He hopes the investment will reduce his ongoing expenses and protect his vehicle so that it can continue to earn him money. He is a happy and outgoing individual who works hard to better the life of his family. He hopes to see his child become a professional one day.

loans.use: to make repairs to his vehicle and complete standard maintenance

loans.name: Torbio

texts.en:
Torbio is sixty-seven years old.  He and his wife live in the village Cusupe near Monsefu, in the province of Lambayeque about forty minutes outside of the major city of Chiclayo.  The two maintain a happy and stable home.  They do not have any children that live with them.

Torbio and his wife raise animals in the field behind their home.  They have a wide range of animals, including sheep, rabbits, and guinea pigs.  They raise these animals for their meat and to sell them in local markets.  In addition to raising animals, Torbio's wife makes sombreros which she sells to locals or in regional artisan markets.  At times Torbio will work as a farm hand in order to assist his neighbors and earn extra income for the family.

This will be Torbio's second loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  He used the previous loan to expand his herd and purchase feed for his animals.  He is requesting this loan so that he can purchase more sheep and begin to raise more medium sized animals.  He is proud to see his business grow and to better his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa de 43 años de edad es soltera, tiene una niña de 7 añitos de nombre Leymi estudiando 2do grado de primaria; Josefa labora para el MINED Santo Tomas desde hace 15 años como directora en el Ner La Union, ubicada en la comarca el Guabo. 

Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en un pequeño patio que le regalo su papa y asi poder brindarle a su pequeña hija mejor comodidad. 

Su mayor sueño es poder terminar su vivienda y contar con las condiciones basicas para vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Josefa is 43 years old and single.  She has a seven year old daughter, Leymi, who is in the second grade.

Josefa has worked for the Saint Thomas MINED (Ministry of Education) for 15 years.  She is the head teacher at Ner La Union, which is located in the Guabo region.

She is requesting her third loan to build a room on a small patio that her father gave her.  That way she will be able to make her little daughter more comfortable.

Her greatest dream is to be able to finish her house and have the basic living conditions in order to live decently.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is fifty-six years old.  She lives in the village of Huaca Parita in the district of Pitipo near the city of Chiclayo.  It is a rural region with a rich cultural history and many ancient mud brick ruins.  Eualalia and her husband own the home in which they live.

Eualia owns two hectares of arable land.  She has planted corn in half her land—which is nearing maturity—and recently transplanted onions to the other half.  She has had these properties for a number of years. Edpyme Alternativa has worked with her in the past in order to assist with the maintenance and planting of the crops.

The current loan is requested in order to hire field workers for the maintenance of Eulalia's crops and the harvest.  She hopes to be able to provide a reasonable employment to some of her neighbors and other locals and to reap an appropriate profit that will help her maintain her own household and be able to continue planting.  The use of laborers increases the crop yield significantly and betters the product.

loans.use: To hire field workers for the maintenance of crops and the harvest

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
Enriqueta de 44 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar,labora para el Hospital Asuncion desde hace 20 años como operadora de microcomputadora, ademas vende productos AVON y ZERMAT para obtener ingresos adicionales. 

Esta solicitando  su 6to credito con el objetivo de construir un sumidero para los servicios higienicos de su casa, pues desea hacer el inodoro, y como su patio es pequeño le resultaria mejor esta construccion.  

Expresa sentirse agradecida con AFODENIC ya que con los creditos obtenidos ha ido poco a poco ir construyendo su casita.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is 44 years old and single.  She has two school age children.

For twenty years she has worked as a microcomputer operator for the Asuncion hospital.  She also sells Avon and Zermat products to get additional income.

She is requesting her sixth loan to build a drain for hygienic services for her house.  She wants to put in a lavatory.  As her patio is small, it will be better with this construction.

She is grateful to AFODENIC because the loans that she has received have been to, little by little, build her house.

loans.use: Put in a drain for hygienic services

loans.name: Ivaneza Milagro

texts.en:
Ivaneza is thirty-one years old.  She lives in the village of Huaca Parita in the district of Pitpo, near the cities of Ferrañafe and Chiclayo.  It is a rural region with a rich history, including ancient mud brick ruins that form hills in the region.  Invaneza lives along with her husband and their seven-year-old daughter.  She and her husband own their home.

Ivaneza owns a small plot of land on which she and her husband plant crops.  They usually plant corn or onions.  Currently they have a crop of onions nearing maturity.  In addition, the two work as farm hands for their neighbors or larger farms in order to support the local economy and earn additional income.  They are very well respected in the region for their hard work and they have good references.

Ivaneza has worked with us before in the past, taking out loans to maintain crops or make other improvements to her fields.  The current loan is intended for the payment of field laborers.  The use of additional help greatly increases the productivity of the farm and spreads out the responsibility and income across the community, a support which Ivaneza is happy to participate in.

loans.use: To hire field laborers

loans.name: Ascencion

texts.en:
Ascension is 46 years old. She lives in the village of La Curva in the district of Pitpo near the city of Ferreñafe. It is a rural region near the city of Chiclayo and is primarily populated by small farmers. She owns her home and is single.

Ascension is a very entrepreneurial woman. She has three separate income-generating activities which assist her in maintaining a stable income across the year and across various business cycles. First, she manages a small storefront out of her home. She sells basic goods to her neighbors, including detergent, hygienic supplies, fruits, vegetables, rice, beverages and candy. She also raises small animals in the yard behind her home. Finally, from her small beehive she raises bees and harvests honey, which she sells in her store or to local artisan dealers.

The requested loan will be used to expand the inventory in her general store. She finds that she often does not have enough goods to make sales for the full day and that her clients at times are searching for items that are not in stock. She would like to increase her inventory in order to take advantage of this additional demand. She also plans to use the funds to improve her other activities and support herself in general.

loans.use: to expand the inventory in her store

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras” ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 04 hijos, la señora tiene estudios de educación primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le permitió  incrementar el capital de su negocio de confección de polos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para incrementar su mercadería de su negocio de confección de polos.
	
Su sueño para el futuro es tener más telas para la fabricación de su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad de pago.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the “Las Mensajeras” (Messengers) community bank which is located in Juliaca district, in San Román province, in the department of Puno.  She is 48 years old, married and has 4 children.  She completed her primary education.

Eugenia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which allowed her to increase the working capital of her business making polo shirts.

She is requesting a new loan for 700 nuevos soles which she will use to increase the merchandise of her business.

Her dream for the future is to have more fabric for her business.

What she most likes about her community bank is the ease of payment.

loans.use: To increase the merchandise of her business making polo shirts

loans.name: Mirna Maria

texts.es:
Doña Mirna de 49 años de edad es soltera, sus hijos son mayores y tienen su propia familia. Mirna laboró para el Hospital Asuncion como enfermera, pero ahora esta jubilada por lo que recibe una pension mensual, ademas se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos AVON Y ZERMAT para obtener ingresos adicionales para sus gastos. 

Esta solicitando  su 6to credito con el objetivo de construir los servicios higienicos de su casa, ya que actualmente se encuentran en mal estado.  

Expresa que gracias a los creditos obtenidos en AFODENIC ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia y espera poder seguir trabajando con esta institucio para continuar mejorando su casa .
texts.en:
Mirna is 49 years old and single.  Her children are grown and have their own families.

Mirna worked as a nurse for the Asuncion Hospital.  She is now retired and receives a monthly pension.  She also sells Avon and Zermat cosmetics in order to get additional income for her expenses.

She is requesting her sixth loan to build a lavatory in her house.  What she now has is in bad condition.

She is grateful for the loans she has received from AFODENIC.  She has managed to improve her living conditions and those of her family.  She hopes to be able to keep working with this institution in order to continue improving her house.

loans.use: To build a lavatory

loans.name: Dionisia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Dionisia de 33 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Noel Miranda con quien tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Dionisia labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como Auxiliar de presupuesto desde hace 8 años. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto para brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien asume los gastos del hogar. 

Espresa que despues solicitara otro credito para seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia pues lo que mas desea es que sus hijas tengan mayores comodidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
Dionisia, 33, and her husband, Sr. Noel Miranda, have two school-aged children.  Dionisia has worked as an assistant budget analyst for the town government of Juigalpa for 8 years. 

Dionisia is applying for this loan to add a room to her house, a project that will greatly contribute to her family's comfort.  She can count on support from her husband who is picking up responsbility for other household expenses.

Dionisia says that she will apply for other loans in the future so that she can continue to improve the house because she wants her daughters to have the best possible living arrangements.

loans.use: Add room to house.

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: La señora Martha Rosa R., tiene la edad de 50 años habita con  su esposo en las pilas orientales, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, todos sobreviven de manera independiente, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 13 años. Años en los que se han enfrentado a problemas con la infección de los roedores, que disminuyen la producción de las siembras, es para la erradicación de este problema, que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insecticidas y fertilizantes que aporten un mantenimiento fito sanitario que combata el problema y les permita aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su capital de trabajo para la inversión a nuevas fuentes de ingreso a favor del bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Sra. Martha Rosa R., 50, lives with her husband in Las Pilas Orientales.  They have 3 grown children, all independent.  Sra. Martha and her husband have operated a farm for 13 years, years in which they have faced problems with rodents that destroy much of what they grow.  Sra. Martha is applying for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers to implement a treatment plan that will combat the problem.  The project will allow her to increase her yields and, in turn, her working capital, money for investing in new sources of income that will benefit her family.

loans.use: Mantenimiento Fitosanitario

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia C. R., es una joven casada de 29 años de edad habitante de las Pilas Orientales un barrio rural del municipio de Ticuantepe, ellos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad, el mayorcito se dedica a estudiar la escuela primaria, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 10 años, fue gracias al apoyo de su esposo y su suegro que ellos comenzaron a laborar en esta actividad, ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insecticidas, que permitan un mantenimiento fitosanitario que mejore la producción aumente los volúmenes de venta y les permita la adquisición a futuro de una camioneta que transporte las cosechas para su rápida distribución venta, recuperación de la inversión y las utilidades que mejoren continuamente sus niveles de vida a todos los miembros de su familia.
texts.en: Sra. Karla Patricia C. R., 29, lives in Las Pilas Orientales, a rural area of Ticuantepe.  She and her husband have 2 young children, the older of whom is in elementary school.  They have operated a farming business for 10 years, a business that they started with help from her father-in-law.  They are applying for a loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides and pesticides to implement a soil treatment plan, a project that will improve their yields and, in turn, their sales.  In the future, the extra income will allow them to buy a truck so that they can move their crop to market more quickly.  The investment will contribute to their efforts to improve their business and their quality of life.

loans.use: Soil treatment plan for farming business.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Maria B. A. tiene la edad de 34 años, vive en el barrio San Ignacio, habita acompañada de su pareja de vida, tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que se dedican a estudiar la escuela de primaria, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 9 años, años en los cuales uno de los principales problemas a los que se han enfrentado ha sido la afectación de los gases emitidos por el volcán que afectan la producción de sus cosechas, fue gracias al apoyo de su papa que logro iniciarse en esta actividad que ha sido el sustento económico de la familia, a futuro espera adquirir un terreno más amplio para multiplicar sus siembras, ella solicita una préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, insumos, e insecticidas que favorezcan las ventas y las condiciones de su familia para óptimos recursos con el objetivo de solventar el gasto económico de los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en: Sra. Rosa Maria B. A., 34, lives in the San Ignacio area.  She lives with her life partner and they have 2 young children, both in elementary school.  Sra. Rosa and her partner have operated a farming busness for 9 years, during which they have faced down a volcano!
