María has a business buying and selling plastic products.  She works from Thursday to Sunday in her town as these are the busiest days in the area.  She begins working at 8.00am and works until 5.00pm which is when she closes.  She buys her products in Guayaquil, from a factory called Plasti Sud.  She has had this business for five years.

This loan will be used to buy products for this month's sales.  She has been a member of her community bank for 15 years and she is very happy.  She likes the seriousness of her fellow bank members.  Her dream is to have a bigger business with other branches.

loans.use: To buy plastic products

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas D. Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, estado civil casada, con tres hijos y grado D. instrucción primaria incompleta.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace siete años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que pudo utilizar en la compra y venta D. animales menores. Actualmente tiene nueva actividad que es la venta D. queso, carne, papa, y quinua. Estos productos son llevados desD. Ilave hacia la ciudad D. Tacna.   
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio y verlos profesional a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es trabajar en grupo.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a member of the community bank "Brisas D. Rio Blanco", located in the district of Pilcuyo in the province in El Collao in the department of Puno.  She is 53 years old, married, and has three children.  She did not finish primary school.

She began working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos seven years ago.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase livestock to raise and sell.  She currently sells cheese, meat, potatoes, and quinoa.  These products are brought from the capital of Tacna.

She is asking for a new loan for 3000 nuevos soles to increase the capital in her business.  

Her dream is to continue improving her business and see her children become professionals.  The thing she likes best about the community bank is working together.

loans.use: Increase the capital in her business

loans.name: Hipolinaria

texts.es:
Hipolinaria  es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas D. Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 56 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con seis hijos, tiene grado D. instrucción D. primero D. secundaria.
Hipolinaria viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace tres años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, le sirvió para  incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. aquellos años que era la compra y venta D. ovejas, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en la Región Tacna.  
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital  D. su negocio.
Su sueño es progresar y seguir adelante en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas.
texts.en:
Hipolinaria is a member of the “Brisas D. Rio Blanco” community bank which is located in Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, in the department of Puno.  She is 56 years old, married and has six children.  She completed the first year of her secondary education.

Hipolinaria has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business which, back then, was buying and selling sheep.  She currently works selling groceries in Tacna region.

She is requesting a new loan for 3,000 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to make progress and succeed in her business.  What she most likes about her community bank are the talks.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Hiraldia Dulia

texts.es:
Hiraldia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras”  ubicado en el distrito de Cabanilla,  provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera y con 01 hijo, la señora tiene estudios de educación superior.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 años,  nos cuenta que su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de productos cosméticos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar mas mercadería.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital y poner otros negocios.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la organización y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Hiraldia is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women) community bank which is located in Cabanilla district, Lampa province, in the department of Puno.  She is 29 years old, single and has one child.  She finished her higher education.

Hiraldia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 1 year.  She tells us that her original loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling cosmetics.

She is requesting a new loan for 500 nuevos soles which she will use to buy more merchandise.

Her dream for the future is to have more capital and to set up other businesses.

What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings, the organization and the punctuality.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Bertilda Armanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Armanda es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y esta muy feliz ya que de la decisión que tomaron hace muchos años han podido recibir ayuda no solo ella si no también sus compañeras del Banco. Tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación procreo 5 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven aun con ella, además de dos nietos que los quiere como que si fueran de ella.

Tiene una pequeña panadería donde además de pan fabrica y vende deliciosos pasteles, nos cuenta que es lo que más le gusta hacer ya que se divierte decorando sus obras que son muy apreciadas por las personas que conocen lo que ella hace. Trabaja todos los días desde las  5am hasta la noche que se encarga de dejar todo listo para el nuevo día, vende en su pequeño local.  También vende joyas de fantasía, productos que compra en Portoviejo cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar harina y otros productos necesarios para la fabricación del pan y sus pasteles. Sus sueños son gozar de buena salud y formar una microempresa de fabricación de pasteles.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 'San Esteban' community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Armanda is a founding member of her community bank and she is very happy since, because of the decision they took many years ago, herself and her fellow bank members have been able to receive help.  Armanda is 57 years old.  She is married and has 5 grown-up children.  Three of her children still live with her as well as two grandchildren who she loves as if they were her own children.

Armanda has a small bakery where she not only bakes and sells bread but also delicious cakes.  She tells us that this is what she most likes doing because she enjoys decorating her cakes which are very much admired by the people who know what she does.  She works every day from 5.00am until the evening when she makes sure everything is ready for the next day.  She sells her products from her small premises.  Armanda also sells costume jewelry which she buys in Portoviejo every fortnight.

This loan will be used to buy flour and other products which she needs to make her bread and cakes.  Armanda's dreams are to enjoy health and to create a small cake-making business.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter, eggs, sugar, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Jesica Irene

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Irene, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años, el mayor esta en primero de educación básica. Su esposo es agricultor. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya dos años y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que su tienda es pequeña pero que tiene de todo, ya son 7 años que lleva con ella y dice que su tienda es su vida ya que en ella además de ganarse el sustento de su familia también se distrae con sus amigas que llegan hasta su local. Su mercadería la compra en Rocafuerte y Portoviejo.  También recibe en su local parte de la mercadería.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mas productos para surtir aun mas su tienda. Su sueño es tener un mini market con todas las comodidades para sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 'San Esteban' community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find Irene who is 29 years old, married and has two children aged 5 and 3.  Her oldest child is in their first year of elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer.  Irene has been a member of her community bank for two years and she likes it because the interest rates are very low.

Irene has a small convenience store.  She works there every day from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  She tells us that her store may be small but it sells a bit of everything.  She has had the business for 7 years and tells us that her store is her life since it helps her to support her family and she also has enjoys spending time there, chatting to friends who call by.  She buys her goods in Rocafuerte and Portoviejo.  She also receives deliveries of some of her goods directly to her store.

This loan will be used to buy more products to better stock her store.  Her dream is to own a mini market with all the conveniences her customers need.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, eggs, soda, oil, etc.

loans.name: Celestino Cesar

texts.en:
Celestino is 50 years old. He lives near the city of Chiclayo in northern Peru. He shares his home with his partner. They do not have any children that live at home anymore.

Celestino owns a mototaxi. He drives it in and around the city of Chiclayo providing general transport to the residents. This is a well-received, but competitive business given that very few individuals have their own vehicles and rely on the various private transport companies and individuals to meet their daily needs. In addition to driving the mototaxi, Celestino works as a guard at the Ministry of Agriculture at night.

Celestino has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past. He has a very good repayment history and has always used credit responsibly. He plans to use this loan to make necessary repairs to his mototaxi and to make several improvements to his home. He hopes this will improve his overall quality of life and reduce the ongoing daily expenses of maintaining his mototaxi. He is a dedicated husband and hardworking man.

loans.use: mototaxi maintenance and home improvements

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Digna es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben para incrementar su negocio. Tiene 59 años, está casada y fruto de  relación tuvo cuatro hijos ya todos son mayores de edad pero el menor de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una compañía.
 
Es un ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (perfumería, artículos de belleza y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 16h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que aprovecha las ofertas cuando los productos salen más baratos y que cuando pasa la promoción los vende a precio normal con lo que se gana un dinero extra.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos e invertir mas en los que estén de oferta ya que estos  le dejan mayores ganancias. Su sueño es gozar de buena salud ella y los suyos para seguir en su trabajo ya que le gusta lo que hace.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 'San Esteban' community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Digna is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it for the help which she receives to increase her business.  Digna is 59 years old.  She is married and has four grown-up children.  Her youngest child still lives with her.  Her husband works for a company.

Digna is a housewife but in order to help with the household expenses she also sells Avon products (perfumes, beauty products and ladies' accessories).  She works every day from 8.00am to 4.00pm and makes her sales door to door.  She tells us that she takes advantage of offers when products are cheap and when the offers are over she sells the products at their regular price which makes her extra money.

This loan will be used to buy products and invest more in those that are on offer since they make her the most profit.  Her dream is for herself and her family to enjoy good health and for her to continue in her work because she likes what she does.

loans.use: To buy perfume, beauty products and ladies' accessories

loans.name: Azucena Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos  a la señora Mariana, tiene 60 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 5 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, la ultima hija vive con ella en su casa. Su marido es comerciante de ganado.  Ella es parte del Banco Comunal hace ya 5 ciclos y está muy a gusto por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Es una muy buena ama de casa que además se dedica a atender su negocio, tiene una boutique en el centro de Charapoto, local que es arrendado y que lo tiene desde hace varios años. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 17h00, en su local vende ropa y zapatos de todo tipo y precios ya que vende productos nacionales e importados. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada quince días o una vez al mes dependiendo de las ventas que se hayan realizado.

Este crédito es para comprar mas mercadería para surtir la boutique. Sus sueños son tener su propio local para ya no pagar mas arriendo y algún día comprar un carro.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 'San Esteban' community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find 60 year-old Mariana who is married and has 5 grown-up children.  Her youngest daughter lives with her in her home.  Mariana's husband is a cattle salesman.  She has been with her community bank for 5 loan cycles and is very happy with the ease of obtaining a loan.

Mariana is a good housewife who also serves in her business.  She has a boutique in the center of Charapoto.  Her premises are rented and she has had them for several years.  She works every day from 8.00am to 5.00pm in her premises selling clothes and footwear of all kinds and at all prices.  She sells both national and imported products.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every fortnight or once a month, depending on the sales she has made.

Mariana will use this loan to buy more merchandise to stock her boutique.  Her dreams are to have her own premises so that she no longer has to pay rent and also some day to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.en:
Jessica is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children in a home which they own in the district of Tambogrande. It is a tropical region which is primarily populated by farmers and people who raise animals. There is also a small commercial sector.

Jessica sells clothing out of her home and in the streets. She has a number of loyal clients and is well known within the region. In addition, Jessica sells soy juice and tamales to the locals during breakfast and lunch hours. Her husband is a nurse in a nearby town and he comes home on a monthly basis to support her and spend time with the family.

This loan will be used to purchase additional clothing for sale. Jessica hopes to be able to expand her inventory and thereby increase the number of clients she reaches. By slowly building her business, she plans to increase her profits and the quality of life for her family. Jessica is well respected in the region and is a very hard worker. We are happy to be able to provide her with a loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing for sale

loans.name: Peetronila

texts.en:
Petronila, 63-years-old, lives in the district of Tambogrande, a rural zone with many small fruit plantations and individuals who raise animals. She owns her home and shares it with her husband and their 26-year-old daughter. Her daughter works independently.

For some time now, Petronila has worked as a seamstress. She owns two sewing machines and she provides general repair and sewing services to her neighbors. She is especially skilled at producing and repairing suits and tuxes. Her husband is a street vendor with a significant number of loyal clients. He sells his products on credit, recovering repayments on a bi-weekly basis.

The requested loan will be invested in additional fabric and other sewing items. The family hopes to be able to improve their output and profits. Petronila is well respected in the region and has good references. She is proud of her work and believes that the demand in the region will allow her to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: invest in additional fabric and other sewing items

loans.name: Denis Jhoel

texts.en:
Denis is 19 years old. He lives in his parents' home with his father, mother and four other brothers and sisters in Tambogrande. This region is tropical and the majority of the population works on small fruit plantations or raises animals.

Denis sells fish out of his home and in the streets around his neighborhood. He purchases the fish in the nearby city of Piura and transports it to Tambogrande for resale. He works Mondays through Fridays. He also assists his mother in her small restaurant where she sells chicha (a traditional beverage), full meals and small appetizers.

Denis plans to use the loan proceeds to purchase additional fish and expand his inventory. He hopes to be able to increase his market share and sales. In this way, he believes he will be able to increase his monthly income and improve his family's quality of life. He is a hardworking and entrepreneurial young man with big dreams for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and expand his inventory

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo lives in the village of San Pedrillo in the district of Tambogrande, a tropical region in which the majority of the population manages small fruit plantations and raises animals. Maximo owns his home and shares it with his wife and their two children. They maintain a stable and happy home.

The family owns approximately one and three-quarters hectares of land on which they grow mangos and limes. They manage to harvest ten baskets of limes off the property each week, which they sell to local fruit companies. In addition, they have one milk cow and a small herd of sheep which they raise for their meat and sell in the local market. 

Maximo plans to use this loan to purchase additional feed for his animals and fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. He expects that these purchases will increase the family’s productivity. It is his dream that his children become professionals and receive a good education. For this reason, he works hard every day in order to improve his family’s income and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for his animals and fertilizer and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.en:
Jose lives in the village of San Pedrillo in the district of Tambogrande.  It is a tropical zone in northern Peru that is largely populated by individuals who work on small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Jose maintains a stable home along with his partner and their two children.  He is twenty-nine years old.

Jose has a number of income sources.  First, he and his family raise animals in the space behind their home.  The have a number of sheep and cows that they raise for their meat and secondary products.  Jose also manages a small plot of land that he inherited from his parents on which he cultivates limes.  In addition to these activities, he works as a security guard for a large farm in the area.  Between these three activities, Jose earns a relatively stable income which assists him in providing for his family.

The requested loan will be used to purchase feed for his animals and additional items for his farm in order to improve production.  It will be his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  He hopes to be able to increase his family’s income and improve their quality of life.  In particular, he hopes to be able to provide a better education to his children than that to which he had access.

loans.use: Purchase feed for his animals and additional items for his farm in order to improve production

loans.name: Nancy Yanine

texts.en:
Nancy lives in the district of Tambogrande, a tropical zone in Northern Peru. The area is primarily populated by individuals who work on small fruit plantations or raise animals. Nancy owns her own home, which she shares with her young daughter. She is a single mother, aged twenty-two.

Nancy sells clothing. She works as a street vendor, sometimes setting up a small display and, at other times, carrying her wares around busy areas. It is a difficult business, but well appreciated by the locals as it offers quick access to general items. In addition to selling clothing, Nancy raises chickens, ducks and turkeys, which she later sells in local markets. From these two activities, Nancy is able to stabilize her income and provide for her daughter.

This will be Nancy’s first loan from Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to use the funds to expand her clothing inventory through a bulk purchase. She hopes the improvement in her supply will increase her sales and her profit. Nancy has big dreams for her future and the future of her daughter. She hopes to be able provide an education for her daughter and to see her become a professional.

loans.use: To expand her clothing inventory

loans.name: Jesus Amada

texts.en:
Jesus lives in the village of Viviano Espinoza in the district of Las Lomas in the province of Piura. She is a single mother. She owns her home and lives with her two young children. She is 50 years old.

Jesus manages a small general store in the front of her home from which she sells basic items such as soap, food items and drinks. She sells beauty products to her neighbors from the Esika brand which provides opportunities to women with low resources. She can be found in her store on a daily basis making sales morning, noon and night.

This will be Jesus’s first loan with Edpmye Alternativa. She has good references and is well respected in the neighborhood. She plans to use the loan to increase her inventory and better meet her client’s needs. In this way, she hopes to improve the opportunities for her family and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and better meet her client’s needs

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Heremelinda is forty-five years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a home that they own. They resiD. in the village of Viviano Espinoza in the district of Las Lomas in the province of Piura. It is a traditional agrarian area in which many residents have small mango or lemon plantations and raise animals.

Hermelinda sells clothing to her neighbors and other residents of the region. On a daily basis, she travels the streets showing her products. Her children assist in the business as well, now that they are old enough to work semi-independently. Hermelinda’s husband is a public transit driver, running one of the many small buses that crisscross the region.

This will be Hermelinda’s first loan with our institution. She has good references and is well respected in her neighborhood. She plans to use the loan to expand her clothing inventory so that she can improve customer satisfaction and increase her monthly sales. She hopes to be able to increase her family’s income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to expand her clothing inventory

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is forty years old. He owns his home and shares it with his wife and their two young children. They live in the district of Tambogrande, specifically in the village of Guaraguaos Bajo. It is a rural region and fairly tropical. The majority of the population work on small fruit plantations and raise animals.

Roberto owns a small parcel of land which he inherited from his parents. He raises limes on that land and also has a small herd of sheep. These activities provide his family with a relatively constant income stream and a small level of protection in hard times.

The loan will be used to purchase additional farm products to protect his trees and improve production. He hopes to be able to increase his family's income and to provide for the ongoing education of his children. He is very hard working and well respected in the region.

loans.use: to purchase additional farm products

loans.name: Olga Yojany

texts.en:
Olga is a thirty-two-year-old, single mother. She lives with her two children in the village of Viviano Espinoza in the district of Tambogrande. She owns her home. The region is tropical and residents are primarily involved in the raising of animals and the production of fruits.

Olga sells beauty products from the line Unique. She has a good number of loyal clients and makes two purchases a month to meet customer demand.  She attends to her clients on a regular basis, taking new orders and promoting other products. In addition to selling beauty products Olga raises ducks, chickens and turkeys in the rear part of her home. From these two activities Olga is able to maintain a relatively stable income stream.

This will be Olga’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to use the loan to make larger monthly purchases to better serve her clients and increase her monthly income. She also plans to purchase additional balanced feed for her animals, which she will raise to full size to take advantage of the higher selling prices during the holiday season. Olga is a very hard working woman and is well respected in the community. We are excited to work with her and to provide this credit.

loans.use: to make larger, monthly stock purchases

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer is a wife of J. D. and resides in a city called Sumandri in Pakistan. Her husband runs the family business, a bakery.  Her home is a small one and contains only two rooms.  Anwer is the mother of seven children: three daughters and four sons. Her oldest three sons work with their father in the bakery, and the youngest doesn’t do anything and stays at home. Her three daughters help Anwer in managing the household chores.

In the family bakery, they make and sell different items like biscuits, bread, and vegetable rolls to their customers. They also supply bakery items to different general stores as well. They started this business about a year ago and fortunately, due to the good quality and taste of their products, they have successfully won over many customers.   

Anwer has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her family business. With her portion of this group loan, Anwer's husband will purchase ingredients for baking in larger quantities that will help him to fulfill bigger orders and, hopefully, to make more money.   She is hopeful that the investment will be profitable for her family business and that her family's standard of living will improve.  She is a new loan applicant at Asasah and this is her first loan application.

Note: In the photo that accompanies this profile, the woman holding the Asasah Passbook is Anwer.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for a bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase nuts to roast and sell

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is married with two sons, both of whom work in a factory on a monthly salary. She lives in a small city named Samundri in the Punjab area of  Pakistan, which is known for its agriculture. She has been living there since she got married.

Naseem is a housewife, stays at home and does her household work. Her husband has a grocery store, located in the market. As grocery stores are considered to be some of the most profitable businesses, in every community there are two to three grocery stores available. Due to this, the competition is increasing day by day among grocery store owners and the only way to win business from the other grocery stores is to be better stocked than the competition.

Therefore, Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With her portion of this group loan, he will purchase the groceries in bulk quantity that will enable him to compete with the other grocery shops and in fulfill the demands of his customers.  Naseem is hopeful that with the help of this investment that her husband will successfully be able to get the desired results from his business.  This is her first loan application with Asasah and she hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.

Note: In the photo that accompanies this profile, the woman holding the Asasah Passbook is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a grocery store.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. His shop is located in the market. He has been involved in this business for past eight years. Now because there are more grocery stores in the same street he is facing tough competition which is affecting his sales. To overcome this problem, he has decided to sell grocery items in bulk quantity.  Naseem and her husband hope the loan Naseem receives from Asasah will prove helpful for the growth of his business.

Naseem is the mother of two sons and two daughters. None of them could get an education due to poor financial conditions. Both of her sons now work in a hospital for low wages and her daughters stay at home and manage the household chores.  They live in a city named Samundri in Pakistan. Their residence is a three-room brick house.  This is Naseem's first loan application with Asasah. She hopes it will be a profitable experience for her.  

Note: In the photo that accompanies this profile, the woman holding the Asasah Passbook is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy inventory in bulk for a grocery store.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a resident of Sumandri which is a small city in Punjab Pakistan.  It is famous for its agriculture industry.  She lives there in a Christian colony with her family in a 2 room brick house.  She is a housewife who stays home and does her household responsibilities. Her husband operates a spare parts business. Specifically, he sells motorbikes spare parts through his shop.  He has been doing this business for over 20 years. 

Naseem has given birth to 6 children.  One of them works in the army, while 2 sons work with their father in his spare parts shop.  The remaining three children stay at home.  Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business.  With the loan, he will buy spare parts for motorbikes in bulk quantity so that he can fulfull his customer's orders on a timely basis.
 
She is hopeful that with the help of this loan investment, her husband’s business will grow further and it will result in better financial conditions for the family. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application.  In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy motorbikes spare parts for the spare parts business.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Samundri, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan. It is known for its agriculture industry. She lives in the area named Christian colony, which is a residential area of city Samundri. She moved there 15 years ago with her family. She is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She is a very responsible person who does her work with full concentration.
 
She is married to E. M., who has a painting business. He paints houses and buildings. He has contracts with different building and house owners and finishes the work on an agreed schedule. Razia has a son who earns a meager income as a government employee. She could not provide an education for him, and he had to start a job to financially support the family.
  
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy different colors of paint boxes to offer more variety and better service to his clients. She is hopeful that by using his experience in this profession, her husband will successfully be able to increase his profits. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy paint

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a housewife; she prefers to stay at home and do her household duties. She is very cooperative and is always ready to help her family overcome life's difficulties. She lives in Samundri, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived in her house, which is located in the Christian colony, a residential area of the city, for over 20 years.

Razia has a son who is a painter by profession, painting walls and buildings on order. His clientele base is building and house owners hire him on a contract basis. Razia couldn’t educate him due to poor financial conditions. He contributes to his family financially through his earnings.

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband’s delivery business. He has been in this business for over 7 years. He uses his donkey cart to load items such as construction supplies and fruits and vegetables and delivers the items to designated places. With this loan, he will buy a new donkey cart because the old cart has become rough and rotten, preventing him from loading it fully, which negatively affects his earnings. Razia is hopeful that an investment will help her husband continue his work and serve his customers better.

Razia is a regular lender with Asasah; this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and has never missed a meeting.

Note: In the photo, Razia is holding a book (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy a new donkey cart for her husband's delivery business

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is 23 years old and is from Palestine. He has been working in hairdressing for 5 years now in his own shop which he inherited. Muhammad needed money to pay rent for the current month and to improve the shop by purchasing the tools he needs.

Muhammad came to FATEN to ask for the loan which will improve the shop and increase the number of clients since he will be using much better tools.

Muhammad is cutting a customer's hair in the picture shown here.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To pay off rent and purchase tools

loans.name: Alya

texts.en:
Alya is a wife and a mother of four daughters and two sons. Alya is married to Robin, who owns an auto repair workshop. Alya's husband has been working in this field for eight years now. The workshop is located on the main street and attracts a lot of new customers.

Alya came to FATEN and took out a loan to help her husband pay off the rent and purchase the repair tools he needs in his work. Alya's husband Robin appears in the picture in his workshop because Alya is very religious. 

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the culturA. context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principA. loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To pay off rent and purchase auto repair tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and install a greenhouse

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad is a 24-year-old married man who lives with his wife in a small town in Gaza which is known for its trade and agriculture. In 2008, Ziad opened a bookstore in his small town since there were no bookstores in the area. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to buy new stationery stock for his store and accessories to decorate the store and make it look more welcoming to his customers. He believes that if he receives this loan, it will help him increase his income so he can have a successful business and help his family live a better life.

loans.use: To buy new stationery stock for his store and accessories to decorate the store.

loans.name: Sofonie De Derak Group

texts.en:
Judex is the coordinator of the Sofonie or Zephaniah group. He lives with his wife and son, Judson. He says that his moS.difficult challenge is finding capital to conduct business because the opportunity is present for those who desire to work. 

Judex is excited to be taking his firS.loan with Esperanza after having heard so much about the great things other associates have been able to do with their loans. He plans to use this loan to inveS.in his two main business activities. He will use part of the loan to add to his savings to repair a motorcycle he had previously purchased. With the remaining portion he will inveS.in a homemade mini movie theater. He will buy extra chairs and purchase DVDs as well. He hopes to use the profits to expand his business, enabling him to be a better provider for his family. 

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients generally. His group is located in De Rak. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of Haiti, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To repair a motorcycle and to purchase DVDs and chairs

loans.name: Edulfa Floresmila

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a  la señora Edulfa, tiene 53 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado 5 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, su marido tiene un bar y salón.

Se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja los jueves, viernes y sabados desde las 7am hasta las 17h00, la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza en los campos, lugares a los que se traslada para ofrecer sus productos, como ya conoce a las personas a quienes les vende, les deja a crédito y les cobra en tres partes. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil y Huaquillas cada fin de mes.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería. Ella es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y se desempeña como presidenta del Banco, le gusta por los beneficios que ofrece la institución. Su sueño es tener un carro para ir a vender con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
The “La Rosa de Guadalupe” communal bank meats every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its traditional culture and for its location, minutes from the provincial beaches of San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find Edulfa.  She is 53 years old and is in a live in relationship.  Together she and her partner have had five children, who are all fully grown.  Her partner runs a bar and grill.

She sells all types of clothing, door to door, and works on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM.  She makes most of her sales in rural areas, where she travels to offer her products and where she knows the people well.   She sells on credit and customers pay her in thirds.  At the end of every month, she brings new merchandise in from Guayaquil and Huaquillas.

She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise.  She is a founding member of the communal bank, serves as the bank’s president, and likes the benefits that the bank offers.

She would like to have a car so that she can be more comfortable when making sales calls.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ramón Segundo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Don Ramón tiene 55 años y desde hace muchos años mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, su mujer es comerciante.

Tiene un bar donde vende además de bebidas algunos platos de comida rápida, su especialidad es la venta de carne, la cual según nos dice es deliciosa, trabaja los jueves, viernes, sabados y domingos desde las 9am hasta las 21h00. Sus productos  compra en Rocafuerte y las bebidas las recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos para la venta de la semana, carne y bebidas. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Y le gusta por la responsabilidad del grupo. Sus metas son tener un local mucho más amplio y adecuado para brindar mayor satisfacción a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The La Rosa de Guadalupe communal bank meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto. The city is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Ramón is 55 years and has been in a common-law marriage for several years. He has four children with his common-law wife and they are all adults. His wife is a merchant.

He has a bar where he sells drinks as well as some fast food dishes. His specialty is selling meat which he tells us is delicious. He works Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday from 9am to 9pm. Ramón buys his products in Rocafuerte and has the drinks delivered to his bar.

This loan is to purchase more products (meat and drinks) to sell during the week. This is his fourth loan cycle with the communal bank and he likes the responsibility of the group. His goal is to have a larger and more adequate place of business to provide his customers with greater satisfaction.

loans.use: To purchase drinks and meat

loans.name: Edilma Dioselina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Para la señora Edilma este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque a través de las reuniones a aprendido mucho. Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y de una relación que tuvo tiene 4 hijos de 11, 10, 9 y 4 años, los mayores están en la escuela, tiene una casa propia donde vive con sus hijos.

Tiene un puesto en el mercado de Charapoto donde vende frutas y legumbres, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 17h00, trabaja con la ayuda de su ex suegro. Sus productos los compra a los campesinos que llevan sus productos al mercado y otra parte la compra a comerciantes mayoristas allí mismo en el mercado.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos para surtir su puesto. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y que nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The “La Rosa de Guadalupe” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its traditional culture and for its location, minutes from the provincial beaches of San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This will be Edilma’s third loan cycle with the communal bank.  She likes it because she’s learned a lot in the meetings.  She’s 34 years old and is the single mother of four children, ages 11, 10, 9, and 4.  The oldest are in school and they all live in her home.

She has a stall in the Cahrapoto market, where she sells fruits and vegetables, and works every day from 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM.  She gets help from her former brother in law and buys some of her products from the farmers who take them to market, and the rest from wholesalers at the market itself.

She will use the money from this loan to buy more products to stock her business.  She wants her children to have a good education and not be in need of anything.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Reyna Judid

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Judid, tiene 62  años  de edad y desde hace muchos años mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos ya todos son mayores de edad. Su marido trabaja en la junta de agua potable de Charapoto.

Tiene un puesto en el mercado de Charapoto donde vende frutas y legumbres, trabaja los viernes, sabados y domingos desde las 5am hasta las 18h00. También vende ropa en los días que no esta en el mercado, la ropa la lleva a vender a Pedernales ciudad a la que viaja todos los lunes y regresa los jueves al medio día, se queda en esa ciudad realizando ventas y cobros ya que deja a crédito su mercadería. La ropa la compra en Portoviejo y lo que es frutas y legumbres en el mismo mercado a comerciantes mayoristas.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa ya que es lo que más ganancias le deja.  Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco y le gusta por los créditos. Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 'La Rosa De Guadalupe' community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet Judid.  Judid is 62 years old and has lived with her common-law husband for many years.  She has 3 grown-up children from this relationship.  Judid's husband works for the 'Junta de Agua Potable' (Drinking Water Committee) in Charapoto.

Judid has a stall in Charapoto market where she sells fruit and vegetables.  She works Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays, from 5.00am to 6.00pm.  She also sells clothes on the days she doesn't work in the market.  She takes her clothes to the town of Pedernales to sell.  She travels there every Monday and returns at midday on Thursday.  She stays in the town, selling clothes and also collecting payments since she leaves her goods with her customers on credit.  She buys the clothes in Portoviejo and buys her fruit and vegetables from wholesalers in the same market.

Judid will use this loan to buy clothes since they are what make her the most profits.  This is her third loan cycle with her community bank which she likes because of the loans.  Her dream is to own large premises.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Jaclyn María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jaclyn, tiene 28 años  de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de un año y nueve meses y otro de siete meses.

Ella junto a su esposo tienen una cebichería,  en las tardes su marido trabaja en la finca del papá en la que es el cuidado del ganado, en la cebichería trabajan todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 14h00 o hasta que se termine lo que hayan preparado para el día. Los platos que venden es el ceviche de pescado, camarón, concha y de otros mariscos. A ella le ayuda un hermano de ella.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos para la preparación de los ceviches. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 'La Rosa De Guadalupe' community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet Jaclyn.  She is 28 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has two children from this relationship, one is 21 months old and the other is 7 months old.

Jaclyn and her husband have a 'cebichería' (an eatery where they sell 'ceviche' - raw fish marinated in citrus juice and spiced with chili peppers).  In the afternoons her husband works on his father's farm where he takes care of his cattle.  They both work in the 'cebichería' every day from 6.30am to 2.00pm or until the meals they have prepared run out.  They sell 'ceviche' made from fish, prawns, shellfish and other seafood.  Jaclyn's brother also helps out.

This loan will be used to buy more products for preparing 'ceviche'.  This is Jaclyn's fourth loan cycle with her community bank and she likes the benefits which the institution provides.  Her dream is to have her own premises.

loans.use: To buy fish, prawns, shellfish, tomatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Martha tiene 53 años de edad y está casada hace 30  y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 29 y 22 años,  el menor aun vive con ellos y estudia en la Universidad. Su marido es comerciante.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, tiene muchos clientes que le realizan pedidos  y estos los entrega en su casa. Ella deja sus productos a créditos y cobra semanalmente lo cual es una ventaja ya que a la vez que realiza sus cobros también  hace nuevas ventas. Compra sus productos en Portoviejo, trabaja sola  todos los días y realiza los cobros los días sábados, dice que tiene muchos clientes porque es muy paciente con ellos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mercadería para incrementar su negocio. Es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada por sus facilidades de pago. Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
In the City of Charapoto, the Communal Bank La Rosa de Guadalupe gathers every 15 days.  This district is known for its traditional culture and for being located within minutes of two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.  

Señora Martha is 53 years old and has been married for over 30 years.  From her marriage, she has two children, one of 29 years old and another of 22 years old.  The youngest still lives with her and her husband and studies at the university.  Her husband is a shop owner.  

She works in sales, selling all types of clothing.  She has a lot of clients that make orders, which she then delivers to their house.  She allows her products to be sold by credit and makes weekly collections, which is an advantage since she receives payments while making new sales.  She purchases her products in Portoviejo, works alone every day, and collects her payments on Saturdays.  She says that she has a lot of clients because she is very patient with them.  

This credit will be used to purchase merchandise to increase her business.  It's her fourth cycle in the Communal Bank and she is appreciative of the easy payments.  Her dream is to have her own local shop.

loans.use: Purchase clothes.

loans.name: Matilde De Los Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon  que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Matilde, tiene 62 años de edad y hace varios años su esposo falleció quedando ella viuda y con seis hijos a su cuidado, en la actualidad ya todos mayores de edad, con ella vive una de ellos que es discapacitado.

Tiene un local en su casa donde vende carne asada, cueritos, y chinchurrias, bocadillos que son muy apetecidos por los turistas y personas del lugar. Trabaja de jueves a domingo por las tardes desde las 15h00 hasta las 19h00. Ahora desea incrementar su negocio para vender meriendas por las tardes y noches.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar tres mesas y diez sillas, además de platos, ollas y cucharas para el nuevo negocio que va a iniciar. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace seis ciclos y le gusta el Banco porque gracias a los créditos ha podido salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y que su hijo este bien de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Colon gathers every fifteen days in the Colon parish of the City of Portoviejo, the Manabita Capital known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by many hills.  

Here we find Señora Matilde of 62 years old.  A few years ago, her husband died leaving her as a widow with six children under her care.  Currently, all of them are adults and only one of them live with her because he is disabled.

She has a business in her home where she sells carne asada (grilled beef), cueritos (little fried cakes), chinchurrias (grilled animal intestines), and bocadillos (jellies), which are very popular with tourists and locals.  She works from Thursday to Sunday in the afternoons from 3pm to 7pm.  She would like to expand her business by selling snacks in the afternoon and at night.

This new credit is to purchase three tables and ten chairs, along with plates, pans, and spoons for the new business that she is going to start.  She has been a member of the Communal Bank for over six cycles.  She likes the Bank because thanks to their credit, she has been able to move ahead.  Her dreams are to have a great restaurant and for her son to have good health.

loans.use: Purchase three tables, ten chairs, plates, pans, and spoons.

loans.name: Johana Aide

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon  que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros. En este lugar las personas se dedican a la agricultura en gran parte.

La señora Johana es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta porque gracias a  los créditos a podido financiar en gran parte su negocio y además por la ayuda que reciben también sus amigas y compañeras. Tiene 24 años de edad y está  casada pero en planes de divorcio, de esta relación tuvo tres hijos de 4- 1 año y un pequeño de solo un mes de nacido.
 
Se dedica a la venta de yogurt, ropa y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). La venta de yogurt la realiza todos los días en las mañanas y lo que es ropa y Yanbal cuatro días a la semana por las tardes. Sus productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, nos cuenta que ahora realizar su trabajo se le ha hecho mas difícil porque sus hijos están pequeños pero en su situación tiene que trabajar para no perder sus clientes, ya que si se divorcia le tocara a ella sola hacerse cargo de  sus hijos.

Este crédito es para pagar los pedidos de yogurt y parte de los productos de Yanbal. Su sueño  es ser una gran microempresaria.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Colon gathers every fifteen days in the parish of Colon in the City of Portoviejo, the manabita capital known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by many hills.  The majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture.

Señora Johana is a founding member of the Communal Bank and is very happy because thanks to these credits, she has been able to finance a substantial part of her business.  Also, her friends and colleagues have received help as well.  She is 24 years old and is married but is in the process of a divorce.  From this marriage, she has three children between the ages of 1-4 years old and a one-month old infant.

She sells yogurt, clothes, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women).  She sells yogurt every day in the morning and clothing and Yanbal four days a week in the afternoons.  She sells her products by credit and collects payments every fifteen days.  She tells us that working has become difficult because her children are small but she doesn't want to stop working and thus lose her clients since if she has a divorce, then she is responsible for caring for her children.

This credit will be used to pay the cost of ordering yogurt and a part of the Yanbal products.  Her dream is to become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: Purchase yogurt and beauty products.

loans.name: Lorena Del Rocio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon  que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros. En este lugar las personas se dedican a la agricultura en gran parte.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Lorena, tiene 42 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una linda jovencita de 14 años, la misma que estudia en el colegio y es quien vive con ella.

Ella tiene un negocio de cabinas telefónicas y  un comedor en su casa, trabaja todos los días en las cabinas telefónicas y en el restaurante solo los fines de semana, nos cuenta que lleva con el negocio de las cabinas cerca de 5 años y el comedor lo tiene por mas de diez años, dice que decidió vender comida por la necesidad  ya que quedo sola y no tenía a nadie que le diera para mantener a sus hijos que aun estaban pequeños, es así como saco a sus hijos adelante y fue progresado poco a poco.

Ahora con este crédito espera comprar mas productos para la preparación de los alimentos, así como también productos que vende en sus cabinas como jugos, sodas etc. Está en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Sus sueños es tener un gran restaurante y que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Colon gathers every fifteen days in the Parish of Colon in the City of Portoviejo, the manabita capital known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by many hills.  The great majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture.

Here we find Señora Lorena of 42 years old.  She is a single mother of three children, two of them adults and a young woman of 14 years old, whom studies and lives with her.

She has a telephone booth business and a cafeteria in her home.  She works every day at the telephone booths and only in the restaurant on the weekends.  She tells us that she has been running the telephone booth business for about five years and the cafeteria one for over ten years.  She decided to sell food out of economic necessity since she was left alone and couldn't rely on anyone's help to support her children, who were still very young at the time.  This was how she moved her children ahead and made progress little by little.

With this credit, she hopes to purchase more ingredients with which to prepare her dishes, along with products that she could sell in her telephone booth business, such as juices, sodas, etc.  She enjoys the Communal Bank and the ease of receiving credits.  Her dream is to have a great restaurant and see her daughter study a profession.

loans.use: Purchase supplies, sodas, juices, etc.

loans.name: Margarita Cupertina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon  que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros. En este lugar las personas se dedican a la agricultura en gran parte.

Para la señora Margarita este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que ofrece la institución. Tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de esta relación tiene siete hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven aun con ella. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Desde muy joven aprendió corte y confección y es a eso que se dedica, tiene un pequeño taller de costura en el que realiza una gran cantidad de obras. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 12pm y desde las 15 pm hasta la noche, dice que no trabaja todo el día porque tiene que atender a su esposo e hijos que se dedican al campo, pero en las noches a veces se queda hasta la madrugada cuando tiene bastante trabajo. Le encanta hacer vestidos de niñas. Sus obras las entrega en el Centro Comercial de Portoviejo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más telas y otros artículos que se utilizan en la costura. Su aspiración es tener un local en el centro en Portoviejo.
texts.en:
The Colón communal bank meets every two weeks in Colón parish in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the City of the Valley, because it’s surrounded by many hills.  People here are farmers for the most part.

This is Margarita’s fourth cycle in the communal bank.  She likes it because of the benefits the institution offers.  She is 55 years old, married and has seven adult children.  Three of them still live with her.  Her husband is a farmer.

She learned sewing and dressmaking while still very young and this is her occupation.  She has a small workshop where she makes a large number of items.  She works daily from 9am until noon and from 3pm until night.  She says that she doesn’t work all day because she has to care for her husband and children who work in the fields.  However, at night she sometimes works until dawn when she has a lot of work to do.  She loves making dresses for girls.  She delivers her completed items to Portoviejo’s Commercial Center.

This loan is to buy more fabric and other items used in sewing.  Her goal is to have a locale in downtown Portoviejo.

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon  que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros. En este lugar las personas se dedican a la agricultura en gran parte.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Rosa, ella tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tuvo dos hijos de 19 y 9 años, el mayor en el colegio y el pequeño en la escuela, el esposo trabaja como pre vendedor en la Coca Cola.

Ella es una gran ama de casa y para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia hace 4 años decidió poner un negocio de comida en sus casa en el que trabaja los fines de semana desde las 8am hasta las 19h00, ahora ha decidido también preparar comida de lunes a viernes  en una clínica que  va hacer inaugurada en Portoviejo, allí va a vender comida tanto para los médicos como para los pacientes que lleguen a ese lugar.

Es para eso que solicito este crédito, espera comprar algunas cosas que aún le faltan como: platos, cucharas, ollas, y otros artículos necesarios. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la forma de trabajar de la institución.
texts.en:
The Colon Communal Bank meets once every two weeks in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is the capital of Manabita, which is known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by so many hills.  The people there mostly work in agriculture.

That is where we meet Rosa.  She is 39 years old and married.  She has two children, ages 19 and 9.  The oldest is in high school, and the little one goes to elementary school.  Her husband works as a pre-seller for Coca Cola.

She is a great housewife.  In order to help her husband with the family expenses she decided four years ago to establish a food business in her house.  She works there on weekends from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She has now decided to also prepare food on Monday through Friday in a clinic, which will be opened in Portoviejo.  She will sell food there for the doctors as well as the patients who come to the clinic.

That is why she has requested a loan to buy some things that she still needs.  She will buy things like plates, spoons, pots, and other needed things.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank.  She likes the way the institution works.

loans.use: To buy plates, spoons, pots, and glasses

loans.name: Eufemia Rebeca

texts.es:
La Señora Eufemia M.  es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza natural, sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, su centro histórico que por su belleza fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es amable y hospitalaria.

La Señora. Eufemia tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene dos hijo de 34 y 28 años de edad,  sus hijos casados y viven independientes, su esposo es chofer profesional y se dedica a conducir un bus interprovincial, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Eufemia se dedica al comercio hace 5 años, vende todo tipo de ropa, su mayor clientela la tiene en la costa ecuatoriana a la que vieja todos los fines de semana.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su hermana quien es la presidenta del banco comunal, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir mas su negocio. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ms Eufemia M. is a member of the communal bank Loma de la Cruz. She lives in the sector of Totoracocha in the city of Cuenca, which is famed for its natural scenery – the city sits amidst four rivers – and its historic center which is listed as a World Cultural Heritage Site. Its people are friendly and hospitable.

Ms Eufemia is 54 years old, married and the mother of two children aged 34 and 28, who are married and live independently. Her husband is a professional driver and drives a bus on an interprovincial route. They don't have their own house, but live for rent.

Doña Eufemia has been a storekeeper for five years. She sells all kinds of clothes. Her main clientele lives on the coast of Ecuador where she travels every weekend.

This is her second loan with the communal bank. She was invited by her sister who is the president of the communal bank. She will use her loan to invest in clothes to stock up her inventory. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Henry Fabian

texts.es:
El Señor Henry M. es socio del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza natural, sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, su centro histórico que por su belleza fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es amable y hospitalaria.

Nuestro socio hace un mes está trabajando en unas minas de donde extraen oro, pero como es un trabajo muy peligroso va a continuar con su negocio. El es comerciante, vende ropa de todo tipo, ropa interior y colchas.  Esta actividad la realiza hace 3 años. Su mercadería la vende recorriendo en especial en la costa ecuatoriana.

Don Henry tiene 36 años, es soltero y tiene 3 hijos  de 15, 14 y 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos viven fuera del país, solo le pasa la pensión alimenticia a su hijo que se encuentra en el país y está estudiando en la escuela. No tiene una casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo que realiza los créditos en el banco comunal y esta muy contento de formar parte de este grupo de gente luchadora.  El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en un nuevo negocio que es en la venta de chuzos (carne en palitos). Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mr. Henry Macías is a member of the Loma de la Cruz (Hill of the Cross) communal bank.  He lives around the Feria Libre sector of Cuenca.  This city is known for its natural beauty, the four rivers that bathe it, its historic city center that was named Cultural Patrimony of Humanity and its kind and hospitable residents.

He has been working in a gold mine for a month but, because this is very dangerous work, he is going to continue with his business.  He is a merchant.  He sells all kinds of clothes, underwear and bedspreads.  He has been in this line of work for three years.  He sells the merchandise especially traveling along the Ecuadorean coast.

Henry is 36 years old, single and has three children who are 15, 14 and 10 years of age.  His two oldest children live abroad.  He sends a food stipend just to his son who is in the country and going to school.  He does not have a house of his own; he rents.

He is in his fourth cycle with the communal bank and is very happy to be part of this group of hard working people.  He will use the money from the loan to invest in a new business.  He will sell chuzos (grilled meat on skewers).  His dream is to own a house.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, potatoes, wooden meat skewers, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Pilar

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen T. es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por la parroquia del Sinincay en donde su gente se dedica a la cría animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población sale a la ciudad en donde desempeñan varias actividades, también han migrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de un mejor trabajo.

La Señora Carmen es muy joven con apenas 24 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad que esta estudiando en el pre kínder. Su esposo labora en una fabrica de joyas, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá pero independientes.
 
Doña Carmen se dedica a trabajar en una imprenta, actividad que la desempeña hace 7 años,  labora de ocho de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de lunes a viernes. También se dedica hace 3 años a vender ropa a sus familiares.
 
Se encuentra en su quinto crédito en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su mamá. Con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para la temporada navideña. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen T. is a member of the community bank Loma de la Cruz.  She lives in Sinincay parish where people are involved in livestock and agriculture.  Much of the population has left for the city where they have various activities, they have also emigrated to various parts of the world in search of a better job.

Señora Carmen is very young, she's only 24 and is married with a 4 year old child who attends pre-kindergarten.  Her husband works in a jewelry factory.  They don't have their own house so they live in her mom's house, but independently.

Doña Carmen is works in a printing business, where she has been for 7 years.  She works from 8 am until 6 pm, Monday through Friday.   She also has been working for 3 years selling clothes to their families.

This is her fifth loan in the community bank and was suggested by her mother. With her new loan she will invest in buying more clothes for the holiday season.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: Buying clothes.

loans.name: María Eva

texts.es:
La Señora María G. es socia del banco comunal Despertar, vive por el sector del Salado en la ciudad de Cuenca, conocida también como la Santa Ana de los cuatro Ríos, es una ciudad del centro sur del Ecuador, capital de la provincia del Azuay. Cuenta  con una gastronomía muy variada la que cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes y su gente es muy cordial y amable.

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 25, 22, 12 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y es quien ayuda en la economía del hogar, su segunda hija es casada y vive en su casa pero independiente, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica al comercio, tienen casa propia la misma que ha sido construida gracias al trabajo y esfuerzo conyugal.
 
Doña María se dedica a la atención de su gabinete de belleza en el cual viene laborando hace 17 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las once de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche. Aprendió este oficio estudiado en una academia durante tres años y ahora es toda una profesional.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue  invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa. El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como son los tintes, tijeras etc. Su meta es viajar hacia los Estados Unidos de Norte América.
texts.en:
Mrs. María G. is a member of the Despertar (To Awaken) communal bank.  She lives in Cuenca’s Salado sector.  Cuenca, also known as Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos, is a city in south-central Ecuador.  It’s the capital of Azuay province.  It has a very varied gastronomy which entices the visitor’s palate.  Its residents are very cordial and kind.

She is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 25, 22, 12 and 8 years of age.  Her oldest son works and contributes to the household’s economy.  Her second daughter is married and lives in her house but independently.  Her third son is in high school and her youngest goes to a local elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.  They own their own house which was built thanks to their work and effort as a couple.

María has had a beauty salon for 17 years.  She is open from Monday through Saturday from 11am until 8pm.  She leaned this craft studying at an academy for three years; now she is a complete professional.

She is in her second loan with the communal bank.  She was invited by a friend who is an active member.

The money from the loan will be used to buy beauty supplies such as: dyes and scissors, etc.  Her goal is to travel to the United States of America.

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Mayra Yalila

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra F. es socia del banco comunal Despertar, vive por la ciudadela de los Chóferes en la ciudad de Cuenca, conocida también como la Santa Ana de los cuatro Ríos, es una ciudad del centro sur de Ecuador, capital de la provincia del Azuay. Cuenta con una gastronomía muy variada la que cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes y su gente es muy cordial y amable.

La señora Mayra es comerciante y labora junto a su esposo, esta actividad la viene realizando hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos como son queso y yogurt, su producto los vende recorriendo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de lunes a sábados.
 
Doña Mayra tiene 30 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 8 y 1 año de edad,  su primer hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.

Es socia de ESPOIR hace 3 años y todos los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más producto lácteo para su negocio. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mayra F. is a member of the Despertar (Wake Up) communal bank.  She lives in the Chóferes neighborhood in the city of Cuenca, also known as Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos.  It is a city in south central Ecuador and is the capitol of Azuay Province.  It boasts an extremely varied cuisine which captivates the palates of its visitors, and the people are very warm and friendly.

Mayra is a businesswoman who works with her husband, and she has been doing this job for three years.  She sells dairy products like cheese and yogurt.  She makes traveling sales Mondays through Saturdays from 9 in the morning until 6 in the evening.
 
Mayra is 30 years old.  She is married and has two children, ages 8 and 1.  Her first son attends a school in the city.  She does not have her own house, so she lives in a relative's house.

Mayra has been a member of ESPOIR for three years, and all the loans have benefited her business.  She will invest the new loan in purchasing more dairy products for her business.  Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: Buy cheese and yogurt

loans.name: Fátima Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora.
