Fátima T. es socia del banco comunal Despertar, vive por la parroquia de Baños en la ciudad de Cuenca, conocida también como la Santa Ana de los cuatro Ríos, es una ciudad del centro sur de Ecuador, capital de la provincia del Azuay. Cuenta  con una gastronomía muy variada la que cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes y su gente es muy cordial y amable.

La Señora. Fátima se encuentra de 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad que estudian en una escuela de la localidad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico automotriz, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Fátima en la mañana se dedica a laborar en cabinas telefónicas desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 12 del medio día, de lunes a sábados, el resto de su tiempo se dedica a la atención de la tienda la que tiene en su casa hace 2 años y labora en ella de domingo a domingo.

Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su tienda. Su meta es  crecer mucho más en su tienda.
texts.en:
Fátima T. is a member of the ‘Despertar’ (‘Awaken’) communal bank. She lives in the Baños parish, which is also known as Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos, in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is located in the south central area of Equador, and it is the capital of the Azuay province. Cuenca offers a varied gastronomy which captures the palate of its visitors, and the people of Cuenca are very kind and hospitable. 

Fátima is 28 years of age, married and has two children of 9 and 7 years of age who study in a local school. Her husband is an auto-repair mechanic.

Fátima works in a phone centre from 7 in the morning until midday, Mondays to Saturdays. The rest of the time she works in a store that she has run from her own house for two years. She works there 7 days a week.

This is the first loan that Fatima has taken out with the community bank, after being invited by her sister to form part of this group of enterprising women. She will use the money from this loan to purchase more products for her store. Her goal is to increase business in her store.

loans.use: Purchase groceries including rice, sugar, oil and eggs.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Rosenda M. is 55 years old, married and supports her family by operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She lives in Crossing, Barangay Bunga, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,200 PHP. Rosenda is now borrowing 25,000 PHP so that she could fund her business operations. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rosenda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Fund her business operations

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Tsevelmaa J. is 57 years old and lives with her 24 year old daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her daughter is handicapped and receives a disability pension of 53,800 MNT per month.

Tsevelmaa operates a meat trading business in her town. She sells a variety of meats to her customers at a rented stall in the local market. Tsevelmaa started her business in 2000 after retiring from her career at a construction company. Her business currently operates at a stable level and she continues to make progress.

She hopes to grow her business in the future and her continued success is very important as she must support her daughter, who is disabled. Tsevelmaa is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat at a wholesale price.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalinda T. is from the Barangay of Pangabuan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, married to Cristito T. and blessed with 2 children, one of whom is now working abroad and the other one is now in school. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a dress shop as a seamstress. She is also receiving support from her husband as her partner in the business and also the tailor man. They’re been engaged in this kind of dress shop business for 10 years. They’re earning an average amount of not less than PHP 10,000.00 from the business. 

In 2007, Rosalinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program and has successfully repaid a loan amount of PHP 10,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000.00 as her 6th loan which will be used for additional capital for their dress shop business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children's education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for their dress shop business.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Mrs. Belen M. is from Barangay of Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.  She is 38 years old, married to Danilo M. and blessed with 4 children all of are now school age.  To make a living, she presently manages an electronic repair shop business. She is also receiving support from the salary of her husband as an overseas seaman.  She’s been engaged in this kind of electronic repair shop business for 2 years already.  She is earning an average amount of not less than PHP 1,500.00 from the business. 

Just this year, Belen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belen as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program and is now requesting a loan of PHP 50,000.00 as her 1st loan which will be used for the payment of the tuition fees for her children and the remaining amount for pocket money for her husband who is back working abroad.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Payment for tuition fees and pocket money for her husband for going back abroad to work.

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en: Uyanga B. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her husband operates a transportation service using his own car and in summer months, he trains a racehorse. Her two children attend a local school. The family moved to their current town in 2001 after working and living as a herder in the countryside between 1995 and 2000. Uyanga graduated from a hairdresser training course in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. Since 2002, she has been working as a hairdresser. She is a friendly and open-minded woman. In the future, she plans to purchase the necessary and latest tools and equipment for her hair salon and provide good service for her customer in a comfortable environment. Uyanga says, "I want to save my business earnings and buy a new house and fence for my family." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase tools and equipment for her barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa A. is from the village of Bangkal, Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Adelfa owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Adelfa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In July 2009, Adelfa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Adelfa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Adelfa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Jeogelyn Calinga Group

texts.en:
Jeogelyn C. is from the village of Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Jeogelyn is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jeogelyn C.’s Group.

To make a living, Jeogelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. Jeogelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In April 2010, Jeogelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeogelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Jeogelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Jeogelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

location.town: Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City Misamis Occidental

To make a living, Lourgen owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lourgen has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Lourgen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,995 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lourgen is requesting a new loan of 14,995 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lourgen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou E. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Sta. Rosa, Poblacion, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: candle-making and a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband, Miguel E., who is 51 years old, works as a Quality Control Supervisor to earn his living. They have five children who are between 16 and 24 years old. Two of the children have their own families, one has work and two are still going to school. Marilou joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilou has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase  raw materials so that she can continue to save up for the future, improve her business and help the needs of their family. Marilou E. is a Dungganon who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Phai's Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people are forming a village loA.. Mrs. Phai M., 56, was selected as the village bank president by its members. They are living in Veal Thum village in Kandal province. The members of this village will use the loA. for different purposes. 

Mrs. Phai M. is a tailor at home who is able to earn good profits to support the family. Mrs. Phai M. is a widow and works hard to support her child, a student in the university, but she does not have enough money to pay for the school's fees. Thus, she would like to ask for a loA. to add to her savings so she cA. pay for her child's school fees.

loans.use: To add to her savings to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza E. is from the village of Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old. Esperanza is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Esperanza owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Esperanza has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esperanza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esperanza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Esperanza is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Esperanza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha P. is a married woman who lives in Pob. Latid, Pinamungajan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store business. Her husband, Roberto P., who is 50 years old, works as a fisherman/driver to earn his living. They have eight children who are between 4 and 26 years old. Three of her children already have a family, two have work and one is currently going to school. Editha joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Editha has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,800, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock and a motorized boat so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education. Editha P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Pag-asa, Brgy. Port Barton, San Vicente, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  buy & sell (rice, darak & charcoal) and  businesses. Her husband Arvin C., who is 34 years old, works as a businessman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 10 months and 13 years old. Four of the children are currently going to school. Lorelie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lorelie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 26,500, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her  children.  Lorelie C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina B. is from the village of Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 45 years old. Adelina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Adelina owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Adelina has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Adelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita S. is 53 years old, married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: buying and selling sea cucumbers and lobster and a general store. She lives in Prk. Pag-asa, Brgy. Port Barton, San Vicente, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She currently earns an average monthly income of 18000 PHP. Zita is now borrowing 24000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Zita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ever Lesmy

texts.es:
Ever es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo de un año en la Campiña Chumpon de distrito de Paiján, una zona situada en la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar labores de transporte)el brinda su servicio en el distrito de Paiján y sus caseríos y gracias a esta actividad puede percibir ingresos estables, los cuales invierte en su sostenimiento. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola en los campos agrícolas de la zona.

Ever desea realizar algunas labores de mantenimiento a su vehículo de modo que pueda brindar un servicio de calidad ya que el continuo uso y el mal estado de los caminos ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Ever es una personas bastante responsable y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Ever is a 32 year-old father who lives together with his wife and one-year-old child in Camiña Chumpon, Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than five years he has been providing a passenger and freight transport service in his mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with a carriage on the back that is used to transport people or goods).  He works in the villages of Paiján district and, thanks to this business activity, he is able to have a stable income.  He also works as an agricultural laborer in the area's fields.

Ever would like to carry out some maintenance work on his vehicle so that he can provide a quality service since his continual use of his vehicle and the bad state of repair of the roads have meant that his vehicle has started to suffer some mechanical failures.  To achieve his goal he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles.

Ever is quite a responsible person who has a great desire to be get ahead.  The people who know him hold him in very high regard and consider him to be a trustworthy man.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance expenses for his mototaxi

loans.name: Graciela Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old.  She lives with her partner and their two children.  They live in Pimentel.  It is a costal city in northern Peru about thirty minutes outside the major city of Chiclayo.  Most people in her town are fisherman, commercial workers or raise animals.

For the last two years Maria has run a small general store out of her home.  She sells basic items such as soap, hygienic supplies, dry foods, candy and beverages.  She is proud to be able to serve her community and increase their access to such items.  Her partner sells emoliente (a traditional beverage which contains honey and a type of syrup) and other drinks in the market in Pimtentel.  Her partner also drives a mototaxi on a daily basis, providing transportation to local employees, entrepreneurs and other individuals.

This will be Maria’s first loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the loan in order to increase her inventory. She hopes such an action will enable her to better meet her clients’ demands and expand her market share.  She hopes to be able to improve her family’s income level and standard of living.  She dreams of putting both her children through school and university.

loans.use: Expand her inventory

loans.name: Choem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Choem R. is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in Veal Thum Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. R. was selected as the Village Bank President by its thirteen members. The village members will use their portions of the loan to support their different businesses. 

Mrs. Choem R. and her husband, Mr. Huon Neang, are farmers who own 1.15 hectares of land.  The couple does not have any children. They use this land to grow rice and different vegetables for a living. In addition to working as a farmer, Mr. Huon Neang is also fisherman.  In order to support her husband's fishing business, Mrs. Choem R. would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing supplies.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is 48-years old, married and supports her family by operating a pig-fattening business.  She lives in Punta Balidbid, Brgy. Balidbid, Sta. Fe, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig-fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She currently earns an average monthly income of 11000 PHP. Lolita is now borrowing 15000 PHP to use as additional working capital.  This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lolita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is 29 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents and other family members.  Their home is in Eten.  It is a smaller community on the coast outside the city of Chiclayo.  Most of the residents are fisherman, commercial dealers or raise animals.

For two years now, Veronika has managed a small general store.  She sells a wide variety of products including detergent, vegetables, candy, beverages, hygienic products, and many other items.  She enjoys her role in providing for her community and increasing their access to products to meet their basic needs.  She finds that every day she is increasing her clientele and she would like to expand her market share.

This will be her first loan with Edpyme Alternative.  She plans to use the funds to increase her inventory and provide better service to her clients.  She hopes such an action will increase her profile in the neighborhood and make her existing clientele more loyal.  It is her dream to expand her business and be able to better provide for her children.  She is proud to have her own income source and to be able to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una madre D. familia D. 58 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Macuaco del distrito agrícola D. Oyotún, una zona situada a casi dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace más D. diez años a la crianza y venta D. animales menores. Ella cría aniomales menores en su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. vive. Los ingresos que percibe D. esta actiovidad le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economia familiar.

Teresa desea mejorar su negocio adquiriendo más animales y alimento balanceado D. modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mejores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles.

Teresa es una mujer con muchas ganas D. progresar y salir adelante, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Teresa is 58 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Macuaco neighborhood in the agricultural district of Oyotún, an area located about two hours from the city of Chiclayo.  

For more than 10 years, she has raised and sold small animals.  She raises small animals in her home and when they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to merchants who visit the area where she lives.  The income she makes from this activity helps her husband with the family finances.

Teresa would like to improve her business by acquiring more animals and balanced feed for them so that she can increase her sales and make a larger profit.  She has asked for a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative to do so.

Teresa is a woman eager to make progress and get ahead.  Her dream is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Segunda Margarita

texts.en:
Segunda is thirty years old. She lives in the city of Eten, which is a small community outside of the city of Chiclayo. It is primarily populated by fishermen, small business persons, and individuals who raise animals. Segunda shares her home with her partner and their two small children. Her family owns the home in which they live.

For the last four years now, Segunda has managed a small general store. She sells various products out of the front of her home including soap, dry foods, vegetables, beverages, candy, and other items. She has a good number of loyal clients and constant demand. Her husband is a construction and industrial arts teacher in the area. Between these activities the family manages to earn a relatively stable income.

The loan is destined for investment in additional inventory for Segunda’s general store. She hopes to be able to increase her market share, her sales, and  her family’s income.  She believes that education and income are significantly important for success and she is working hard to instill good values in her children. This will be her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Flor María tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija dependiente. Reside en casa de sus padres, la cual se encuentra ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Nueva Arica, una zona situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de diez años a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella cría animales menores en su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para mantener a su hija y ayudar a sus padres con la economía familiar.

Flor María desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales, para lo cual ha creído conveniente adquirir mas animales y alimento balanceado con los cuales desea incrementar su nivel de ventas y por ende sus ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Flor es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien confiable y responsable.
texts.en:
Flor María is 33 years old, single, and has a young daughter.  She lives in her parent's house, which is located in the agricultural district of Nueva Arica, an area located about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than ten years, she has raised and sold small animals.  She raises the animals in her home and when they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the merchants who visit the area where she lives.  The income she earns from this work helps her support her daughter and help her family with living expenses.  

Flor María would like to expand her business of raising and selling animals by purchasing more animals and balanced feed in order to increase her sales and her profits.  She is asking for a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Flor is a woman who is eager to get ahead in life.  People who know her consider her to be responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: Purchase animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes A. is a widow who lives in Alice Beach, Brgy. Ocoy, Sta. fe, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a dried fish business. She has 6 children who are between 18 and 29 years old; 4 of them have family and 2 are currently working and helping her. 

Lourdes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lourdes has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 12000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing 15000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more raw materials so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Lourdes A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for dried fish

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios D. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 48 years old. Remedios is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Remedios owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Remedios joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35000 PHP from ASKI. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Remedios from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is thirty-one years old.  She is separated from her partner and she lives along with family members in the city of Reque, which is to the south of the city of Chiclayo and serves as an intermediary market for fish and other items.  She lives in a more rural part of the town, but her home has electricity and water.  She has one four year old son to whom she is very dedicated.

Celia owns a small herd of cows from which she harvests milk.  She sells the fresh milk to her neighbors and in local markets.  The milk either meets the basic needs of the population or goes to the larger milk dealers in order to be processed into other products.  She is proud to be able to play an important role in earning income for her family.

This will be Celia's first experience with a financial institution.  She has never taken out a loan before.  She plans to use the funds in order to purchase female pigs.  She hopes to be able to expand her business and better provide for her family.  She also hopes to be able to reduce her risk by diversifying her business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es:
Agapito tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Espinal del distrito de Oyotún , una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada a casi dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde que era joven actualmente posee una pequeña parcela agrícola en donde suele sembrar diversos granos y cereales. En esta campañara ha instalado arroz y espera obtener una buena cosecha para garantizar el sustento a su familia. Por ello se esta esforzando para lograr su meta.

Actualmente desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes que le permitan lograr que su cultivo se desarrolle de mejor modo. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Agapito es una persona que conoce muy bien su negocio y que siempre se ha valido de el para sacar adelante a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen bastante aprecio y estima.
texts.en:
Agapito is 53 years old.  He is married and lives together with his wife and children in the village of Espinal in Oyotún district, a farming region which is almost two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Agapito has been doing agricultural work since he was a young boy.  He currently owns a small plot of land where he sows different grains and cereals.  This season he has planted rice and hopes to obtain a good harvest to support his family.  For this reason he is working hard to achieve his goal.

Currently he would like to acquire some fertilizers which will allow his crops to develop as well as possible.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles.

Agapito is a person who knows his business very well and who has always used his business to get his family ahead.  People who know him have a lot of respect for him and think very highly of him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to maintain his rice crop

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas is 35 years old.  He lives with his partner and their two children near the town of Reque, which is about 20 minutes south of the city of Chiclayo.  Reque is a small commercial town that serves as an intermediary between coastal areas and the city.  Nicolas lives in a rural area that is primarily populated by individuals who raise animals.

For a number of years, Nicolas has managed his own farming operations.  He has extensive experience in farming and is quite skilled.  Most recently he has planted corn in fields near his home.  He dreams of one day owning his own fields instead of renting.  He is proud to be able to provide for his family through his own labor and initiative.

The requested loan will be invested in additional products to support the proper growth of his crops and maximize their yield.  He hopes to be able to increase his income in the next few seasons in order to purchase his own land.  He hopes to be able to build a small business that his children can take over and run as their own once he is old.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.en:
Irma is forty years old.  She lives along with her partner and their four children, who all attend elementary school.  The family lives in the village of El Clacke which is near Reque, approximately twenty minutes south of the city of Chiclayo.  The family is well respected in the area as hard-working and kind.

Irma raises animals in the yard behind their home.  She raises pigs, cows, and various fowl, including ducks, chickens and turkeys.  She has been raising these animals for some times and appreciates the opportunity to provide for her family.  The animals help to supplement the family's income, given that her husband is a field hand who works during times of harvest and tends to the fields.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional feed for her animals and to expand her herd.  She hopes to be able to decrease her family’s risk and to increase her family’s income.  She is an extremely  hard-working woman with grand plans for her business and the success of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and animals

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zolia es una madre de familia que tiene 64 años de edad y que reside junto a su esposo en el caserío Macuaco del distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada a casi dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace muchos años en labores agrícolas. Ella suele ayudar a su esposo y juntos han sembrado y cosechado diversos productos como por ejemplo arroz y maíz. En esta oportunidad han sembrado arroz y se encuentran trabajando para lograr obtener una buena cosecha. Zoila desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes para asegurar que el suelo tenga los nutrientes que su cultivo necesita, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Zoila desea seguir creciendo como empresaria junto a su esposo, ella se siente activa trabajando y piensa seguir haciéndolo mientras tenga la salud y fuerza necesarias.
texts.en:
Zoila is 64 years old and lives with her husband in the village of Macuaco in the Oyotún district, an agricultural area located about two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has worked for many years as a farmer.  She and her husband work together to plant and harvest different crops, such as corn and rice.  They currently have planted rice, and they are working hard to have a good harvest.  Zoila wants to purchase fertilizer to be sure that the soil has all of the necessary nutrients to support a good rice crop.  She has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Zoila wants to continue growing her business with her husband.  She feels active when she works, and wants to continue working while she has the necessary health and strength.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for a rice crop

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old.  She lives with her partner and their three children in the village of San Pablo Pomalca in the district of Pomalca, a small rural region near the city of Chiclayo.  Her children are 17, 12 and 10 years old.

For several years, Maria has run a small general store out of her home.  She sells a wide range of products including dry foods, personal products, candy, vegetables, beverages and other items.  In addition, she sells carrots two days a week in the local market, the Mercado Los Patos.  Her husband works as a farmhand for local farms and production facilities.

Maria plans to use the loan to expand her inventory at both the general store and the carrot stand.  This will be her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa and her first experience with a financial institution.  She appreciates the access to credit in order to expand her business and improve her family’s income.  She dreams of providing her children with education from primary school and secondary school through college.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is sixty-five years old.  He lives with his wife in the village of El Clacke, which is near the city of Reque, twenty minutes to the south of the city of Chiclayo.  All of their children are adults and live outside of the home.  It is a rural region with small farmers and people who raise animals.  Juan and his wife have lived in the area for over twenty-five years.

The couple raises animals.  Juan primarily raises cattle which from which he harvests milk, and his wife raises fowl which she sells for their meat.  The two are happy to be able to provide for their needs as well as to provide good examples to their children as independent workers.  They hope to be able to retire on their business and in the future provide small inheritances to their children.

The loans will be used to expand their herds and purchase additional feed for their animals.  They hope to be able to increase their herds before the holiday season in order to take advantage of the higher prices during that time.  They also hope to improve their standard of living and better serve their community.

loans.use: Purchase additional feed for the animals and expand his herd

loans.name: Marinel

texts.en:
Marinel N. is 40 years old and married. She helps support her family by operating a direct selling business as a Natasha Dealer.  She lives in Madasigon, Barangay Balidbid, Santa Fe, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $163. 

Marinel is now borrowing 15,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marinel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
Raymundo es un padre de familia de 65 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola que se ubica en a casi dos horas de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde que era muy joven, actualmente el cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar granos y cereales. En esta oportunidad ha instalado el cultivo de arroz y con mucho esfuerzo espera obtener una buena cosecha. El desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y lograr su objetivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Raymundo es un padre honrado y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima, confianza y respeto.
texts.en:
Raymundo is 65 years old, the father of a family, and resides with his wife and children in the district of Oyotun, an agricultural zone located almost 2 hours by highway from the city of Chiclayo.

He has dedicated himself to agricultural work since he was very young.  At present, Raymundo has a small parcel of cultivable land where he sows grains and cereals.  Currently, he has planted rice, and with great effort he hopes to obtain a good harvest.  

Raymundo wants to buy fertilizer to maintain his crop and reach his objective. For that reason, he thought it convenient to approach Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new sols.

Raymundo is an honored father who always does his best to advance his family.  People who know him have much esteem, respect, and confidence in him.

loans.use: TO BUY FERTILIZER TO MAINTAIN HIS RICE CROP

loans.name: Angelica Faustina

texts.es:
Angélica es una madre de familia de  38 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector La Clake, una zona rural que tiene como principales actividades a la agricultura y la crianza de animales, pertenece al distrito de Reque, una zona situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Angélica tiene una pequeña bodega en donde vende todo tipo de abarrotes y gaseosas, sus ventas los realiza a diario y sus principales clientes son los pobladores de la zona, tiene varios años de experiencia en este rubro, y debido a la calidad de productos que ofrece y al buen trato que brinda cuenta con una clientela fiel. Además se dedica a la crianza de cuyes los cuales los vende tanto vivos como sacrificados.  

Angélica desea ampliar su bodega y aumentar sus ventas para percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Angelica is a 38-year-old mother  who lives with her husband and children in La Clake, a rural area whose main business activities are farming and rearing animals. La Clake is in the district of Reque, which is twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

Angelica has a small store where she sells all kinds of groceries and sodas. She sells her products every day and her main customers are local residents. She has several years' experience in this field, and due to the quality of her products and the way she treats her customers, she has a loyal clientele. She also works at breeding guinea pigs, which she sells either alive or slaughtered. 

Angelica wants to expand her store and increase sales to realize greater profits. Therefore, she has seen fit to request a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Kiva Field Partner, Edpyme Alternativa. 

She is a responsible woman who is devoted to her family. People who know her regard her as both responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy basic items and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila C. is from the village of Barangay Mangayan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Prescila is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Prescila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. 

Prescila is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Benjamín tiene 37 años de edad es separado, tiene dos hijos de cinco y ocho años de edad, reside en el caserío La Clake, una zona rural que se dedica pricipalmente a la agricultura y a la crianza y venta de animales, pertecece al distrito de Reque y se encuentra ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace quince años, el trabaja como peón agrícola en los campos de cultivo de la zona y con esta actividad se encarga de solventar sus gastos y mantener a sus hijos. El desea incrementar su nivel de ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos, por ello ha decidido incursionar en el negocio de crianza y comercializacion de ganado vacuno, para ello desea comprar una ternera que piensa engorndar y luego aparear con otros toros de raza para vender sus crias vivas o sacrificadas, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera ves a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener un futuro sólido.
texts.en:
Benjamín is 37 years old.  He is separated and has two children aged five and eight.  He lives in La Clake village, a rural area whose inhabitants work mainly in farming and raising and selling animals.  The village is in Reque district and is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Benjamín has been doing agricultural work since he was fifteen years old.  He works as an agricultural laborer in the area's fields and, through this activity, he manages to cover his expenses and support his children.  He would like to increase his level of income to improve his quality of life and that of his children.  For this reason, he has decided to set himself up in the business of raising and selling cattle.  He would like to buy a heifer so that he can fatten it up and then mate it with other thoroughbred bulls in order to later sell the resulting calves either alive or as meat.  To achieve his goal he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 nuevos soles.

He is a person with a great desire to get ahead and make progress.  His biggest wish is to continue growing as a businessman and to provide his children with the opportunity to have a solid future.

loans.use: To buy a heifer to break into the cattle breeding business

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia G. is a married woman who lives in Purok Croton's A, Barangay Old Sagay, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  fishing, fish vending and a RTW (ready to wear) business as a direct selling Natasha dealer. Her husband, Jesus G. Jr., who is 50 years old, works both as a fisherman and as a carpenter to earn his living. They have four children who are between 5 and 19 years old. 

Amelia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amelia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $208, raising the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase a motorized fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Amelia G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Marilou's Group

texts.en:
Marilou S. is from the village of Marabulig, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 55 years old. Marilou is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marilou is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activiies.

In 2006, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 36000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Marilou is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

texts.en:
As fish is the main fresh food to everyone in Mrs. Fall S. F. family, they depend on fishing and fish selling. Her main income depends on selling fish at the local market. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or that she buys from her wholesale supplier. Mrs. Fall S. F. is a humble mother who has been blessed with six children, five of whom are single, and the other one is married. 

Mrs. Fall S. F. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time when engaging in her business activities. As a result of the increasing needs of her clients, Mrs. Fall S. F. is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn H., 50, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Long, 53, live in a small village along National road number three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1979 and have six children - two sons and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, two have full-time employment and two attend school.

Chanthorn sells groceries from home. She also operates a business renting a space in her house to a garment factory worker. Her husband is a teacher. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase additional grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mr. Chantha S., 24, is single and lives with his father, brothers and sister on an island in the Mekong river about 15 km from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Chantha is a weaver. He is asking for a loan of $500 to provide capital to his father’s farming business.

loans.use: To provide capital to his father’s farming business.

loans.name: Sunnara

texts.en:
Mr. Sunnara C. (pictured above) and his wife, Mrs. Pov Kim, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2006 and have a young son. 

Sunnara is a construction worker. His wife is a garment factory worker. He has previously had a loan from Kiva and is now asking for his second loan of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Ey

texts.en:
Mrs. Ey C., 41, and her husband Mr. Sorn San,  59, live on an island in the Mekong river about 15 km from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1985 and have four children - two sons and two daughters. Two of their children have full-time employment and two are in school.

Ey and her husband are rice farmers. Besides farming, her husband is also a fisherman. Ey is asking for her first loan of $150 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide for growing rice.

loans.name: Beun

texts.en:
Mrs. Beun T., 41, and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Chea, 40, live on an island in the Mekong river about 15 km from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 2006 and have a 7 year old son.   

Beun has been a weaver for more than ten years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a security guard. Beun is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.
